name: Surgery
objective: change your appearance
first_tasks: give 1,000 gold to the flesh sculptor for her services

reward.description: a new appearance

tools: NONE
description:
Are you interested in my services? I warn you, my skills do not come cheaply.
Hmm, I suppose I can work with your face. After all, the sculptor cannot always choose the finest clay.
Shall I remake your face?  It is no small thing to submit yourself to the flesh sculptor's knife. Just give me 1,000 gold and tell me what you desire - beauty or hideous deformity, nothing is beyond my skill.

name: Protecting the Bloodline
objective: destroy a vampire before it turns its bandit allies into vampires
first_tasks: kill the vampire bandit
tools: NONE
description:
A feral-blooded has holed up with a group of bandits. Likely wants to create a nest of broodlings.
We don't need competition for blood, and we don't want the mortals getting up in arms making things difficult for us. Go destroy the feral beast before this becomes a problem.

name: Unseen Visions
objective: read "Blood"
first_tasks: perform the ritual of the Ancestor Moth to gain the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls

first_task_locations.description: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest

reward.description: the answers the player seeks

items.name: "Blood"
items.description: an Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.description: mysterious scrolls which are fragments of creation from outside time and space

groups.name: Ancestor Moths
groups.description: moths that provide the player with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls

tools: the ritual of the Ancestor Moth: the player must remove the bark from a canticle tree with a draw knife to attract Ancestor Moths to them
description:
Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest.
Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek. It involves carefully removing the bark from a Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you.
In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife. Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it... you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls. From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.

name: Prophet
objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
first_tasks: ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

locations.name: Cyrodiil
locations.description: a province half a continent away from the player and Serana

tools: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls
description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.

name: Rescue
objective: rescue Farkas from a group of necromancers
first_tasks: kill the vampire leading the group of necromancers

reward.description: an enchanted item

characters.name: Farkas
characters.description: a man, and the player's friend

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: NONE
description:
Arkay has some grave news, friend. Your friend, Farkas, kidnapped! A vicious night stalker rules over a group of necromancers - seeks to gain leverage over the righteous.
Arkay's never clear on life and death. Is he still alive? There's always hope... Go to Morvunskar, kill the vampire, and try to save Farkas.

name: Prophet of the Night
objective: locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon
first_tasks: speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers and travelers about the rumors of a Moth Priest in Skyrim

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

characters.name: Moth Priest
characters.description: a priest who has dedicated his whole life to reading and deciphering Elder Scrolls

tools: Lord Harkon is giving a speech to the player and their fellow vampires: the player and the other vampires will dominate over the sun itself, and forge a realm of eternal darkness
Lord Harkon has reclaimed one of his Elder Scrolls and needs a Moth Priest to read it
description:
Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit.
Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!

name: A Precious Horse
objective: save Arvak from Soul Cairn
first_tasks: find Arvak

first_task_locations.name: Soul Cairn
first_task_locations.description: a terrible dimension where souls are trapped for an eternity

reward.description: the player will learn how to call Arvak to them

characters.name: Arvak
characters.description: a male horse, belongs to the soul

tools: NONE
description:
You must help me find my Arvak. He doesn't deserve to be in a place like this!
Arvak is my horse. We came to this horrible place together. We were attacked by monsters, so I told him to run.
Please, he's such a loyal creature, and he's been running for so long. You have to save him! A place like this will change you...
If you find him, I'll teach you how to call him to you. I'm sure he'd be much happier someplace sunnier.

name: Preemptive Strike
objective: destroy a vampire before it turns its bandit allies into vampires
first_tasks: find the vampire
tools: NONE
description:
I've found another beast hiding from the light of day.
We need to destroy him before he turns his comrades into a brood of vampires. He's holed up in Treva's Watch with a group of a bandits.

name: New Allegiances
objective: turn Valindor into a vampire, and return to Vingalmo
first_tasks: use vampiric seduction on Valindor, embrace him and bite him on the neck

quest_giver.name: Vingalmo
quest_giver.description: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

characters.name: Valindor
characters.description: a knowledgeable man

tools: NONE
description:
I've found a new candidate, ripe for the Gift. I'm sending you to welcome this soul into our family.
Valindor of Riften has his ears in places that we'd love to listening in. Joining our family should increase our possibilities in the south.
Put his mind to rest, allay his fear through vampiric seduction and when he is in a pliant condition, embrace him and bite him on the neck.
When you offer the embrace, do so away from prying eyes. Our new sibling will then likely require rest while his blood undergoes the change. Return to me when your part is done.

name: Lost Relic
objective: retrieve the Dawnguard Shield for yourself
first_tasks: kill the Falmer preventing you from getting the Dawnguard Shield

quest_giver.name: Florentius Baenius
quest_giver.description: a follower of Arkay and a fellow Dawnguard member

reward.name: Dawnguard Shield
reward.description: a relic of the Dawnguard of old, a magical shield that when blocked with surrounds its wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: NONE
description:
I've been pouring over some of the tomes left here in the keep. Interesting stories, indeed. Seems the previous incarnation of the Dawnguard had, at one time, some interesting toys.
I have located one of their toys. Arkay and I think it could be a great advantage for us. You should look into retrieving it. It is a magical shield that when blocked with, surrounds its wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead. Might come in handy.
You'll be up against the Falmer of Sightless Pit, if I understand Arkay correctly. Nothing you can't handle.

name: A New Order
objective: recruit Isran's old allies for the Dawnguard
first_tasks: find Sorine Jurard and Gunmar, and recruit them for the Dawnguard

quest_giver.name: Isran
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

reward.description: Sorine Jurard and Gunmar as allies

characters.name: Sorine Jurard
characters.description: a smart Breton girl, who is good with tinkering and fascinated with the Dwemer and their weapons
characters.location: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

characters.name: Gunmar
characters.description: a big, brutish Nord man, who trains animals, especially trolls

tools: the Dawnguard is fighting against powerful vampires, who have an Elder Scroll
description:
We're up against powerful vampires, unlike anything we've seen before. And they have an Elder Scroll.
There are people I've met and worked with over the years. We need their skills, their talents, if we're going to survive this.
I think we'll want Sorine Jurard. Breton girl, whip-smart and good with tinkering. Fascination with the Dwemer. Weapons in particular. Last I knew, she was out in the Reach, convinced she was about to find the biggest dwarven ruins yet. You'll also want to find Gunmar. Big brute of a Nord, hates vampires almost as much as I do. Got it into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear.
If you can find them, we might have a chance.

name: A Jarl's Justice
objective: kill a vampire masquerading as a visiting advisor in Brunwulf Free-Winter's court
first_tasks: convince Brunwulf Free-Winter that the visiting advisor is a threat to him

quest_giver.name: Isran
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

characters.name: Brunwulf Free-Winter
characters.description: a Jarl holding his court in Windhelm

tools: Brunwulf Free-Winter's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against the visiting advisor as a crime
description:
Jarl Brunwulf Free-Winter is in danger. A vampire plays as a visiting "advisor" to the court of Windhelm. Destroy it before it's able to complete its foul business.
But be warned. The Jarl's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against this "advisor" as a crime. Convince the Jarl of the threat and he'll let you destroy the creature. If not, then do your best not to get caught.
Quickly now! The longer you delay, the more danger the Jarl is in.

name: Lost to the Ages
objective: search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
first_tasks: find Katria's journal, which contains her notes about the Aetherium Forge

items.name: "The Aetherium Wars"
items.description: a book written by Katria's male apprentice, contains Katria's research on the Aetherium Forge

tools: the player read "The Aetherium Wars"
description:
The name's Katria. I am - was - an adventurer. Raided ruins like this for nigh on twenty years. I was on the trail of something big. It led me here, and... I didn't make it.
Oh. You read the book, didn't you? "The Aetherium Wars"? It was my theory, you know. My research. My life's work. All of it, lost! Stolen by my own damn apprentice! That's how I ended up here. I can't rest. Not until I find the Aetherium Forge, until I can prove that it was my discovery. Mine, not his!
Hmm... well, you can pick up where I left off. My notes should still be in my journal, if you can read it. We still have to find the Forge itself. I had a lead on that, too.

name: Impatience of a Saint
objective: help Jiub find the first volume of his opus
first_tasks: collect the ten missing pages of Jiub's opus

quest_giver.name: Jiub the Eradicator, Saint Jiub, Jiub
quest_giver.description: a ghost of a man who wants people to know of his achievements in life

tools: NONE
description:
I am Jiub. Some call me Saint Jiub. Others call me Jiub the Eradicator. Perhaps you've heard of me?
If you haven't, I can't say that I am surprised. Until I get my second volume published, no one will ever know of my achievements. In order to write the second volume of my opus, I need the notes from my first volume. Otherwise I need to do all of this from memory.
When I was tossed in here I felt myself falling… and I dropped the pages I had been holding. There were ten of them in all.
Find them for me, please, I beg you!

name: Hunting the Monster
objective: destroy a vampire
first_tasks: visit the vampire's contact, and find out where the vampire is hiding
tools: NONE
description:
I've learned of a possible vampire.
And while I do not know its exact whereabouts, I do have information suggesting someone who does.
Pay a visit to the beast's last known contact. Do what you must to find where it's hiding now.
Then root out the monster, and destroy it.

name: Judgment
objective: destroy Harkon
first_tasks: meet up with Isran and the rest of your Dawnguard allies

first_task_locations.name: Castle Volkihar
first_task_locations.description: a castle belonging to Harkon in Tamriel

quest_giver.name: Isran
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

characters.name: Harkon
characters.description: the lord of the vampires

tools: Isran will address the player's fellow Dawnguard members before leaving for Castle Volkihar: the Dawnguard has gained the upper hand in the fight against the vampires
description:
The day hasn't been won while the vampire Harkon still walks Tamriel.
Let me address the Dawnguard, and then we'll be off. The men deserve to know that we've finally gained the upper hand. It's time we take the fight to their door.
Gather your things and rest well, my friend. We meet outside Castle Volkihar.

name: Kindred Judgment
objective: kill Harkon
first_tasks: face Harkon with Serana

characters.name: Harkon
characters.description: Serana's father, and the lord of the vampires

tools: Serana thinks that the player can't trust Harkon after they spoke with Serana's mother in the Soul Cairn: the player can't bring the bow to Harkon
description:
I think we both know... it's time to face my father Harkon. If we don't, he'll keep chasing us for the rest of our lives.
Well, before we spoke to my mother in the Soul Cairn, I would have said we bring the bow to my father. But after everything with her... I don't think we can trust him. No. He has to die. We have no choice.
Let's face him together.

name: The Hunt
objective: send a message to the Dawnguard by killing one of them without drawing attention
first_tasks: kill a Dawnguard spy
tools: NONE
description:
You're going to go kill a Dawnguard spy.
But don't draw attention. Some kills are for fun, some for profit. And others are for sending messages. This one is a message. Don't make a big scene. Don't get caught.
The corpse is to be the message, not the attack. With any luck he'll bleed to death before anyone notices. A cold corpse will say what we want better than a warm one.

name: The Prey
objective: remind the Dawnguard that they are the prey
first_tasks: track down a Dawnguard member, and kill him discreetly

quest_giver.name: Garan Marethi
quest_giver.description: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

tools: NONE
description:
I've learned the whereabouts of a troublesome Dawnguard member. You will track him down and dispose of him.
But please, do be discreet. Don't. Get. Caught. Our aim isn't to stir the nest, just to skin a rat, reminding them that they are the prey.

name: Hide and Seek
objective: kill a vampire masquerading as a regular citizen without being accused of murder
first_tasks: track down the vampire
tools: NONE
description:
I've located the whereabouts of a vampire masquerading as a common citizen in Solitude. Track him down and dispose of him.
Vampires enjoy stalking their prey. Passing among us undetected emboldens them. Makes them feel powerful, untouchable. But we'll put a swift end to that.
Tread lightly. The vampire can cloud the minds of those he preys upon. It won't be easy to convince anyone he's other than he appears. The law is unaware of the danger and will treat you as a criminal if you are caught. You must be clever. Find a way not to be caught or accused of murder.
We must be vigilant and self sufficient if we are to defeat these monsters.

name: The Gift
objective: turn your wife into a vampire
first_tasks: use vampiric seduction on your wife, embrace her and bite her neck

quest_giver.name: Vingalmo
quest_giver.description: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

characters.description: the player's wife

tools: the player is married: it presents difficulties for vampires
vampirism is the greatest gift that vampires can bestow to their loved ones
description:
It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married. Marriage is a fine institution, however, one that does present certain difficulties for such as like ourselves.
May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours and "invite" her to the family by offering her the Gift of Vampirism. Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.

name: Durnehviir
objective: learn a dragon shout from Durnehviir
first_tasks: summon Durnehviir by speaking his name to the heavens

quest_giver.name: Durnehviir
quest_giver.description: a dragon, and a reluctant servant of the Ideal Masters

reward.description: Durnehviir will fight as the player's ally and teach the player his shout

groups.name: Ideal Masters
groups.description: the rulers of the Soul Cairn

locations.name: Soul Cairn
locations.description: a terrible dimension that imprisons souls

tools: the player fought against Durnehviir in the past: Durnehviir respects the player
description:
My desire to speak with you was born from the result of our battle. I merely wish to respectfully ask a favor of you.
For countless years I've roamed the Soul Cairn, in unintended service to the Ideal Masters. Before this, I roamed the skies above Tamriel. I desire to return there.
I fear that my time here has taken its toll upon me. I share a bond with this dreaded place. If I ventured far from the Soul Cairn, my strength would begin to wane until I was no more.
I will place my name with you and grant you the right to call my name from Tamriel. Do me this simple honor and I will fight at your side as your Grah-Zeymahzin, your Ally, and teach you my Thu'um.
Simply speak my name to the heavens when you feel the time is right.

name: Forgotten Books
objective: bring ancient Falmer tomes to Urag gro-Shub
first_tasks: find more ancient Falmer tomes

reward.description: per ancient Falmer tome
a translated edition of each brought Falmer tome

tools: the player is presenting an ancient Falmer tome to Urag gro-Shub and asking if Urag gro-Shub is interested in buying it
description:
Well, well. I haven't seen one of these beauties in a long time. A rare find in the original Falmer language. You're damn right I'm interested. Question is, are you selling?
Well, considering no one else in Skyrim would buy something they couldn't possibly read, I'd say you don't have much of a choice. Tell you what, you bring me books like this, and I'll pay a thousand gold each. I'll even throw in a translated edition I have for free.
If you're holding out for more gold, it's never going to happen.

name: Destroying the Dawnguard
objective: prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
first_tasks: kill the Dawnguard leaders

first_task_locations.description: an abandoned fort in the Reach

tools: the Dawnguard will become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered
description:
The Dawnguard will, no doubt, soon become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered.
We need to strike a crippling blow against them before they muster more men against us. They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach. The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike. Not a serious threat, but we can't leave them completely unchecked or they may become one.
But their time has come to an end. And you will be the one that ends it. Killing their leaders should discourage them from an out and out war with us.

name: The Affairs of Hagravens
objective: help Melka reclaim her tower by killing Petra
first_tasks: let Melka out of the cage

reward.description: Melka's staff

characters.name: Petra
characters.description: a female Hagraven

groups.name: Hagraven
groups.description: monsters, a horrific cross between an old crone and a bird

tools: the player entered the room where Melka has been imprisoned
description:
Who enters? Will nobody save poor Melka?
You, meat! Come, come. Don't leave poor Melka to die. Pretty, pretty flesh. Let me out!
Petra! Evil Petra put me in a cage, stole my tower. Hate her, chew her bones! Let me out, kind, kind meat.
Ah, I have a pretty staff. Help me find Petra, wring her neck, pluck her eyes. Take my prize staff, I just want my tower back!

name: Deceiving the Herd
objective: frame the Dawnguard for murder
first_tasks: murder someone influential in public while wearing Dawnguard armor and plant a note on the victim
tools: Feran Sadri gives the player Dawnguard armor, and a note for framing the Dawnguard
description:
The Dawnguard have increased their operations and have been aggressively recruiting in Whiterun.
We need to put a damper on their efforts and give those trouble makers something to worry about other than harassing our interests.
You are to make a public show of murdering someone. Do it in the streets for all to see. The higher the profile the better. Someone attached to the court, a merchant, a bard, a priest, someone with stature. Make it seem you are a member of the Dawnguard, thus sowing confusion among the herd. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
The people will put pressure on the Dawnguard who are apparently murdering their fellows without provocation. Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.

name: A Cornered Rat
objective: locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall
first_tasks: talk to Brynjolf about finding Esbern

reward.description: Esbern knows how to stop the dragons

characters.name: Esbern
characters.description: a paranoid man

characters.name: Brynjolf
characters.description: a 'well-connected' man

tools: the Thalmor are also looking for Esbern
description:
We've got to find Esbern in Riften before the Thalmor do. He'll know how to stop the dragons if anybody does. You'd better get to Riften. Talk to Brynjolf. He's... well-connected. A good starting point at least.
Oh, and when you find Esbern... if you think I'm paranoid... you may have some trouble getting him to trust you. Just ask him where he was on the 30th of Frostfall. He'll know what it means.

name: The Lure of of the World
objective: convince Nikulas to stay with his mother
first_tasks: counsel Nikulas on the perils of the world

characters.name: Nikulas
characters.description: Edla's son, strong and loyal, yet reckless and foolish

tools: Edla recently lost her husband: Nikulas is everything she has left
description:
I'm Edla. I have a son. His name is Nikulas. He's a good lad, strong and loyal. I only wish he wasn't so eager to leave the village. I've tried to tell him that the world beyond our lands is dangerous and cruel, but he won't listen.
For now, I need Nikulas here. You see, his father, my husband, was recently lost to us. Nikulas is all that I have left in this world. I know it is selfish of me to say so, but I cannot lose him. Not while I still grieve. Also, I know his heart. Nikulas is reckless and foolish, like most young men. He cannot understand what awaits him in the wide world.
Could you talk to Nikulas? I know he would listen to you. You've been out there in the wide world. You know its perils.

name: Dawnguard
objective: join the Dawnguard
first_tasks: speak with Isran about joining the Dawnguard

characters.name: Isran
characters.description: the male leader of the Dawnguard

tools: vampires are becoming a larger threat
description:
I'm Durak of the Dawnguard.
We are vampire hunters. We search out and destroy those bloodsucking scum wherever we find them. We are looking for anyone willing to fight against the growing vampire menace.
Everybody says that they are not interested about joining, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires.
Want to sign up to the Dawnguard and kill vampires? Go talk to Isran, our leader, at Fort Dawnguard, southeast of Riften. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.

name: Brelyna's Practice
objective: help Brelyna Maryon by allowing her to practice her spells on you
first_tasks: stand where you are

reward.description: a necklace

tools: NONE
description:
We're all trying to become better mages, right?
Well, I need someone I can practice a few spells on. Nothing dangerous, really.
Would you be willing to assist me? I can't practice that kind of spell on myself. Believe me when I say I wouldn't be asking if it weren't necessary. You just have to stand there...
You might wish to help out one of your fellow mages. If that is not enough, I have this amulet you could take.

name: A False Front
objective: deliver false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal
first_tasks: convince an innkeeper to help you locate an Imperial runner, get the Imperial orders from the runner, and replace them with forgeries

first_task_locations.description: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

tools: NONE
description:
I Need you to deliver some false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal. But first we need to get our hands on some Imperial orders to make the forgeries.
The inns at Dragon Bridge and Rorikstead are frequent stops for Imperial runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Talos guide you.

name: The Fallen
objective: capture and interrogate a dragon to learn Alduin's location
first_tasks: convince the Jarl of Whiterun to help you capture a dragon in his palace

first_task_locations.name: Dragonsreach
first_task_locations.description: the palace of the Jarl of Whiterun that was built to hold a captive dragon

characters.name: Jarl of Whiterun
characters.description: a headstrong noblemen

characters.name: Alduin
characters.description: an evil dragon

tools: NONE
description:
Do you know Dragonsreach? The Jarl of Whiterun's palace? Its name is no accident. The palace was originally built to hold a captive dragon.
You might be able to trap a dragon there, interrogate him and learn Alduin's location. You'd require the Jarl's cooperation, of course. That might not be easy to come by.
You must trust in the rightness of your cause, and the strength of your Voice.

name: A Forged Path
objective: deliver false orders to the Stormcloak commander in Dawnstar
first_tasks: convince an innkeeper to help you get some real Stormcloak orders

first_task_locations.name: Nightgate or Candlehearth
first_task_locations.description: inns, frequent stops for Stormcloak runners

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion

tools: NONE
description:
I need you to deliver some false orders to the Stormcloak commander in Dawnstar. But first we need to get our hands on some rebel orders to make the forgeries.
The Nightgate and Candlehearth inns are frequent stops for Stormcloak runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Show the rebels the futility of their cause.

name: Rings of Blood Magic
objective: retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
first_tasks: retrieve the Ring of the Erudite
retrieve the Ring of the Beast

reward.name: Ring of the Erudite
reward.description: one of the ancient rings of blood magic

reward.name: Ring of the Beast
reward.description: one of the ancient rings of blood magic

characters.name: Molag Bal
characters.description: the god of vampires

tools: the rings of blood magic increase the abilities of the player's vampiric powers: Molag Bal supposedly gave the rings to vampires
description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient rings of Blood Magic: the Ring of the Erudite in Swindler's Den and the Ring of the Beast in Cragwallow Slope. They belong among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
The rings increase the abilities of your vampiric powers. Some say Molag Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
You'll be able to keep the rings. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.

name: The Eye of Magnus
objective: force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus
first_tasks: get inside the College of Winterhold with the Staff of Magnus and reach Ancano

quest_giver.name: Tolfdir
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher at the College of Winterhold

items.name: Staff of Magnus
items.description: a powerful staff that can breach magical shields according to the Psijics

characters.name: Ancano
characters.description: a power-hungry male wizard

tools: Tolfdir and the others can't crack Ancano's magical shield around the College of Winterhold
the player got the Staff of Magnus the Labyrinthian
description:
Ancano has sealed himself inside the College! The Eye of Magnus is is growing his power. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself.
I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it. You have the Staff of Magnus, then? Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
You're the one with the staff, my child. If it can help us get inside the College, and reach Ancano, we'll have to hope that there's a way to stop all this.

name: Extracting an Argonian
objective: rescue Derkeethus
first_tasks: find Derkeethus

first_task_locations.name: Darkwater Pass
first_task_locations.description: a dangerous cave filled with water pools and high falls, south of Darkwater Crossing

characters.name: Derkeethus
characters.description: a man, Sondas Drenim's friend

tools: NONE
description:
There's a cave known as the Darkwater Pass south of here. It has its share of water pools and high falls.
Those falls... dangerous place. A friend of mine, Derkeethus, thought he could find some good fish in the pools. Haven't heard from him in a long while.
Could you try to find him? He might need someone to rescue him.

name: New Silence
objective: help Neloth with his silence experiment
first_tasks: let Neloth cast a new kind of silence spell on you

reward.description: Neloth will prepare a version of the silence spell that the player can cast themselves

tools: NONE
description:
You could help me with my research. I believe I've discovered a new form of silence. Some philosophers postulate seven orders of silence, but I believe there's an eighth.
If you allow me, I'd like to envelop you in the eighth form, to study the mental effects. If this works, I'll prepare a version that you can cast yourself, if you ever wish to inflict... er, study silence.

name: Experimental Subject
objective: help Neloth by being a test subject in his experiment
first_tasks: stand still and let Neloth cast an experimental spell on you
tools: the player asked Neloth whether they could help with his research
description:
You want to help with my research? Are you willing to be an experimental subject?
Oh, it's nothing too dangerous. The experiment should provide an additional spectral tether from your own lifespark to the divine realm. You would experience it as a sort of... increased vigor. You would fight longer, feel stronger, that sort of thing. At least I think it will. Probably. Almost certainly. Of course, you never can tell.
Now stand still... it's my first time casting this spell, and I don't need any additional distractions.

name: Evil in Waiting
objective: help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
first_tasks: collect the three vessels needed to vanquish Hevnoraak, and bring them to Valdar

quest_giver.name: Valdar
quest_giver.description: a ghostly guardian whose powers are fading

characters.name: Hevnoraak
characters.description: an evil man who has been dead for many generations

tools: Valdar has been holding Hevnoraak in his tomb
Hevnoraak's minions guard the three vessels
description:
Leave, stranger. Evil stirs in this place. I fear for the security of the very land if it should break free.
We stand at the tomb of Hevnoraak, who has been dead for many generations. I fear, however, that his return may be at hand. I have been holding him here. While he regains strength, however, I am fading. By now I can barely contain his power, much less defeat him if he awakens. But with the help of a living champion I may be able to succeed.
Three vessels in the tomb below hold the power to vanquish Hevnoraak. Before anything else, we need those. Bring them to me - but be careful, mortal. They are guarded by Hevnoraak's minions. They will stop at nothing to see their master return.

name: Erik the Adventurer
objective: help Erik become an adventurer
first_tasks: convince Mralki buy armor for Erik

characters.name: Mralki
characters.description: Erik's father, an innkeeper in Rorikstead

tools: the player is an adventurer
description:
You look like you've seen your share of adventure. I envy you that. In fact, maybe you can help me with something.
I want to be an adventurer like you, but my father says I can't. He says that he needs me to stay here and work the farm, and even if he did let me be an adventurer, we couldn't afford to buy armor. His name's Mralki, and he's the innkeeper here. I hope you can change my father's mind. He can be a little stubborn.
I can't stand the thought of being trapped in this village for the rest of my days.

name: Escaped Criminal
objective: hunt down an escaped criminal
first_tasks: find the escaped criminal

quest_giver.name: Skjor
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Companions

characters.description: escaped criminal, a dangerous man

tools: NONE
description:
You're looking for work? It seems that law-breakers in the Pale have no desire to stay there. I don't blame them.
One of them's escaped, and you're going to find that coward. At this point they don't care what happens to him and neither do I. Best to just kill him and be done with it.
Be careful. This man is known to be dangerous.

name: The Joy of Enchanting
objective: use an Arcane Enchanter and a filled soul gem to enchant something
first_tasks: take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor and use an Arcane Enchanter to learn its enchantment

reward.description: the player learns to enchant weapons and armor

tools: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire to teach them how to enchant weapons and armor
learning an enchantment from an item destroys the item
Farengar Secret-Fire can sell the player everything they need
description:
Ah, a student of the craft. You'll need to start by learning an enchantment.
Take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor, then use the Arcane Enchanter to learn its secrets. The item is destroyed in the process, so be wary. Once you know an enchantment, you'll need a filled soul gem, and something to enchant. You'll use the Arcane Enchanter for that, too.
Of course I have everything you need for sale, if you have the coin.

name: Enchanting Pick-Up
objective: bring an item from a client to Sergius Turrianus
first_tasks: get the item from Sergius Turrianus' client

quest_giver.name: Sergius Turrianus
quest_giver.description: an enchanter at the College of Winterhold

tools: the player is a student at the College of Winterhold
Sergius Turrianus gives the player the name and the location of the client
description:
There's more enchanting to be done. You can acquire whatever it is and bring it back here, and I'll take care of it.
Be quick about it, will you? This is a good way for the College to bring in some money.
Here's the name and location of the client.

name: Mead for Elmus
objective: retrieve one bottle of Ashfire Mead for Elmus
first_tasks: grab a bottle of Ashfire Mead

quest_giver.name: Elmus
quest_giver.description: a brewer from Thirsk Mead Hall

items.name: Ashfire Mead
items.description: a special brew made at Thirsk Mead Hall

tools: the player asked Elmus if they could help him
description:
Actually, now that I think of it, I have been missing the Ashfire Mead. It's a special brew that we make at Thirsk.
If you could... somehow... get up there and grab a bottle, I'd be a long way towards forgetting how miserable it is down here.

name: Elisif's Tribute
objective: help Elisif the Fair make the offering to Talos to complete her husband's burial
first_tasks: take Torygg's war horn to the shrine

characters.name: Torygg
characters.description: Elisif the Fair's dead husband

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the hero-god of humans

tools: Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire: when they buried Torygg, Elisif the Fair made offerings to all the gods except Talos
description:
There's something... personal... I was hoping you would do for me.
As you may know Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire. When we buried my husband I made offerings to all the gods... except Talos. My husband Torygg would want a proper burial.
I would like you to take an item of his, a war horn handed down from his father, and place it at a Shrine of Talos.
It would mean a lot to me.

name: Berries for Elmus
objective: retrieve some juniper berries for Elmus
first_tasks: find juniper berries
tools: the player helped Elmus and the others reclaim the Thirsk Mead Hall from monsters
description:
We lost most of the mead batches we had brewing when... before those things were here. One is just ready to take its turn, though, and it's about time to add some of the flavorings.
You can't find them on Solstheim, but if you find yourself back in Skyrim, I wouldn't mind you bringing some juniper berries.
They add a different kind of sweetness. Tart. Makes the flavor more round.

name: The Ebony Warrior
objective: fight the Ebony Warrior
first_tasks: locate the Ebony Warrior

quest_giver.name: Ebony Warrior
quest_giver.description: a man who has done all that can be done

tools: only the player can send the Ebony Warrior to Sovngarde
description:
I am the Ebony Warrior. I have come to challenge you to a fight.
I have done all that can be done. There is nothing left. No quests to be undertaken. No villains to be slain. No challenges to face.
Except for you. You are my last challenge. Only you can send me to Sovngarde with honor.
Make your preparations. When you are ready, come find me at my last vigil.

name: Elder Knowledge
objective: recover an Elder Scroll to learn Dragonrend
first_tasks: talk to the mages about finding an Elder Scroll

first_task_locations.name: College of Winterhold
first_task_locations.description: a school for mages in Skyrim

reward.name: Dragonrend
reward.description: a powerful shout

items.name: Elder Scroll
items.description: a scroll that can show the player the past

tools: the player asked Esbern what they need to learn Dragonrend
description:
Ah, you need an Elder Scroll. There's a pretty puzzle. Not the kind of thing you'll find in your local bookshop. Let me think...
Perhaps the College of Winterhold. What learning there is in Skyrim is gathered there. One of the mages there may be able to put you on the trail of this Elder Scroll.
This Elder Scroll might be able to show you the past in some way, and let you learn the Dragonrend shout.

name: A Shield for Igmund
objective: retrieve the shield for Igmund
first_tasks: get Igmund's father's shield back from Hagravens

quest_giver.name: Igmund
quest_giver.description: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

reward.description: Igmund's permission to purchase property in Markarth

groups.name: Forsworn
groups.description: savage people who consort with Hagravens

tools: the player asked more work from Igmund
Igmund's father tried to negotiate with the Forsworn: they took his shield to Hagravens
description:
I do have more work for you. A personal matter. My father died trying to negotiate with the Forsworn, back when that was possible.
They took his shield to Hag's End, to those Hagraven beasts they consort with. I need you to bring it home where it belongs. I warn you, it's dangerous work. No man of mine has ever faced a Hagraven and lived. I'll understand if you decline.
Return my father's shield to me and I'll grant you permission to purchase property in my city.
Divines watch over you.

name: Lost Glory
objective: retrieve the Helm of Winterhold for Korir
first_tasks: find the Helm of Winterhold

items.name: Helm of Winterhold
items.description: a helm that was worn by Hanse in the First Era

characters.name: Hanse
characters.description: a nobleman who was in line to be High King of Skyrim

locations.name: Winterhold
locations.description: a city that has lost much of its history and power

tools: NONE
description:
Winterhold has lost much of its history, and with that much of its power. I, Korir, the Jarl of Winterhold, aim to change that.
I've heard rumors of the resting place of the Helm of Winterhold, the very same helm that Hanse wore in the First Era. He was in line to be High King of Skyrim, you know. Having that might get the ear of the other nobles and give me some authority.
The Helm of Winterhold lies in Hob's Fall Cave. Recover it, and I'll You have Winterhold's thanks.

name: Robber's Stash
objective: find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
first_tasks: go to the island to the south and find the old tree stump

quest_giver.description: the bandit leader, a paranoid man, giving quest via "Bandit Leader's Journal"

reward.description: the bandit leader's stash

items.name: "Bandit Leader's Journal"
items.description: a journal written by the bandit leader

characters.name: Herd
characters.description: a male bandit in the bandit leader's gang, hates Brodir

characters.name: Brodir
characters.description: a male bandit in the bandit leader's gang, hates Herd

tools: the bandit leader thinks that his men are going to mutiny: Herd and Brodir are leading their own cliques within the bandits
the bandit leader is going to gather up gold and escape downriver to Dragon Bridge
description:
Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.

name: Dravynea's Frost Salts
objective: bring frost salts to Dravynea the Stoneweaver
first_tasks: find some frost salts

reward.description: free Alteration training from Dravynea the Stoneweaver

tools: NONE
description:
I was a mage back in Morrowind. I lend my talents to the mines here, helping them keep the tunnels safe. By Azura, it gets hot in there. I use Frost Salts for a potion to keep the heat bearable, but I'm out.
If you want to go to the trouble of getting me some frost salts, feel free. I suppose I could offer you a bit of free Alteration training when you get back.

name: A Ring Worthy of Alchemists
objective: retrieve the Ring of Pure Mixtures for Frida
first_tasks: find the Ring of Pure Mixtures

reward.description: alchemy training from Frida

items.name: Ring of Pure Mixtures
items.description: a ring that boosts an alchemist's talents

tools: Frida's husband died while searching for the Ring of Pure Mixtures
description:
I'm Frida, the oldest woman in Dawnstar.
I picked up the herb trade from my husband. We used to go out in the wilds and collect ingredients together. He used to call me his "pretty Juniper." It's quite romantic, if you're an alchemist. Frost took the old fool a few seasons back, while he was looking for the Ring of Pure Mixtures.
I found the ring's resting place, Shrouded Grove, after he died, but I'm far too old to go exploring some cave, now. I'd be happy to give you some alchemy training in exchange for the ring, if you bring it to me.

name: A Journal of Regret
objective: retrieve Runil's journal for him
first_tasks: find Runil's journal

quest_giver.name: Runil
quest_giver.description: a priest of Arkay and old, regretful elf

reward.description: Runil will pay the player

characters.name: Kust
characters.description: Runil's male assistant

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: Runil became a priest of Arkay after the Great War: many died by Runil's magics
Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept Runil as one of their own
description:
I am Runil, a priest of Arkay. I came into Arkay's light after the Great War. So many died by my hands, my magics.
I'm fortunate that Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept me as one of their own.
Could you do an old elf a favor? I misplaced my journal in a cave I was exploring. I'll pay for its return.
Blessing of Arkay to you for your help.

name: Noster's Lost Helmet
objective: retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
first_tasks: find Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet

quest_giver.name: Noster Eagle-Eye
quest_giver.description: a former scout of the Imperial Legion

reward.description: Noster Eagle-Eye will show the player some of his old scouting tricks

tools: Noster Eagle-Eye tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble: he lost his helmet in one of the old caves
description:
I'm Noster Eagle-Eye. I was the finest scout in the Imperial Legion, once. Tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble.
Lost my helmet in one of the old caves. My pretty, pretty helmet. Life just got worse after that. Kept losing things. So many things....
Oh, could you find that helmet for me? I sure would love to have it again. Could show you some of my old scouting tricks.

name: Roggi's Family Shield
objective: retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
first_tasks: find the Knot-Beard shield

reward.description: Roggi Knot-Beard will show the player some shield techniques

characters.name: Lenne
characters.description: a forefather of Roggi Knot-Beard who lost the Knot-Beard shield

tools: Roggi Knot-Beard's clan was one of the first to settle Kynesgrove: Lenne was the first to discover the mines
description:
I'm from from here. I've wandered a bit, but I always come back to Kynesgrove. My clan was one of the first to settle here.
Legend says that my forefather Lenne discovered the mines after he stumbled into a dark cave to relieve himself. Too much mead. Of course, there's another story of Lenne losing the family shield in a different cave, so it depends on who you believe.
According to my grandfather at least, the family shield should be in the cave. He swore that version of the legend was true, even found the cave old Lenne stumbled into: Ansilvund. Hey, if you find it, I could show you some of the clan's favorite fighting moves. They're all shield techniques.

name: The Queen's Sword
objective: retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
first_tasks: find High Queen Freydis' sword

reward.description: Oengul War-Anvil would be grateful

characters.name: High Queen Freydis
characters.description: a queen who ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, had a legendary sword

tools: the player asked Oengul War-Anvil whether he is the castle blacksmith
Oengul War-Anvil is working an a sword: the Jarl of Windhelm wants it to look like High Queen Freydis' sword
description:
Of course I am the castle blacksmith. What do I look like, a tavern wench? Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary. Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place, Cronvangr Cave.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.

name: A Sharp Heirloom
objective: retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
first_tasks: find Amren's father's sword

reward.description: Amren would be grateful

characters.name: Saffir
characters.description: a woman

tools: Saffir doesn't like that Amren has been spending so much time looking for his father's old sword
description:
I'm Amren, the husband of Saffir.
My Saffir doesn't like that I've been spending so much time looking for my father's old sword. He fed his entire family with the gold he made using that weapon. I'm not about to let it gather dust in some thief's trophy room.
I tracked it to a group of bandits nearby. The place is called Halted Stream Camp. But I'm no fool. I'd need the Whiterun guards or maybe hire some mercenaries to get it. I don't know why I'm saying this, but if you find it out in your travels, I'd be grateful to you.

name: Good Fortunes
objective: retrieve Shahvee's amulet for her
first_tasks: find Shahvee's amulet

reward.description: Shahvee would be in the player's debt

characters.name: Zenithar
characters.description: the god of wealth

groups.name: Argonians
groups.description: a people native to Black Marsh, who have not fared well outside their homeland

tools: thieves stole Shahvee's sacred amulet of Zenithar as soon as she bought it
description:
I'm Shahvee.
We Argonians have not fared well outside our native Black Marsh, but we're determined to make the best of things.
I began praying to Zenithar, the god of wealth, to bring us some fortune, but thieves made off with my sacred amulet almost as soon as I bought it.
If you found my Amulet, Shahvee would be in your debt, kind one.

name: Drowned Sorrows
objective: find Isabelle Rolaine
first_tasks: talk to Vex about Isabelle Rolaine

characters.name: Isabelle Rolaine
characters.description: a young, beautiful woman, and Ranmir's lost love

characters.name: Ranmir
characters.description: a male drunk who used to be happy with Isabelle Rolaine

characters.name: Vex
characters.description: a woman

tools: Ranmir is sure that Isabelle Rolaine ran away with Vex
description:
I'm Dagur, an innkeeper.
I wondered if I could ask a favor of you. It's about Ranmir. Don't get me wrong, I don't have a problem with him being in my inn all the time. He mostly keeps to himself, and so far he's been able to pay. I just hate to see what's happened to him. He hasn't always been like this, you know. Drunk, I mean.
He was a different person. Happy, outgoing... Like anyone who's in love. See, Ranmir was involved with a pretty young woman named Isabelle Rolaine. The two of them were very happy together, I thought. One day, she just disappeared. Ranmir was convinced she'd run off with someone else, leaving him behind. He turned to drinking, and what's left of him is what you see here every day.
I hoped that maybe if she could be found, if he had some sort of explanation, that maybe he could put himself back together. I'm in no position to go searching for her, but perhaps you could. Ranmir seemed convinced that Isabelle'd run off to Riften with someone named Vex. That's all I remember.

name: The Numbers Job
objective: make the shortfalls from Thieves Guild's other jobs look legit
first_tasks: change the numbers in the business ledger

quest_giver.name: Delvin Mallory
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

tools: most businesses in Skyrim keep their transactions recorded within business ledgers
description:
Most of the establishments in Skyrim keep their transactions recorded within business ledgers.
Your job would be to change the numbers in those books so the shortfalls from our other jobs look legit. In this case, we want to waylay a shipment on the way from this business without them even noticin' anything went missin'.
Feel like doing a bit of writin' in Bits and Pieces in Solitude?

name: Dragon's Breath Mead
objective: retrieve the Dragon's Breath Mead and give it to Olda
first_tasks: find Horgeir's stash of drinks

first_task_locations.description: a cave nearby, guarded by wolves

characters.name: Horgeir
characters.description: Olda's husband who promised to give up on the mead

tools: NONE
description:
My husband Horgeir promised me, swore on his ancestors, that he'd give up the mead. And what do I find out?
He's been stashing drink in a cave nearby. He even has some wolves guarding it. I swear, I should just cut out his tongue. That would be the end of it.
You could get Horgeir's stash for me, but I'll keep my dagger sharpened just in case. You can help yourself to any drink you find, but bring me the bottle of Dragon's Breath Mead. It's his favorite, so I know he has one there.

name: Old Friends
objective: find the person who summoned ash spawns and made them attack Neloth
first_tasks: wear the ring Neloth gave you to find the source of the ash spawns

locations.name: Morrowind
locations.description: a province where Neloth has made many enemies

tools: Neloth gives the player a ring: it will light up the source of the ash spawn attacks when the player gets close to it
description:
I'm under attack. There are too many coincidences. There must be someone behind all of my recent troubles.
I have enemies. Legions of them back in Morrowind. However, in this case I have reason to believe it is someone in Solstheim. First I need to identify the culprit. I've enchanted this ring to find the source of the attacks. Here, take it.
Just wear the ring I gave you. It will light up the source when you get close to it. I enchanted the ring with a bit of ash from the last ash spawn attack. It can follow the magical link back to its summoner.

name: Reluctant Steward
objective: tell Varona that Neloth wants apple cabbage stew with some canis root tea
first_tasks: find Varona

quest_giver.name: Neloth
quest_giver.description: a pompous master wizard of Telvanni

reward.description: Neloth shall be grateful

characters.name: Varona
characters.description: Neloth's female steward

groups.name: Telvanni
groups.description: a great house of powerful wizards

tools: the player is the hero of Skyrim
description:
Where is that ash sucking steward of mine? Varona! Have you seen Varona? I'm hungry.
Find her. Tell her I want apple cabbage stew, with some canis root tea. After all, I don't make my own tea. I am a master wizard of the house Telvanni. Other people make tea for me.
You are not my servant? Obviously not, or you would have a cup of tea in your hands. I supposed you want to be asked nicely. Very well.
Please, oh hero of Skyrim. Please find Varona. I shall be ever so grateful.

name: Recipe for Distraction
objective: tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
first_tasks: locate the hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine

first_task_locations.description: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock

items.name: Emberbrand Wine
items.description: a powerful and addicting alcohol drink

groups.name: Redoran
groups.description: a noble house that rules over Raven Rock

tools: Modyn Veleth's men have been stashing bottles of Emberbrand Wine: it distracts them from their tasks
description:
Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service. Looking for something to lend a hand with? We have problems aplenty in Raven Rock.
Commanding the Redoran Guard can be a difficult task. Even the most experienced warriors can fall prey to petty distractions. They usually didn't amount to much, but they make my job that much harder. Some of my own men have become quite accustomed to a spirit they called 'Emberbrand Wine.' Despise the stuff myself. It's powerful and tremendously addicting... I've seen men fail to finish even a single flask.
If I knew where they were stashing the bottles, I'd put an end to it myself. Could you track down the stash? That would be helpful. I just don't have time to do it myself right now.
They're too smart to have left it in the Bulwark. I'd search one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of town.

name: Rebuilding the Blades
objective: recruit new members for the Blades
first_tasks: find anyone who would make a good Blades recruit and bring them to Delphine

reward.description: the player should ask Esbern about the dragon lairs his been studying: the Blades recruits will do some dragon hunting with the player

characters.name: Esbern
characters.description: a male scholar, and a member of the Blades

tools: the Thalmor hunted the Blades down, but the Blades have a headquarters of a sort now: it's time to rebuild the Blades
being a Blade is a lifelong commitment
description:
The Thalmor hunted us down. It wasn't exactly great for recruitment. But we have a headquarters of a sort now. We'll rebuild the Blades.
If you find anyone you think would make a good recruit, I can certainly take a look at them. Remember, though, being a Blade is a lifelong commitment. Their loyalty has to be with us once they're in.
After you have recruited enough new Blades, ask Esbern about the dragon lairs he's been studying. We'll have the recruits do some dragon hunting with you.

name: Recipe for Disaster
objective: kill the Gourmet, steal his writ of passage, and assume his identity
first_tasks: talk to Festus

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Gourmet
characters.description: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known

characters.name: Festus
characters.description: a fellow Dark Brotherhood member, a man

tools: the Gourmet is the last target before he Dark Brotherhood strikes out at the emperor: the Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the emperor at a special dinner
Festus is close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet
description:
There's just one more target before we strike out at the Emperor.
Have you by chance heard of the "Gourmet"? Read his cookbook? It's become quite a phenomenon. The Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the Emperor at a special dinner.
You'll kill him, steal his Writ of Passage, and assume the role of master chef. Festus has been spearheading this part of the assassination plan. He's close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet.
You should report to him.

name: Recipe for Death
objective: assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
first_tasks: question Anton Virane to learn the true identity of the Gourmet, and kill Anton Virane

characters.name: Gourmet
characters.description: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known

characters.name: Astrid
characters.description: the female guildmaster of the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Anton Virane
characters.description: a male cook

tools: Astrid told the player about killing the Gourmet and taking his identity
the player should hide the Gourmet's body if they can
description:
Let's get down to business. Astrid told you about the Gourmet, I hope? That you need to kill him and take on his identity?
But first you'll need to learn who he is. Assuming, of course, that the Gourmet actually is a "he." Could be a woman for all we know. In my, um, investigations, I came upon this. It's a copy of the Gourmet's cookbook. Ah, but not just any copy. It's signed you see! Seems to be a message from the Gourmet to one Anton Virane. I've tracked Virane to the keep in Markarth. It would seem he's the cook.
You are to obtain that information from Virane - who the Gourmet really is, and where he can be found. Oh, and when you're done with Virane, kill him. Loose ends and all that.
As I was saying... You'll need to kill the Gourmet, of course. But what's more, you'll need to get his Writ of Passage, so you can take his place. Oh, and if you can, hide his body. The longer it takes for anyone else to determine his real identity, the better.
Now off with you!

name: Repairing the Phial
objective: acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
first_tasks: get unmelting snow
get mammoth tusk powder
get a briar heart

reward.name: White Phial
reward.description: a legendary bottle that will replenish whatever fluid is placed inside of it

characters.name: Nurelion
characters.description: Quintus Navale's master

tools: Quintus Navale has thought about repairing the White Phial
Nurelion was obsessed with the White Phial: his obsession consumed him
description:
I have some thoughts about repairing the White Phial. There are three crucial elements. Some may be easier to find than others.
On the top of the Throat of the World is a patch of unmelting snow. No heat can touch it. Then we need the tusk of a mammoth, ground to a fine powder as only the giants know how. The final step is tricky. It requires the briar heart from a Forsworn of the Reach.
If you can bring me these materials, the Phial can again be made whole. You can keep the White Phial after I have repaired it. I fear keeping the Phial would just remind me of Nurelion's obsession, and how it consumed him.

name: The Raid
objective: help Laila Law-Giver to uncover and stop the illegal Skooma trade in Riften
first_tasks: convince Sarthis close down his Skooma operation permanently

quest_giver.name: Laila Law-Giver
quest_giver.description: the lawful female ruler of Riften

characters.name: Sarthis
characters.description: a male Skooma dealer

tools: Laila Law-Giver gives the player the key to the warehouse
description:
We're aware of a Skooma dealer's presence in the warehouse within this city. Unfortunately, we're certain this Skooma dealer, Sarthis, has informants within the city guard. Every time we've made a move to arrest him, he's escaped.
However, if you'd take care of this discreetly, you might be able to surprise him without warning. Here, this is the key to the warehouse. See if you can drop in on this dealer of poison and convince him to close down his operation permanently.

name: A Cultured Gift
objective: bring Rustleif "Night Falls on Sentinel"
first_tasks: find "Night Falls on Sentinel"

reward.description: Rustleif teaches the player smithing

characters.name: Seren
characters.description: Rustleif's pregnant Redguard wife

groups.name: Redguards
groups.description: a race of people not from Skyrim

tools: Rustleif runs the forge together with his wife Seren, who is a Redguard
Seren worries how she will pass along her traditions to Rustleif and her child
description:
My wife Seren and I run the forge together. She still smiths even though we found out she is with child.
Our son or daughter isn't going to get much Redguard culture here in Skyrim. I know my wife worries how she will pass along her traditions.
Hey, if you find a book called "Night Falls on Sentinel", could you bring it to me? It's a story from my wife's people. Be good to have.
Don't know what the Redguards see in books, but it would make my Seren happy. Let me show you some tricks around the forge, when you return with the book.

name: A Job for Mead
objective: bring Siddgeir some Black-Briar Mead
first_tasks: get Black-Briar Mead

reward.description: Siddgeir gives more important work to the player

tools: NONE
description:
You're here for work? I demand tribute before you can be considered for any real tasks.
How about drink? None of that local piss. Real Black-Briar Mead, fresh from Riften.
You better bring me my mead. I hate people who waste my time.

name: A Mammoth Powered Startup
objective: bring Ysolda a mammoth's tusk
first_tasks: find a mammoth's tusk

reward.description: Ysolda teaches the player trading

characters.name: Ma'dran
characters.description: one of the caravan leaders

tools: Ma'dran would help Ysolda start her own business for a mammoth's tusk
description:
I'm Ysolda. Before my ma and da passed, I told them that one day, I'd become the best trader in Skyrim.
I met one of the caravan leaders, Ma'dran. He said he'd help get me started if I could bring him a mammoth's tusk. Easier said than done.
If you find one, I could teach you a thing or two about trading. Help you get a fair bargain in the future.

name: Song of the Alchemists
objective: bring Lami "Song of the Alchemists"
first_tasks: find "Song of the Alchemists"

reward.description: Lami teaches the player things about herbs

tools: NONE
description:
I'm Lami, an alchemist. I picked up the alchemy trade when I was a girl. One of the temple healers staying here on a pilgrimage showed me the basics.
She had a book with her, "Song of the Alchemists", that I used to read over and over. I miss having a copy.
Could you find that book for me? I'd be happy to show you a bit about herbs if you find the book.

name: Lessons on Defense
objective: bring Captain Aldis a copy of "The Mirror"
first_tasks: find a copy of "The Mirror"

quest_giver.name: Captain Aldis
quest_giver.description: a captain of the Imperial Legion

tools: Captain Aldis trains recruits: he thought about asking some training books from the general
description:
I'm with the Imperial Legion. Train the recruits. Turn boys into men. That sort of thing.
Thinking of asking the General for some training books. Give the soldiers something to do while they're on rest. Something besides drinking. Ever seen a book called "The Mirror"? We used to hand it out to boys looking to learn basic shield work.
If you find a copy of "The Mirror", I'd be glad to have it. Then I'll see if I can get some copies made for the men.

name: A Comforting Amulet
objective: bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
first_tasks: find an amulet of Arkay

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

characters.name: Tova
characters.description: Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's mourning wife

tools: Tova is not handling the death of her and Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's daughter well
description:
Please forgive my mood. I'm still coming to terms with my daughter's death. Our little girl died recently. I've been shouldering my days with strong mead, but nothing gives my Tova peace.
I've been looking for an Amulet of Arkay to remind my wife that our child is with the gods now, but I can't find one. Would you be willing to give me an Amulet of Arkay, should you find one?
I hope Arkay grants my wife some comfort.

name: Purity of Revenge
objective: avenge Kodlak
first_tasks: retrieve the fragments of Wuuthrad and wipe out the Silver Hand

first_task_locations.name: Driftshade Refuge
first_task_locations.description: the headquarters of the Silver Hand

quest_giver.name: Vilkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

characters.name: Kodlak
characters.description: an old man, and the leader of the Companions

groups.name: Silver Hand
groups.description: a bandit gang who hate the Companions

locations.name: Jorrvaskr
locations.description: the mead hall of the Companions

tools: the Silver Hand attacked the Companions in Jorrvaskr, killed Kodlak, and stole the fragments of Wuuthrad
description:
The Silver Hand attacked us. They finally found enough courage to attack Jorrvaskr. We fought them off, but... The old man... Kodlak... he's dead.
No one else got hurt, but they made off with all our fragments of Wuuthrad. But you and I are going to reclaim them. We will bring the battle to their chief camp, Driftshade Refuge. There will be none left living to tell their stories. Only songs of Jorrvaskr will be sung.
We will avenge Kodlak. And they will know terror before the end.

name: The Pursuit
objective: search for clues about Mercer Frey's whereabouts
first_tasks: break into Mercer Frey's house

first_task_locations.name: Riftweald Manor
first_task_locations.description: Mercer Frey's home in Riften, a gift from the Black-Briars after they kicked the previous family out

quest_giver.name: Brynjolf
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Mercer Frey
characters.description: a male guildmaster of the Thieves Guild who betrayed the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Vald
characters.description: a male lowlife

tools: Mercer Frey never stays at Riftweald Manor: he hired Vald to guard Riftweald Manor
the player has the permission to kill anyone who stands in their way
description:
I have an important task for you. I need you to break into Mercer Frey's home and search for anything that could tell us where he's gone.
Mercer's house is in Riften. A gift from the Black-Briars after they kicked the previous family out... a place called Riftweald Manor. He never stays there, just pays for the upkeep on it. Hired some lout by the name of Vald to guard the place.
Be careful, kid. This is the last place in Skyrim I'd ever want to send you. Just find a way in, get the information and leave. And you have permission to kill anyone that stands in your way.

name: Promises to Keep
objective: help Louis Letrush get Frost and his lineage papers from Sibbi Black-Briar
first_tasks: talk to Sibbi Black-Briar about Frost and the lineage papers

reward.description: you'll be well paid

characters.name: Sibbi Black-Briar
characters.description: a privileged man

characters.name: Frost
characters.description: one of the finest breeding horses in the realm

characters.name: Maven Black-Briar
characters.description: Sibbi Black-Briar's mother, and a dangerous, powerful woman

tools: Sibbi Black-Briar agreed to sell Frost to Louis Letrush
Maven Black-Briar threw Sibbi Black-Briar in Riften Jail before he delivered Frost to Louis Letrush: Sibbi Black-Briar thinks that this exempts him from selling Frost to Louis Letrush
description:
I'm Louis Letrush. Looking for work? I need someone to deliver a message to Sibbi Black-Briar.
I recently approached Sibbi Black-Briar about buying Frost, one of the finest breeding horses in the realm. He agreed to sell. I paid Sibbi half the cost of Frost up front, but before he could deliver, Maven had him locked up. Sibbi believes this exempts him from our deal. It does not.
Head to the Riften Jail and talk to Sibbi. Get him to tell you where Frost and his Lineage Papers are and bring them to me outside Riften. You'll be well paid for your time.

name: The Forsworn Conspiracy
objective: investigate the attack market in the market
first_tasks: find out why Margret was attacked, and who is behind the Forsworn

reward.description: Eltrys will pay the player for any information they bring him

characters.name: Margret
characters.description: a woman who was attacked by a crazed man at the Markarth market

tools: NONE
description:
I'm sorry to drag you into Markarth's problems, but after that attack in the market, I'm running out of time.
You want answers? Well so do I. So does everyone in this city. A man goes crazy in the market. Everyone knows he's a Forsworn agent. Guards do nothing. Nothing but clean up the mess.
This has been going on for years. And all I've been able to find is murder and blood. I need help. Please. You find out why that woman Margret was attacked, who's behind the Forsworn, and I'll pay you for any information you bring me.

name: Proving Honor
objective: complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
first_tasks: claim another fragment of Wuuthrad with Farkas

quest_giver.name: Skjor
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Companions

reward.description: the player will become a true Companion

characters.name: Farkas
characters.description: a fellow member of the Companions, a man

tools: Farkas will answer the player's questions about the Companions
description:
We have something special for you this time.
Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out in Dustman's Cairn.
This is a simple errand, but the time is right for it to be your Trial. Carry yourself with honor, and you'll become a true Companion. Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp. He'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get Farkas killed.

name: Pilgrimage
objective: help Alessandra make peace with her dead father
first_tasks: bring Alessandra's ceremonial dagger to Andurs so it can be interred with Alessandra's father's remains

first_task_locations.name: Hall of the Dead
first_task_locations.description: a hall where bodies are interred and cared for, in Whiterun

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of burials and funeral rites

characters.name: Andurs
characters.description: a male caretaker

tools: Alessandra did not want to become a Priest of Arkay like her father
Alessandra gives the player her ceremonial dagger
description:
I am Alessandra, a priest of Arkay.
My father was a Priest of Arkay, as well. All my life was spent around the dead, being forced to learn the proper burial rituals and prayers. I never had any friends; who'd want to spend time with 'the little weird girl who hangs around dead people?' So I grew up with a miserable trade. This is all I know how to do... prepare and inter the deceased.
I'd like to make the journey to the Hall of the Dead in Whiterun and give my ceremonial dagger to Andurs, the caretaker. I believe once it's interred with my father's remains I'll be at peace with his memory.
A Priest of Arkay is entrusted with a ceremonial dagger once they've completed their training. It's usually given by the head priest who sanctified the ritual. In my case, the head priest happened to be my father. The thing is, I never wanted to follow in his footsteps... In some ways I still don't.
I'm entrusting you with the dagger. Bring it to Andurs and he'll take care of the rest.

name: Purity
objective: handle Vilkas' personal troubles
first_tasks: help Vilkas give up his beastblood

first_task_locations.name: Tomb of Ysgramor
first_task_locations.description: a tomb where lycanthropy can be cured

quest_giver.name: Vilkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions, and a werewolf

characters.name: Kodlak
characters.description: the dead male leader of the Companions

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied underworld of honorable heroes

groups.name: Glenmoril
groups.description: a coven of witches who cursed the Companions with lycanthropy

tools: Kodlak's final teaching: those with beastblood cannot enter Sovngarde
the player has a head of the Glenmoril that is needed to cure lycanthropy
description:
There is always work for the Companions. But there is more personal task before me.
Kodlak's final teaching is troubling me. I think he was right about beastblood and Sovngarde. I wish to cleanse myself that I might know glory in the afterlife.
Will you help me give up my beasthood? You still bear a head of the Glenmoril betrayers, yes? Then lead on, back to the Tomb of Ysgramor.
My soul is now prepared.

name: Sanctity
objective: cure Farkas' lycanthropy
first_tasks: get a special Hagraven's head with Farkas

first_task_locations.description: the place that is already known to the player

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a Nord werewolf, and a fellow member of the Companions

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied underworld of the Nords

characters.name: Kodlak
characters.description: the dead male leader of the Companions, who was cured of lycanthropy

characters.name: Aela
characters.description: a female member of the Companions

tools: Kodlak said that werewolves can't be good Nords
Aela said a Hagraven's head is needed to cure lycanthropy
description:
There is always work. My mind is someplace else, though.
I think that maybe Kodlak was right. As a werewolf, I can't be a good Nord. I want to be clean, like he was, and go to Sovngarde when I finally die.
Aela said we would need a Hagraven's head. I already have one of them, but she said it was a special kind. And that you knew where to get more.
Let's go find one!

name: Payment Delivery
objective: help Pactur alleviate Bryling's wrath about missing shipments
first_tasks: tell Bryling that there will be a shipment soon

reward.description: Pactur lets the player take a few ingots from Bryling's mine

characters.name: Bryling
characters.description: a harsh noblewoman

tools: NONE
description:
Bryling's already come down hard on us for missing shipments. Likely to do it again, since we're late.
You could take word to her in Solitude that there'll be a shipment soon. Buy us some time and keep her off our backs. In exchange, I'm willing to let a few ingots go missing. Maybe more than a few.
You'd do me quite a favor. I wouldn't forget it. I'm sure she'll be angry. Brace yourself.

name: Pieces of the Past
objective: retrieve the scattered pieces of Mehrunes' Razor for Silus Vesuius
first_tasks: find Ghunzul, Drascua, and Jorgen, the owners of the pieces of Mehrunes' Razor

reward.description: Silus Vesuius will pay the player

characters.name: Ghunzul
characters.description: a dangerous marauder

characters.name: Drascua
characters.description: a dangerous marauder

characters.name: Jorgen
characters.description: a man

characters.name: Mehrunes Dagon
characters.description: the evil god of the Mythic Dawn

groups.name: Mythic Dawn
groups.description: an evil cult that wanted to destroy everything during the Oblivion crisis

tools: after the Oblivion crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn: one of the groups found Mehrunes' Razor and split it into three fragments almost 150 years ago
the descendants of the group still have the fragments of Mehrunes' Razor: Silus Vesuius gives the player his notes on the owners
description:
I have a job you look perfect for.
