A little history, first. After the Oblivion Crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn. One of these groups found Mehrunes' Razor, the artifact of Mehrunes Dagon. They split it into three fragments and pledged to keep them apart forever. That was almost 150 years ago, and the pieces are still being kept by the descendants of that group. And they're right here, in Skyrim.
At least two of the owners, Ghunzul and Drascua, are dangerous marauders. And the third owner, Jorgen, I only know he lives in Morthal.
Here are my notes about them. I'll gladly pay you for getting the pieces any way you can. No questions asked.

name: The Words of Power
objective: find a lost word of power
first_tasks: get to the location marked on your map

first_task_locations.name: Skyrim
first_task_locations.description: a province with many words of power

reward.description: the player learns a new word of power

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: a mortal blessed with the blood and soul of a dragon, masters of the Thu'um

tools: the player is the Dragonborn
description:
You have learned so much already, Dragonborn. Growing your gift too quickly would be dangerous.
But there are many Words of Power in Skyrim, carved in the Dragon tongue. Even from here, we can feel the Thu'um resonate from them. Finding these lost Words would be a sufficient test, to temper your abilities with experience.
We have felt the whisper of a Word. Give me your map, and I will show you where its echo can be found.

name: The Wolf Queen Awakened
objective: stop Potema from returning to the living
first_tasks: find Potema's skeleton and remove it from the catacombs
bring Potema's skeleton back to be sanctified by Arkay

first_task_locations.name: Potema's Catacombs
first_task_locations.description: catacombs filled with Potema's undead minions

characters.name: Potema, the Wolf Queen
characters.description: a former queen of Solitude, and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: Potema was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago: Styrr has a book about Potema
one of Potema's servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines
the player was there when Potema was summoned in spirit form
Styrr helps the player with Potema's minions
description:
Ah Potema, the Wolf Queen. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history. She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
And now Potema has been summoned in spirit form. Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs. A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
You were there when Potema was summoned. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to stop her from returning to the living. I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.

name: The World-Eater's Eyrie
objective: fly to Skuldafn on Odahviing and face Alduin
first_tasks: free Odahviing

characters.name: Alduin, World-Eater
characters.description: a male dragon, likes devouring the souls of mortals

locations.name: Skuldafn
locations.description: Alduin's door to Sovngarde, an ancient fane high in the eastern mountains filled with Alduin's remaining forces

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied underworld where the souls of mortal heroes end up in

tools: the player lured Odahviing to Dragonsreach and took him prisoner: the player distrust Odahviing
description:
It was you that lured me here and took me prisoner... I have done nothing to earn your distrust.
Wisdom sees the doorway. It would be wise to recognize when you only have one choice. You can trust me. I am not treacherous. Alduin has proven himself unworthy to rule. I go my own way now. He has traveled to Sovngarde to regain his strength, devouring the souls of the mortal dead. A privilege he jealously guards... His door to Sovngarde is at Skuldafn, one of his ancient fanes high in the eastern mountains. I surely do not need to warn you that all his remaining strength is marshaled there.
Free me, and I will carry you to Skuldafn so that you can face Alduin in battle. I warn you, once you've flown the skies, your envy of the dragons will only increase.

name: With Friends Like These...
objective: kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
first_tasks: turn around, and select the person who shall not leave the room alive

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's admirer, and a member of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: the player's debt to the Dark Brotherhood will be paid

characters.name: Aventus Aretino
characters.description: a young boy who wanted Grelod the Kind dead

characters.name: Grelod the Kind
characters.description: a cruel, old female orphanage headmistress, killed by the player

tools: Astrid woke the player up from their sleep
Aventus Aretino was looking for the Dark Brotherhood: Grelod the Kind was a Dark Brotherhood contract, and the player must pay for killing her
description:
Sleep well? Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole. A kill you must repay.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.

name: Wind and Sand
objective: retrieve a copy of "Wind and Sand" for Neloth
first_tasks: find a copy of "Wind and Sand"

quest_giver.name: Neloth
quest_giver.description: a wizard experimenting with the ash and Redguard magic

characters.name: Afa-Saryat
characters.description: a famous Redguard wizard

tools: NONE
description:
I've been trying to adapt Redguard magic to the ash. I think the key concept I'm missing is recorded in Afa-Saryat's book, Wind and Sand.
I have some associates and correspondents who find things for me. One of them has a credible rumor on where this book might be. And I'd like you to find the truth of the matter.
Go to Druadach Redoubt and fetch the book for me, will you?

name: The White Phial
objective: retrieve the White Phial for Nurelion
first_tasks: reach Curalmil's resting place

first_task_locations.name: Forsaken Cave
first_task_locations.description: a long forsaken cave to the west of Windhelm

characters.name: Curalmil
characters.description: a crafty, long-dead alchemist, and the creator of the White Phial

items.name: White Phial
items.description: a legendary bottle that will replenish whatever fluid is placed inside of it

tools: Nurelion's assistant won't let Nurelion get the White Phial himself
Nurelion gives the player the alchemical mixture that is needed to reach Curalmil's resting place
description:
I've finally derived the location of the White Phial, but my doting busybody of an assistant won't let me get it.
It's buried with its maker, Curalmil, in Forsaken Cave, a long forsaken cave to the west of here. Curalmil was a crafty one, even in death. You would need the skills of a master alchemist to reach his resting place.
Luckily for you, I've already made the required mixture. Here, take it. Please... don't dally. I've wasted enough time arguing with my useless assistant here.

name: Whispers in the Dark
objective: spy on Cicero and the person he is talking with
first_tasks: hide inside the Night Mother's coffin to eavesdrop on the meeting between Cicero and a mystery person

first_task_locations.description: Night Mother's Chamber in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Cicero
characters.description: an insane male member of the Dark Brotherhood, and the Night Mother's Keeper

characters.name: Night Mother
characters.description: the corpse of the spiritual female leader of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: Cicero has been concerning Astrid ever since he arrived at the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: Astrid thinks that Cicero is plotting to overtake the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary and restore the Old Ways
description:
Cicero concerns me. Ever since he arrived, his behavior's been... Well, erratic would be an understatement. I do believe he is truly mad. But it's worse than that.
Cicero's taken to locking himself in the Night Mother's chamber, and talking. To someone. In hushed, but frantic tones. Who is he speaking with? What are they planning? I fear treachery. As the Night Mother's Keeper, he believes he's entitled to the rule of this Sanctuary. Cicero will cite our independence as the need to revert to the Old Ways. He'll claim we're undisciplined, unruly. Heretical, even. Ironically, the Night Mother could prove to be just as much a victim. The queen in a fool's twisted game of chess.
I need you to steal into that chamber, and eavesdrop on their meeting. It'll be no use clinging to the shadows. They'll see you for sure. No, you need a hiding place. Somewhere they'd never think to look. Like inside the Night Mother's coffin.

name: The Whispering Door
objective: find out why Nelkir has become brooding
first_tasks: talk to Nelkir

reward.description: Balgruuf the Greater would be grateful

characters.name: Nelkir
characters.description: Balgruuf the Greater's youngest son, a quiet boy

tools: NONE
description:
My youngest son, Nelkir, is a dark child. I don't know what to do with him.
He was always a quiet lad, but lately... something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent. He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him.
If you could speak to him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful.

name: The Way of the Voice
objective: answer the summons of the Greybeards
first_tasks: reach High Hrothgar

first_task_locations.description: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World

reward.description: the Greybeards can teach the player how to use their gift

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: masters of the way of the voice

locations.name: High Hrothgar
locations.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards

tools: the player killed a dragon for Balgruuf the Greater and absorbed some kind of power from it
the Greybeards think that the player is a Dragonborn: a Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the voice - the ability to focus the player's vital essence into a Thu'um, or shout
description:
So when the dragon died, you absorbed some kind of power from it. So it's true. The Greybeards really were summoning you. They are masters of the Way of the Voice. They live in seclusion high on the slopes of the Throat of the World.
Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it. If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue?
The Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the Voice - the ability to focus your vital essence into a Thu'um, or Shout. If you really are Dragonborn, they can teach you how to use your gift.
You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor.

name: Waking Nightmare
objective: relieve the people of Dawnstar from Vaermina's damaging nightmares
first_tasks: return to Nightcaller Temple with Erandur, and help him end the nightmares

characters.name: Vaermina
characters.description: an evil goddess

locations.name: Nightcaller Temple
locations.description: a temple hosting the root of the nightmare problem, a short walk away from Dawnstar

tools: Vaermina has an awful hunger for people's memories: in return, she leaves behind nightmares
description:
The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.
These dreams are manifestations created by Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares, not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.
I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple. Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard? I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic. I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's nightmares.
Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.

name: Unfathomable Depths
objective: take the Lexicon from From-Deepest-Fathoms, and free her from her burden
first_tasks: return the Lexicon back to Avanchnzel

first_task_locations.name: Avanchnzel
first_task_locations.description: a deep ruin in the west

tools: NONE
description:
You. You must take the Lexicon. Free me of my burden.
The memories. I cannot stand them. You must take them away, return them to Avanchnzel.
You must take the Lexicon from me. Please... take it now. You must bring it to Avanchnzel, in the west. Return it to them. It must go back.

name: Under the Table
objective: make a delivery for Romlyn Dreth
first_tasks: smuggle a small Black-Briar Mead keg to Wilhelm

reward.description: Wilhelm will trade the player something for the Black-Briar Mead keg

characters.name: Wilhelm
characters.description: a male innkeeper

characters.name: Indaryn
characters.description: a male employee of the Black-Briar Meadery

locations.name: Black-Briar Meadery
locations.description: a meadery in Riften that produces Black-Briar Mead

tools: if the player bumps into Indaryn, they should not tell him anything about Romlyn Dreth's dealings
description:
I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Black-Briar Meadery.
If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious. I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork.
Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

name: Vald's Debt
objective: ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
first_tasks: talk to Maven Black-Briar about erasing Vald's debts

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow thief, and Vald's ex-lover

characters.name: Vald
characters.description: a male thug who only understands gold

characters.name: Mercer Frey
characters.description: the player's enemy

characters.name: Maven Black-Briar
characters.description: a powerful woman with criminal connections

tools: the player asked Vex information about Vald
description:
Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

name: Under New Management
objective: become the guild master of the Thieves Guild
first_tasks: meet the members of the Thieves Guild

first_task_locations.description: in the center of the cistern room

quest_giver.name: Brynjolf
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, and the player's friend

reward.description: the player becomes the guild master of the Thieves Guild

tools: NONE
description:
Well, my friend... the time's come to make it official. It's time to become our Guild Master.
Don't worry, I promise this will be short and sweet. If you'll just meet us in the center of the cistern room, we can begin.

name: Ore Identification
objective: pick up an ore sample for Hafjorg for identification
first_tasks: speak to Filnjar to get the ore sample

reward.description: some potions

characters.name: Elgrim
characters.description: an absent-minded male alchemist who runs an alchemy shop

characters.name: Filnjar
characters.description: a male miner

tools: NONE
description:
I swear, if I wasn't around, Elgrim would forget to eat his meals. How we make any coin at all is beyond me.
In fact, I need to arrange for someone to pick up an ore sample for me in Shor's Stone... goodness knows Elgrim won't lift a finger to do it.
You would do this for me? Oh, that would be wonderful. Speak to Filnjar in Shor's Stone. He's got some sort of ore sample he wants us to identify and was willing to pay us well for it.
The job pays well, so I hope I can make arrangements soon. We could really use the gold. I'll have Elgrim make some potions for you for all that travel.

name: Unearthed
objective: become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
first_tasks: give 1,000 gold to Ralis Sedarys so that he can hire some diggers from Raven Rock to dig up Kolbjorn Barrow

reward.description: once there is something worth looking at, Ralis Sedarys sends word to the player

locations.name: Kolbjorn Barrow
locations.description: an ancient tomb buried in ash in the northern ashlands of Solstheim

locations.name: Mournhold
locations.description: a large city on the mainland

tools: the ash storms fill up Kolbjorn Barrow faster than Ralis Sedarys can dig
description:
The name's Ralis. Ralis Sedarys, out of Mournhold.
I've got a financier waiting for me back on the mainland. Sent me here in the interests of obtaining some rare antiquities. The 'Relics of Ahzidal.' But this whole thing became a disaster right quick, let me tell you.
You come out to the northern ashlands, you don't expect things to go easy, you know? But this was something outside my particular expertise. When I first got to Kolbjorn, you couldn't even see it. Buried in the ash, like most other things on this blasted island. Dug out a pile of the stuff taller than me just to find the barrow. Who knows how much to reach the door. Excavating isn't exactly my specialty. Even if it was, the ash storms fill it in faster than you can dig.
Could you become my business partner? We can sort out the details of our little arrangement later, but for now, I'll manage the dig if you can manage the coin.
When you have 1,000 gold for me, I'll head back to Raven Rock and round up some diggers. Once we've got something worth looking at, I'll send word to you.

name: Trouble in Eastmarch
objective: take care of the bandits troubling farmers
first_tasks: find the bandit stronghold

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the companions

tools: NONE
description:
There's some trouble in Eastmarch. Farmers getting troubled by some bad types who've built up a stronghold in the area.
There's nothing but a bunch of lowly bandits. Cowards, who will take little effort.
Take care of them. Do not spare them your blade.

name: Under Saarthal
objective: look for anything interesting
first_tasks: locate enchanted artifacts for Arniel Gane

quest_giver.name: Tolfdir
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher at the College of Winterhold who likes to lecture on the dangers of magic

characters.name: Arniel Gane
characters.description: one of the scholars of the College of Winterhold, a man

tools: NONE
description:
We are looking for anything at all that might be of interest. That's why I adore Saarthal... we have no idea what we're going to find. And if, along the way, my message about the dangers of magic should happen to sink in for a few students, that would be a happy coincidence.
Hmm. Well, why don't you see if you can assist Arniel Gane? He's one of our scholars, here working on cataloging our finds.
I expect he'd appreciate some help in locating any additional magical artifacts here in the ruins. Any enchanted items will do; the usefulness of the enchantment is irrelevant. If you find anything, the class can look it over.

name: Trinity Restored
objective: transact the oath with Nocturnal and become one of the Nightingales
first_tasks: undergo the ceremony to become a Nightingale

quest_giver.name: Karliah
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, and a Nightingale

reward.description: all of the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale

characters.name: Nocturnal
characters.description: the goddess of thieves

groups.name: Nightingales
groups.description: a trio of highly skilled thieves dedicated to the service of Nocturnal

tools: the binding terms of the oath with Nocturnal: the player will be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises, and upon the player's death, the player's spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians
description:
Are you ready to transact the Oath with Nocturnal?
By transacting the Oath with Nocturnal, you're entering into a business deal. You'll be provided all of the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale. You're free to use those powers as you see fit to further your own goals or the goals of the Thieves Guild.
In return, you'll be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises. More importantly, upon your death, your spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians.
Once the Oath has been struck, the terms are binding. Knowing this, are you ready to undergo the ceremony?

name: Unbound
objective: escape Imperial custody with Ralof
first_tasks: jump through the roof of the inn on the other side and keep running
tools: the player and Ralof are making their escape together: the player is a Nord
description:
Hey, Nord. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! I'll follow when I can!

name: Toying With The Dead
objective: retrieve the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals for Vekel the Man
first_tasks: find the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals

reward.description: Vekel the Man would split the reward for the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals with the player

items.description: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings

characters.name: Arondil
characters.description: an insane male wizard, and a necromancer performing unspeakable experiments on reanimation

tools: Arondil used to live in Dawnstar: his house was burned down when his necromantic experiments became public knowledge
description:
I have a buyer with a very odd taste in literature, looking for some particular books.
I'm told they're the ravings of a madman, a wizard named Arondil, and his peculiar cravings. It's said to be in four volumes and very hard to come by. My client is offering quite a reward for them, which I'd split with you.
Recently, a woman was found... naked and shivering along the road to Dawnstar. The only information the guard could get from her were tales of strange experiments and Arondil scribbling in his journals.
He used to have a home in Dawnstar until they burned it down. The people say he was doing unspeakable experiments on reanimation... rituals only a necromancer would perform. After he made for Yngvild, he was never heard from again.
In his later years, Arondil moved into some ice caves known as Yngvild. He preferred the solitude in which to perform his, um... experiments.

name: Tolfdir the Absent-Minded
objective: help Tolfdir find his missing alembic
first_tasks: find Tolfdir's alembic
tools: NONE
description:
This is rather embarrassing, but it seems I've misplaced something.
I can't find my Alembic. I need it for some research. I suppose I could use another one, but... well, it sounds silly, but mine has sentimental value.
If you happen to see it, would you mind bringing it to me?

name: Totem of Hircine
objective: find a totem of Hircine with Aela the Huntress
first_tasks: go with Aela the Huntress

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a member of the Companions, and a werewolf

characters.name: Harbinger
characters.description: the leader of the Companions

characters.name: Skjor
characters.description: a dead male member of the Companions

characters.name: Kodlak
characters.description: a dead male member of the Companions who wanted to cure his lycanthropy

characters.name: Hircine
characters.description: the god of the werewolves

groups.name: Silver Hand
groups.description: a bandit gang who hate the Companions

tools: the player is the Harbinger of the Companions
Skjor and Kodlak talked about totems of Hircine: simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions
description:
Harbinger, I'd be honored if you joined me in my search.
I had once heard Skjor and Kodlak talking about the totems of Hircine. Simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions.
Once Kodlak began looking for his cure, I'd wager Skjor didn't bring it up again. But I was going through his things and found a book I had never seen before. All about the Totems. I've been talking to my sources around the holds, and think I may have heard where one of them lays.
Want to come along and help me find this totem of Hircine?

name: To Kill an Empire
objective: assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet
first_tasks: present the Gourmet's writ of passage to Commander Maro to gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and poison Titus Mede II's meal with Jarrin Root

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the leader of the Dark Brotherhood

items.name: Jarrin Root
items.description: a powerful poison that kills immediately after one bite

characters.name: Gourmet
characters.description: a famous male chef

characters.name: Commander Maro
characters.description: the male officer in charge of Titus Mede II's security

characters.name: Titus Mede II
characters.description: the Emperor

tools: the player killed the Gourmet for Astrid: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid gives the player Jarrin Root
after assassination, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge: Astrid has "arranged" for it to be unguarded
description:
So it's done. You've killed the Gourmet. And now Titus Mede II is as good as dead.
I've decided you will have the honor of killing the Emperor. Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Writ of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro.
You'll gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and then the Emperor. You're posing as a chef, so you'll be able to poison his meal rather easily. Here, take this - it's called jarrin root. All it takes is one taste, and the effects are quite immediate. The Emperor will be serving Sithis before he even knows he's dead. Once Mede has been killed, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge. I've "arranged" for it to be unguarded once the alarm is sounded.
Now go, my friend. Go, and fulfill your destiny as Listener.

name: The Throat of the World
objective: receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
first_tasks: hear Paarthurnax's shout, and match it with your own

characters.name: Dovahkiin
characters.description: a mortal with the soul of a dragon

tools: the player is meeting Paarthurnax for the first time: the player is the Dovahkiin
description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Paarthurnax. Who are you? What brings you to my mountain? Forgive me. I gave in to the temptation to prolong our speech. I know you are Dovahkiin.
You have come here to learn from me. Patience. There are formalities that must be observed, at the first meeting of two of the dragons. By long tradition, the elder speaks first. Hear my shout! Feel it in your bones.
Match it, if you are Dovahkiin!

name: That Was Always There
objective: return Viola Giordano's gold ring to her without her knowing
first_tasks: sneak inside the house and place Viola Giordano's gold ring in a dresser

quest_giver.name: Revyn Sadri
quest_giver.description: a merchant dealing in used goods

reward.description: Revyn Sadri will make it worth the player's while

characters.name: Viola Giordano
characters.description: a woman who fancies herself a criminal investigator

tools: the player asked Revyn Sadri whether something in his store is stolen
description:
Of course nothing in here is stolen. Only a careless, shameful, idiotic fetcher would do something as stupid as to buy pilfered goods....
Oh by Azura, I've made a terrible mistake. I bought a gold ring, and Viola Giordano has been missing a ring that looks just like it.
Could you return the ring to her? It's not that easy. She'd go to the guard if she knew I was even remotely involved. You have to get it to her some other way.
Look, it's dangerous, but if you sneak the ring into her house. Put it in a dresser or something. I will make it worth your while.

name: Deal Like A Steal
objective: secure a merchandise transportation deal for the Thieves Guild
first_tasks: deliver a satchel of Moon Sugar to Ri'saad to secure the deal

quest_giver.name: Tonilia
quest_giver.description: a fence, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Ri'saad
characters.description: the male leader of the caravans that travel across the realm

tools: the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances
description:
Before we get down to business, I've got something I need you to do.
Well, as you know, the Guild's growing and things are looking up around here. The only thing we're lacking is a reliable way to transport our merchandise across the land.
I'm not sure if you've noticed, but there are several caravans that travel across the realm. They're shrewd traders and don't mind getting their hands dirty.
I've bartered with their leader, Ri'saad, on more than one occasion. I want you to bring him something. You see, the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances.
Present Ri'saad with this satchel of Moon Sugar, and I bet my last coin he'll make a deal.

name: Thane of Winterhold
objective: gain the honorary title of thane of Winterhold
first_tasks: help the people of Winterhold

reward.description: the perks of being a thane

tools: NONE
description:
There is room in my court for a new Thane. It's an honorary title, mainly, but there are a few perks someone like you could make use of.
However, I could only grant the title to someone who is known throughout my Hold.
You help my people, and I'll make you my Thane.

name: The Temple of Miraak
objective: uncover what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak
first_tasks: find a way into the Temple of Miraak with Frea

characters.name: Storn
characters.description: the shaman of the Skaal, and Frea's father

characters.name: Miraak
characters.description: an ancient, evil man

groups.name: Skaal
groups.description: a tribe of trusting and hospitable people on Solstheim

tools: something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim, including the Skaal: it makes them work on horrible creations that corrupt the stones
Storn says that Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible
description:
I am Frea of the Skaal. I am here to either save my people, or avenge them.
Something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim. It makes them forget themselves, and work on these horrible creations that corrupt the Stones, the very land itself. My father Storn, our shaman, says Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible.
If you want to know what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak, then let us go together. First, we need to find a way into the Temple of Miraak.

name: Ash Research
objective: extract a sample from an ash spawn for Neloth's research
first_tasks: kill an ash spawn and harvest a sample from it

reward.description: some septims

tools: NONE
description:
Hmm. I have a new spell I'm working on. I hope to be able to conjure ash spawn.
If I could get a sample of ash from an ash spawn, that would be quite useful. I've made this special tool that will extract... well, you don't need to know the details. Just go harvest a sample.
Of course, the creature will have to be dead first, but I trust that's something you can... bring about. There will be some septims for your troubles.

name: Telrav's Request
objective: help Telrav
first_tasks: escort Telrav back to his camp nearby

quest_giver.name: Telrav
quest_giver.description: a man who was attacked by bandits

reward.description: the player will be rewarded

tools: NONE
description:
Bandits attacked and ransacked my cart. Can you help me?
My camp is nearby in the ruins of Nilheim. Get me there safely and you'll be rewarded.

name: The Sweep Job
objective: clear out valuables from Atheron Residence
first_tasks: steal three items of value

first_task_locations.name: Atheron Residence
first_task_locations.description: a wealthy house house in Windhelm

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

tools: NONE
description:
One of the quickest ways to make some coin in Skyrim is to clear out some of the wealthier homes of their valuables.
If you're interested, I could point out a good place that could use a little housecleaning by stealing three items of value.
The place in question is the Atheron Residence in Windhelm. The people in this home recently got one of your fellow Guild mates sent to jail.
How about you make them pay for that? Just remember the order: do job first, get drunk second.

name: Take Up Arms
objective: prove that you are worthy of joining the Companions
first_tasks: go with Vilkas out to the yard, and let him see what you can do

reward.description: membership in the Companions

characters.name: Vilkas
characters.description: a male member of the Companions

tools: the player told Kodlak Whitemane that they want to join the Companions
description:
You would like to join the Companions? Would you now? Here, let me have a look at you. Hm. Yes, perhaps. A certain strength of spirit.
How are you in a battle, child? Don't feel like you need to show off for our sake. Vilkas, here, will be the one testing your mettle.
Let Vilkas take you out to the yard and see what you can do.

name: Tending the Flames
objective: become a member of the Bards College
first_tasks: retrieve King Olaf's Verse

quest_giver.name: Viarmo
quest_giver.description: the welcoming headmaster of the Bards College

reward.description: Bards College membership

items.name: King Olaf's Verse
items.description: a part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim, a poem dealing with King Olaf

characters.name: Jarl Elisif
characters.description: the local ruler, a noblewoman

characters.name: King Olaf
characters.description: a long-dead king

tools: Jarl Elisif has forbidden the burning of King Olaf, a festival put on by the Bards College: to convince Jarl Elisif change her mind, Viarmo wants to read King Olaf's Verse
description:
Welcome to the Bards College. I am Viarmo, the headmaster here.
Always a pleasure to meet a prospective bard. You should be aware that many apply but we accept very few people. When possible, we ask applicants to perform tasks the college needs completed. In this case, I do have a task befitting an aspiring bard...
Jarl Elisif has forbidden the Burning of King Olaf, a Festival put on by the Bards College. We need to change her mind. To convince her I want to read King Olaf's Verse. A part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim. Unfortunately the poem was lost long ago.
According to our histories keeper, the portion of the Edda dealing with King Olaf might still exist in Dead Men's Respite. I need you to retrieve the poem.

name: The Inheritance
objective: find the hidden treasure for yourself
first_tasks: get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out tree stump

reward.description: treasure

tools: the player is torturing their prisoner
the player's prisoner has hidden her inheritance
description:
Why are you people doing this? Is it information you want?
This... this is about the inheritance, isn't it? All right! I'll tell you where I've hidden it. It's in a hollowed-out tree stump. In the marsh, south of Solitude. Now please, you'll let me go now. Right?
Why don't you be a dear and let me go now. All right? I won't say a word to anyone. Our little secret. I promise.

name: No More Pain
objective: find your prisoner's treasure for yourself
first_tasks: get your prisoner's hidden things from a hollowed-out rock

reward.description: some things

tools: the player is hurting their prisoner
description:
I'll tell you anything. Anything! Just please stop... hurting me... I just... can't take the pain. Not a second longer.
I'll give you money. Treasure. I have some things hidden away. Take them all. They're yours. Just please... stop. Just north of Windhelm. There's a hollowed-out rock. I have some things hidden in there. Take them! They're yours.
I've told you everything I can. I don't know what else you could want...

name: Kill Me and Be Done with It...
objective: find your prisoner's hidden treasure for yourself
first_tasks: get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out rock

first_task_locations.description: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun

reward.description: treasure

tools: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner wants to die
description:
Please... What is it you want?
Just... just stop. And I'll tell you where I've hidden my treasure. It's... in a hollowed-out rock. In the tundra. A bit west of Whiterun. Now please... please stop.
Oh gods, you've taken everything I have. Just kill me and be done with it...

name: Canceled Wedding
objective: find the hidden dowry for yourself
first_tasks: get your prisoner's dowry from a hollowed-out tree stump

quest_giver.description: the player's prisoner, a pompous woman

reward.description: the player's prisoner's dowry

tools: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner's father hid her dowry
description:
You... you can't do this to me. Do you have any idea who I am? When my father hears about this, he will gut you.
Ah, now I understand. This is about my father's hidden cache, isn't it? The dowry for my wedding? Ha! Well it's safely hidden away, in a hollowed-out tree stump. Just outside Riften, tucked away nice and secure. You'll never find it.
Damn it. I gave it away, didn't I?

name: Taking Care of Business
objective: send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
first_tasks: collect some debts from Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand, and Haelga without killing them

quest_giver.name: Brynjolf
quest_giver.description: a member of the Thieves Guild

reward.description: Thieves Guild membership

characters.name: Keerava
characters.description: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Bersi Honey-Hand
characters.description: a man who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Haelga
characters.description: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

tools: the player and Brynjolf did a little thievery at the market
description:
Well, well... Color me impressed kid. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me? They are Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga.
They owe our organization some serious coin and they've decided not to pay. I want you to explain to them the error of their ways. Do this right, and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.
Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is that you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored. A word of warning though... I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business.

name: The Taste of Death
objective: find your place as a follower of Namira
first_tasks: meet Eola and fight your way through the undead with her

characters.name: Namira, Lady of Decay
characters.description: the goddess of cannibals

tools: Eola assumes that the player is a cannibal
Eola has been eating the dead people of Markarth
description:
You were young when you first tasted human flesh, weren't you? A brother or sister had died? An accident, of course.
Then the hunger set in. Curiosity. What's the harm in just one bite? It's okay, now. You've found a friend who understands you. You can let go of your guilt.
A lot of our kind block out the memory of their first meal. The shame is too much. But you don't need to hide anymore. Namira, the Lady of Decay, accepts you for what you are.
She has a place for us, where we can sate our appetites without judgment. It's inside Reachcliff Cave. But the dead have stirred from their slumber recently, and I was forced here. Meet me there. We will fight our way to Namira's embrace together.
Until then, tell the people of Markarth that their dead won't be disturbed, anymore. We have bigger plans ahead.

name: Supply and Demand
objective: destroy the source of Skooma and report back to Laila Law-Giver
first_tasks: go to the source of Skooma

quest_giver.name: Laila Law-Giver
quest_giver.description: the noblewoman who rules over Riften

reward.description: the player will be on their way to a title in Riften

characters.name: Sarthis
characters.description: a male Skooma dealer

tools: the player raided Sarthis' warehouse and killed him for Laila Law-Giver: the player knows where the source of the Skooma is
description:
It's nice to receive good news for a change. Did you recover anything else from the warehouse worth mentioning?
If you have discovered the source of Skooma, then there's no time to lose. It won't take long for Sarthis's associates to learn of his death. The source of the poison must be destroyed once and for all, otherwise another dealer will simply take his place.
Do this task for me and you'll be well on your way to a title in Riften. Report back to me when your task is complete.

name: Summerset Shadows
objective: remove the Summerset Shadows from the picture, and return Torsten Cruel-Sea's silver locket to him
first_tasks: find information about the Summerset Shadows

characters.name: Fjotli
characters.description: Torsten Cruel-Sea's daughter, who liked wearing a lot of jewelry

characters.name: Niranye
characters.description: a woman affiliated with the Summerset Shadows

groups.name: Summerset Shadows
groups.description: a new guild of Altmer thieves, rivals to the Thieves Guild

groups.name: Thieves Guild
groups.description: a guild of thieves who condemn murder

tools: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Fjotli was robbed and murdered: Torsten Cruel-Sea tracked down the murderer, a member of the Summerset Shadows, and killed him
description:
My daughter Fjotli... she was murdered a few months ago. Left her laying on the ground in a pool of her own blood. I assume they were after her valuables... she always wore far too much jewelry in public. When I told her it'd be the death of her, I never thought...
No need to explain, I'm well aware of your Guild's methods do not include killing. It took me weeks, but I finally tracked down the killer. A bloody Altmer at that. Can you imagine? Let's just say I'm a firm believer in an eye for an eye and leave it at that.
The killer fancied himself a thief in some sort of a new Guild forming around here. Gave me some valuable information before... well, you know. Well, I think we can help each other. You recover what I'm looking for and take out a rival Guild in the process. One of the pieces stolen from Fjotli was a silver locket, a Cruel-Sea family heirloom. I want it back.
The only name I have is Niranye. Has a house right here in Windhelm. That's where you should begin looking.

name: Striking the Heart
objective: force the Silver Hand in hiding
first_tasks: assassinate a Silver Hand leader

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

groups.name: Silver Hand
groups.description: a bandit gang who hate the Companions

tools: NONE
description:
I've been hearing rumors of Silver Hand activity. A group of them has holed up in Hjaalmarch, in a camp called Orotheim.
Assassinate their leader and the rest should go hiding. Run fast, my friend.

name: Stoking the Flames
objective: bring 10 fire salts to restore Balimund's forge
first_tasks: find 10 fire salts

items.description: fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava

tools: Balimund's forge consumes fire salts
description:
Come to see Balimund perform miracles with steel, eh? Smithing's been in my blood for generations.
I owe my success to my forefathers and their recipe for flame. The secret is my forge. It consumes fire salts, a strange mineral that burns as hot as lava.
Sadly, this forge is dying and I've used the last of my fire salts. If I can't feed it soon, it may grow cold. Ten pinches of fire salts should give me all I need to bring this forge back to life.
Could you get the fire salts for me? I know that they are hard to come by, but they would save my business and warm an old smith's heart.

name: The Straw that Broke
objective: help Narfi get closure about Reyda
first_tasks: talk to Wilhelm about Reyda

characters.name: Reyda
characters.description: Narfi's sister who went missing

characters.name: Wilhelm
characters.description: a man who told Narfi that Reyda will be back

tools: NONE
description:
Reyda was here, then gone. Went to gather plants and never came home... nope, nope. Everyone looked and no one could find her. Wilhelm said she'll be back... told Narfi not to worry... Reyda will come back.
With father I said goodbye... with mother I said goodbye. Reyda leaves and Narfi can't say goodbye. Makes Narfi very, very sad. Narfi needs Reyda to say goodbye.

name: Stealing Plans
objective: steal the plans of the Silver Hand
first_tasks: sneak into a Silver Hand camp

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

groups.name: Silver Hand
groups.description: a bandit gang who hate the Companions

tools: NONE
description:
I've caught wind that one of the brighter Silver Hand has been sniffing around Eastmarch.
If you can sneak into the Silver Hand camp and steal their plans, we'll have the advantage. Hopefully the plans will let us know more about their movement.

name: The Spiced Wine
objective: convince the East Empire Company to release Evette San's shipment of spices, and return back to Evette San for your reward
first_tasks: talk to Vittoria Vici about Evette San's shipment of spices

reward.description: something for the player's time

characters.name: Vittoria Vici
characters.description: a woman who handles shipments for the East Empire Company

tools: NONE
description:
Hello! I'm the spiced wine merchant Evette San. You wouldn't have a few minutes to run down to the docks would you?
I've got a shipment of spices the East Empire Company is holding up. I need someone to convince them to release it. The person handling shipments is called Vittoria Vici. You should try to talk to her about my shipment.
Get back to me when you're done and I'll give you something for your time. I swear it's a fight with them every shipment.

name: Spread the Love
objective: distribute all religious missives to the citizens of Riften
first_tasks: speak to the citizens

reward.description: Mara's gift

characters.name: Mara
characters.description: the goddess of love

tools: keep away from the keep and the city guards: they won't accept the missives
description:
Riften is drowning in a sea of sin and wickedness and it's my personal mission to let everyone know that the warmth of Mara can see them through.
All I need is a messenger to bring Her words to these poor souls by distributing these missives. Lady Mara would be so pleased, if you could distribute the missives! Let me give you the missives. Here you are. Now make sure you give out every single one, we can't afford to let even one lost soul stray from Her warmth.
Almost anyone in Riften is in dire need of those missives. Speak to them, child. You will know who will listen and who will sin. A word of advice, keep away from the Keep and the city guards. They follow their own path and have already forsaken Her.
Allow me to give you Mara's gift as a reward... a true blessing to aid you in times of need. Despair not, her warmth will protect you always!

name: Stabilized
objective: help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire
first_tasks: talk with Sapphire about Shadr's debt

characters.name: Sapphire
characters.description: a female thief

tools: Shadr thinks that Sapphire cheated him: Shadr ordered a shipment from the Whiterun stables, it never came
description:
I owe a great deal of money to someone and I think they cheated me. I don't know what to do.
I was able to work out a deal with the stables in Whiterun to sell me some of their tack and harnesses. I borrowed some gold from Sapphire to pay for the shipment, but it got robbed before it even arrived. Now Sapphire wants her money back, and if I don't pay her, I think she's going to kill me.
Can you help me pay off my debt? You should go talk with Sapphire about it.

name: A Mail Delivery
objective: make a delivery for Sylgja to her parents
first_tasks: deliver a satchel of letters to Verner

first_task_locations.name: Darkwater Crossing
first_task_locations.description: a village where Sylgja's parents live

quest_giver.name: Sylgja
quest_giver.description: an injured woman, and a good daughter

reward.description: a reward for the player's time

characters.name: Verner
characters.description: Sylgja's father

tools: Sylgja assumes that Verner have something for her
description:
Would you happen to be headed towards Darkwater Crossing?
My parents live there. I usually make the journey to bring them gifts and to just say hello, but I haven't been well lately.
I've written some letters and placed them in a satchel. Perhaps you wouldn't mind delivering it to them on my behalf? I would insist on rewarding you for your time.
Here, take my satchel and give it to my father, Verner. He'll likely have something for you to bring back.

name: Special Delivery
objective: help Bolli sell his fish to an untapped market
first_tasks: deliver a purchase agreement to Kleppr

reward.description: Kleppr will pay the player as soon as they arrive with the purchase agreement

characters.name: Kleppr
characters.description: a male innkeeper

tools: Bolli sells his catch across Skyrim
description:
I'm Bolli, a fisherman.
I sell my catch across a good portion of Skyrim... it's worth its weight in gold to me. The only untapped market left is Markarth. However, I just got word that Kleppr at The Silver Blood Inn might be interested.
If you're headed that way, I would appreciate you delivering a purchase agreement for me. You'd be paid, of course. Kleppr will pay you as soon as you arrive with the letter. Here you are.

name: The Staff of Magnus
objective: bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
first_tasks: find the Staff of Magnus

quest_giver.name: Mirabelle Ervine
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher in magic at the College of Winterhold

characters.name: Ancano
characters.description: a power-hungry male wizard

characters.name: Savos Aren
characters.description: the male Arch-Mage of the College of Winterhold

items.name: Staff of Magnus
items.description: a mage's staff that can absorb a tremendous amount of power

locations.name: College of Winterhold
locations.description: a school for mages in Skyrim

tools: the player needs the Staff of Magnus to break through Ancano's dangerous magic

the player knows that the Staff of Magnus is in Labyrinthian: Savos Aren gave Mirabelle Ervine something from Labyrinthian before he died, Mirabelle Ervine gives the player this item and Savos Aren's amulet
description:
You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.
I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
You know that the staff is in Labyrinthian? Are you... Are you sure? The staff is there? That can't be a coincidence. The Arch-Mage. Before... before he died. He... He gave me something just a little while ago. He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came. I think... I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him. Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think would do you the most good now. Take it, and get out of here.
Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us. If we can't stop this, what happens to the rest of Skyrim?

name: Lusting After Gold
objective: steal a child-sized gold statue for Degaine
first_tasks: sneak inside the temple and find the gold statue

first_task_locations.name: Temple of Dibella
first_task_locations.description: a temple whose priests are exclusively women

reward.description: Degaine pays the player half of what his man in Riften promised for the gold statue

tools: Degaine doesn't want the Thieves Guild to find out about his plans
description:
You see that Temple? Way up there. All them women, keeping to themselves.
Won't let poor Degaine in, no. Not even for a look. But they've got a treasure in there. Gold statue, size of a child. Who knows what they use it for, but I know what I'll use it for.
Stealing it and selling it for profit. Well let's not put it like that. Wouldn't want the Thieves Guild catching wind of us, eh? Nah, just creep in and have a go at taking it out. I'll be here, and pay you half of what my man in Riften promised for it.
You'll be helping out an old beggar, and the gods smile on that sort of thing.

name: Sovngarde
objective: go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor
first_tasks: complete Tsun's warrior's test

first_task_locations.name: Sovngarde
first_task_locations.description: the storied underworld of heroic souls

quest_giver.name: Tsun
quest_giver.description: Shor's shield-thane, and the guardian of the Whalebone Bridge

reward.description: the player will be allowed to pass the Whalebone Bridge

characters.name: Alduin, World Eater
characters.description: a dragon who is eating the souls of Sovngarde

characters.name: Shor
characters.description: the chief of the gods

tools: Tsun judges which heroic souls are allowed to go to the Hall of Valor
the player pursues Alduin: Shor did not let the heroic, angry souls of Sovngarde to attack Alduin
description:
I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all those souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcome, well earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.
You pursue Alduin, the World Eater. A fateful errand. No few have chafed to face the Worm since first he set his soul-snare here at Sovngarde's threshold. But Shor restrained our wrathful onslaught - perhaps, deep counseled, your doom he foresaw.
Living or dead, by decree of Shor, none may pass this perilous bridge 'till I judge them worthy by the warrior's test.

name: Speaking With Silence
objective: catch Karliah
first_tasks: find Karliah with Mercer Frey

quest_giver.name: Mercer Frey
quest_giver.description: the player's guildmaster in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Karliah
characters.description: an intelligent female thief, on the run from the Thieves Guild

tools: the player agreed to meet Mercer Frey outside Snow Veil Sanctum
Mercer Frey found Karliah's horse and killed it
description:
Good, you're finally here. I've scouted the ruins and I'm certain Karliah is still inside.
I did not find her in flesh. No, I found her horse. Don't worry, I've taken care of it... she won't be using it to escape. Let's get moving, I want to catch her inside while she's distracted. Take the lead.
Just make certain you keep your eyes open. Karliah is as sharp as a blade. The last thing I need is you blundering into a trap and warning her that we're here.

name: Pinching A Bottle
objective: give a bottle of double-distilled Skooma to Stands-In-Shallows
first_tasks: steal the bottle of double-distilled Skooma

quest_giver.name: Stands-In-Shallows
quest_giver.description: an old Argonian, and a Skooma addict

reward.description: Stands-In-Shallows trains the player in stealth

tools: NONE
description:
I feel like my scales are clawing into me. Maybe you could help an old Argonian out?
I heard some of the sailors talking about how they stashed a bottle of Double-Distilled Skooma in the Gnisis Cornerclub. I just need a taste.
Please, snatch the bottle for me. I'll be waiting for it. Then, let me show you a thing or two about not attracting attention to yourself.

name: Keeping Up the Appearances
objective: give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
first_tasks: steal Nelacar's mage's staff from his room

quest_giver.name: Malur Seloth
quest_giver.description: the sly, lazy steward of the Jarl of Winterhold

reward.description: Malur Seloth trains the player in speechcraft

characters.name: Nelacar
characters.description: an old male mage

characters.name: Jarl of Winterhold
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Winterhold

locations.name: College of Winterhold
locations.description: a college for mages in Winterhold

tools: the Jarl of Winterhold thinks that Malur Seloth has some connection with the College of Winterhold: he goes easy on Malur Seloth
description:
I do nothing around here. And I hope to keep it that way. The Jarl is convinced I have some connection with the College, so he goes easy on me.
Maybe you'd like to help me keep up appearances? Old Nelacar has a mage's staff in his room in the Frozen Hearth. It'd be good to have that staff in case the Jarl starts wondering if I actually have a real connection to the College.
Pinch that staff for me. I'll be waiting for it. Once I have it, I'll show you a few tricks I've learned about buttering up royalty.

name: Imperial Spy?
objective: give Lod's letter to Dengeir of Stuhn
first_tasks: steal Lod's letter

quest_giver.name: Dengeir of Stuhn
quest_giver.description: a paranoid man who hates the Empire

characters.name: Lod
characters.description: a male blacksmith

characters.name: General Tullius
characters.description: a male Imperial general

locations.name: Skyrim
locations.description: a province of the Empire that might break out of the Empire

locations.name: Solitude
locations.description: the capital city of Skyrim, under Imperial rule

tools: Dengeir of Stuhn thinks that Lod wrote a letter to General Tullius
description:
There's a plot. Not against me. Against all of Falkreath. Those Imperial bastards are spying on every one of us.
Last night I saw Lod the blacksmith writing a letter. Probably sending word to Solitude and General Tullius. Are you loyal to Skyrim? Break into Lod's house and get that letter.
The Empire is probably making Lod smith up more swords and armor for them.

name: Soljund's Sinkhole
objective: make Soljund's Sinkhole safe again
first_tasks: clear out draugr

first_task_locations.name: Soljund's Sinkhole
first_task_locations.description: a mine connected to an old Nordic crypt

tools: Perth warns the player to stay out of Soljund's Sinkhole
description:
Whoa, there. I don't know where you're going, but stay out of that mine. It isn't safe.
We tunneled into an old Nordic crypt. The whole place is crawling with draugr. We're not mining up any ore with those undead around, so I wouldn't go down there if I were you.
You want to clear out the draugr? You're joking, right? Those bone-walkers will tear you limb from limb. But if you want to get yourself killed, go ahead.
I hear talk about a regiment coming to clear the crypt out. We'll see if that happens.

name: Smooth Jazbay
objective: collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
first_tasks: find 20 Jazbay Grapes

reward.description: something for the player's efforts

characters.name: Aduri
characters.description: Avrusa Sarethi's younger sister

tools: Avrusa Sarethi is keeping a a tight rein on Aduri
description:
Sigh. I've got my hands full here. Between the farm chores, cultivating my supply of Nirnroot and keeping a tight rein on my sister Aduri, there's little time for rest.
Could you help me? One of the ingredients I need to cultivate Nirnroot are Jazbay Grapes... the acidic content of the juice is perfect for the soil. I need twenty of them for my current crop.
I'll give you something for your efforts... finding all of them might not be easy... or cheap.

name: Skilled Apprenticeship
objective: bring 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' to Ghorza gra-Bagol
first_tasks: find a copy of 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash'

quest_giver.name: Ghorza gra-Bagol
quest_giver.description: an Orc Blacksmith who used to work for the Imperial Legion

reward.description: Ghorza gra-Bagol teaches the player smithing

characters.name: Tacitus
characters.description: a young Imperial man, and Ghorza gra-Bagol's apprentice

tools: Tacitus is not learning smithing by example: Ghorza gra-Bagol thinks that 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' could help him learn
description:
You'd think an apprentice could forge a few hinges. Not Tacitus. I keep showing him how to treat the iron, but he never gets it.
In the Legion, the Imperial smiths used to read books when they couldn't set their hammers straight. Wisdom of the old, I guess. If you find a book called 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash', could you bring it to me? Tacitus sure isn't learning by example.
Books. Don't know why the Imperials like them so much. It should help the boy, though, Malacath willing. Bring the book, and I'll show you how an Orc learns to smith.

name: Last Goodbyes
objective: take Bera's necklace to Runil, and return to Morwen
first_tasks: give Bera's necklace to Runil and tell him that Morwen sent you

quest_giver.name: Morwen
quest_giver.description: a Skaal woman born in Skyrim

reward.description: Morwen will do what she can

characters.name: Bera
characters.description: Morwen's mother, a Skaal

characters.name: Runil
characters.description: a male Priest

groups.name: Skaal
groups.description: a friendly tribe of people living on a cold, remote island

tools: Bera left the Skaal village to return to Skyrim with her love: Morwen's father, a sailor from Skyrim
Morwen thinks that Bera would like her necklace be placed upon her grave in Falkreath
description:
My mother, Bera, was Skaal, but she left the village and I was born in Skyrim. A trade ship from Skyrim struck ice off the coast near the village, and the Skaal took in the surviving sailors. My mother fell in love with one of the sailors - my father - and eventually returned with him to Skyrim.
I came across a few of my mother's old things not long ago. Among them was a necklace that my father gave to her when they were married. I believe she would want it placed upon her tombstone in Falkreath, as a symbol of her undying love and the great sacrifice she made for it.
If you find yourself in Falkreath, please give this amulet to the priest Runil and tell him that I sent you. He will understand. I don't have much to give in reward, but return to me when the task is done and I'll do what I can. Thank you, Skaal-friend.

name: Silver Lining
objective: recover Endon's stolen silver mold for him
first_tasks: find Endon's stolen silver mold

first_task_locations.name: Pinewatch
first_task_locations.description: a small cottage, and a bandit hideout

reward.description: Endon will pay the player well
Endon becomes an ally to the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Rigel Strong-Arm
characters.description: a male bandit

groups.name: Thieves Guild
groups.description: a guild of thieves rising in power in Markarth

tools: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Endon ordered a silver mold from Valenwood: it was stolen by a group of bandits led by Rigel Strong-Arm
the authorities told Endon that their resources were spread too thin right now
description:
Several months ago I ordered a special silver mold from some artisans in Valenwood. Well, it never arrived. Later I found out that it was robbed by a group of bandits led by someone named Rigel Strong-Arm.
Look, I talked to everyone with an ounce of authority... everyone. They all told me their resources were spread too thin right now. Word on the street says that the Thieves Guild is coming back into its own in Markarth so I figured... ...to send a thief to steal back what was stolen.
Look, this mold is irreplaceable. I'll pay you well for its return and I can also prove to be quite a valuable ally to the Thieves Guild.  The only thing I can tell you is that the mold was taken to the bandit's hideout... a small cottage called Pinewatch.
I'm not sure how many men they have inside, but I trust that won't be an issue for you. Good luck.

name: Silenced Tongues
objective: unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
first_tasks: find the two hidden keys

quest_giver.name: Heddic Volunnar
quest_giver.description: a scholar, giving quest via "Heddic's Volunruud Notes"

items.name: "Heddic's Volunruud Notes"
items.description: notes on Heddic Volunnar's research on Volunruud

items.name: Okin and Eduj
items.description: favored weapons when Tongue Chieftain Kvenel went into battle

characters.name: Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
characters.description: an ancient warrior, and a forefather of Heddic Volunnar

tools: Heddic Volunnar is scouting out Volunruud: the relief not far from the entrance hides Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb
the two hidden keys to Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb are ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj
description:
Heddic's Volunruud Notes
by Heddic Volunnar

I was skeptical, but it's obvious now. The old hymns had truth to them! The relief wasn't far from the entrance, just as they said. I've no doubt now that it hides the entrance to Kvenel's tomb.
The two keys must be hidden somewhere nearby - ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj, favored weapons when Kvenel went into battle. I don't dare explore further without hiring bodyguards to accompany me, however. To think - The Tongue Chieftain Kvenel could be entombed behind just a few feet of stone! The ancestor we scarcely believed was real.
Twice damned for planning this foolish scouting trip. I should have hired those sellswords in the first place. Perhaps there's no need. This place is just a tomb, after all, and there are no obvious signs of habitation. It isn't as though the thousand-year dead will mind if I have a look around.

name: The Gift of Beastblood
objective: meet Skjor in the Underforge tonight
first_tasks: let Skjor show you the way to the hidden door to the Underforge

quest_giver.name: Skjor
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Companions

reward.description: the gift of lycanthropy

characters.name: Eorlund
characters.description: a famous blacksmith

tools: NONE
description:
I have something a little different planned this time. But it's not for everyone to hear. Meet me in the Underforge tonight.
Oh yes, you don't yet know where the Underforge is. I forget that you've never seen it. Beneath the Skyforge, where Eorlund works.
All I say is that you will receive a gift. A gift that will join your spirit with the beast world, friend.
The door to the Underforge is hidden, but I will show you the way.  We will speak more.

name: Siege on the Dragon Cult
objective: recover the Dragon Cult leader's mask for Captain Valmir
first_tasks: find the Dragon Cult leader's mask

first_task_locations.name: Forelhost
first_task_locations.description: the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult

quest_giver.name: Captain Valmir
quest_giver.description: an officer of the Imperial Legion

reward.description: Captain Valmir will pay the player

groups.name: Dragon Cult
groups.description: cultists who were among the first men to arrive from Atmora, they worshiped certain animals, like dragons, as avatars of the gods

tools: the general sent Captain Valmir to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort
dragons granted terrible power to the Dragon Cult for their bloody sacrifices: they were swept out during the dragon war because of their cruelty
description:
You there! As an officer of the Imperial Legion, I require your assistance to complete my mission.
The General has sent me to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort. This was the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult, and their leader's mask was reported to be quite powerful.
They were among the first men to arrive from Atmora and they worshiped certain animals as avatars of the Gods; Dragons being foremost. And for their bloody sacrifices, the Dragons gifted their priests with terrible power. But their cruelty was too great for men to bear, and they rose up in what would be called the Dragon War and the Cult swept from the land.
I'll pay for the Dragon Cult leader's mask. Get in there, find the mask, return it to me, and earn your pay.

name: The Silence Has Been Broken
objective: accept Amaund Motierre's assassination contract
first_tasks: take the sealed letter and the valuable amulet to your superior in the Dark Brotherhood

items.name: Black Sacrament
items.description: a dark ritual to obtain the services of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: the player, a member of the Dark Brotherhood, came to see Amaund Motierre after he had performed the Black Sacrament
Amaund Motierre wants to arrange several assassination contracts with the Dark Brotherhood, leading to the assassination of the emperor
Amaund Motierre gives the player two items: a sealed letter that will explain everything that needs to be done, and a valuable amulet - the player can use it to pay for any and all expenses
description:
By the almighty Divines. You've come. You've actually come. This dreadful Black Sacrament thing... it worked.
Well, I won't waste your time. I would like to arrange a contract. Several, actually. I daresay, the work I'm offering has more significance than anything your organization has experienced in, well, centuries.
As I said, I want you to kill several people. You'll find the targets, as well as their manners of elimination, quite varied. I'm sure someone of your disposition will probably even find it enjoyable. But you should know that these killings are but a means to an end. For they pave the way to the most important target. The real reason I'm speaking with a cutthroat in the bowels of this detestable crypt. For I seek the assassination of... ...the Emperor.
What I ask is no small thing, of course. But you represent the Dark Brotherhood. This is... what you do? No? You must understand. So much has led to this day. So much planning, and maneuvering. Now, it's as if the very stars have finally aligned. But I digress. Here, take these two items. They need to be delivered to your, um... superior. The sealed letter will explain everything that needs to be done. The amulet is quite valuable - you can use it to pay for any and all expenses.

name: Shiv
objective: obtain a shiv from Grisvar the Unlucky
first_tasks: bring Duach's bottle of Skooma to Grisvar the Unlucky

reward.description: a shiv

characters.name: Duach
characters.description: a male prisoner

locations.name: Skooma
locations.description: a drug made from moon sugar

tools: the player told Grisvar the Unlucky that they want protection
description:
Ah, you want protection? I can get you what you need. Maybe you can do something for me, first?
Duach has a bottle of Skooma. Finest distilled Moon Sugar. I'm shaking just thinking about it.
Get that bottle of Skooma, and I'll have a shiv ready for you. Promise you won't ever use it on me, okay?

name: The Shill Job
objective: frame Carlotta Valentia to get her out of the way
first_tasks: place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Carlotta Valentia
characters.description: a woman who pissed off the wrong person

tools: the Thieves Guild gets rid of people without killing them, unlike the Dark Brotherhood
description:
When a client needs us to eliminate another, we don't operate like the Dark Brotherhood. We find alternate means to get them out of the way.
We send you to plant some phony evidence in the mark's house, and then tip off the town guard... the rest takes care of itself. Sound like you can handle it?
Go place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home. She must have ticked-off our client badly. The client's impatient and keeps asking if the job's done. Can you get him off my back?

name: Shalidor's Insights
objective: bring the writings of Shalidor to Urag gro-Shub
first_tasks: discover the writings of Shalidor

quest_giver.name: Urag gro-Shub
quest_giver.description: a librarian who can translate the writings of Shalidor

reward.description: the writings of Shalidor may prove useful

characters.name: Shalidor
characters.description: a immensely powerful male mage in the first era

tools: Shalidor holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study
description:
Have you ever heard of Shalidor? Immensely powerful mage, back in the First Era. Had an understanding of magic few have ever matched. He holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study. Wrote more than you would imagine possible.
Since then, his writings have been scattered all over Skyrim, but are little use to anyone who can't translate them. I'm one of the few who can. I'm always trying to find more of Shalidor's writings.
I've heard whispers of more of his work having turned up. If you can track it down, it may prove useful to all of us.

name: Search and Seizure
objective: find evidence of Ogmund the Skald's Talos worship for Ondolemar
first_tasks: break into Ogmund the Skald's home

characters.name: Ogmund the Skald
characters.description: an old, respected man

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: a mortal man who ascended to godhood

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

groups.name: Thalmor
groups.description: an elven organization that denies the godhood of Talos and tries to root put Talos worship

tools: the player asked Ondolemar what he is doing in Markarth
Ondolemar knows that Ogmund the Skald worships Talos in his home: the Jarl of Markarth refuses to arrest Ogmund the Skald
description:
I was sent here to lead the Thalmor's interests in this corner of the world. It's my mission to root out all Talos worship in this city.
You're awfully inquisitive, aren't you? I like that. Perhaps you'd care to solve a little problem I'm having? Ogmund the Skald. He's old, respected, and I know for a fact that he worships Talos in his home. But the Jarl has been hesitant to call for his arrest. I want you to break in to his home and find evidence.

name: Served Cold
objective: search Raven Rock and root out traitors who want to assassinate Councilor Morvayn
first_tasks: talk to Geldis Sadri and check out any leads he provides you

quest_giver.name: Adril Arano
quest_giver.description: the second councilor of Raven Rock, and a loyal underling of Councilor Morvayn

characters.name: Councilor Morvayn
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Raven Rock, a member of House Redoran

characters.name: Geldis Sadri
characters.description: a knowledgeable barkeeper

groups.name: House Hlaalu
groups.description: a dishonorable great house, rivals of House Redoran

groups.name: Ulen Family
groups.description: a family belonging to House Hlaalu

tools: the player has helped Raven Rock before
the Ulen Family has placed a deathmark on Councilor Morvayn's head
description:
After everything you've already done for Raven Rock, I hate to ask for more but I can't risk Councilor Morvayn being killed.
The Ulen Family of House Hlaalu, a rival Great House, has placed a deathmark on the Councilor's head. I need you to start out by being my eyes and ears... search Raven Rock and see if you can root out these traitors.
The best place to start would be Geldis Sadri over at the Retching Netch Cornerclub. If he provides you any leads, check them out before bringing them to my attention. I can't afford to make any mistakes.

name: A Scroll For Anska
objective: help Anska find a scroll about her family legend
first_tasks: defeat Vokun, a powerful old priest buried here, with Anska

characters.name: Vokun
characters.description: a powerful old male priest who was buried long ago

characters.name: Ysgramor
characters.description: a famous male hero of old

tools: Anska's family legend states that they are descendants of Ysgramor
description:
I'm Anska. Are you here to help?
I've finally located Vokun's crypt! The scroll I'm looking for just has to be here. Maybe you could help find it, I just know it's in here.
Vokun is some old priest buried here long ago. I've been searching for his tomb for a few years now. If Vokun is as powerful as I think, I may need a little help um... dealing with him. With the two of us this should be easy.
You can have anything except the scroll of course. It's probably meaningless to you, but according to family legend it links our bloodline back to Ysgramor himself.

name: Sealing the Deal
objective: help Talen-Jei complete Keerava's wedding ring
first_tasks: find three flawless amethysts for Keerava's wedding ring

quest_giver.name: Talen-Jei
quest_giver.description: an Argonian man who wants to marry Keerava

characters.name: Keerava
characters.description: a female Argonian

groups.name: Argonians
groups.description: a race of people from Black Marsh

tools: in Black Marsh, tradition dictates Argonians present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent their future bond: Talen-Jei already has a gold band for Keerava's wedding ring
description:
I met Keerava when I wandered into Riften a few years ago. Been smitten with her ever since. In fact, I'm thinking of asking her to marry me.
In Black Marsh, tradition dictates we present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent our future bond. I already have the gold band, but all I need are three flawless amethysts to complete the setting.

name: Scare My Enemy
objective: assault someone for Idolaf Battle-Born
first_tasks: talk to Idolaf Battle-Born

quest_giver.name: Idolaf Battle-Born
quest_giver.description: a man, giving quest via "Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born"

reward.description: Idolaf Battle-Born will pay the player

characters.name: Nazeem
characters.description: a punchable man

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: the player

items.name: "Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born"
items.description: a letter to the player from Idolaf Battle-Born

tools: Idolaf Battle-Born saw the player assault Nazeem
description:
Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born
by Idolaf Battle-Born

Dragonborn,
