I'm aware of your recent assault on Nazeem. Rest assured I have no interest in that particular matter. I do, however, have an interest in your willingness to employ force when the need arises.
If you are able to assist me, I will gladly pay you for your troubles.
Next time you are visiting Whiterun, please call on me.
Sincerely, Idolaf Battle-Born

name: The Savior of Selveni Nethri
objective: help Selveni Nethri escape from Southfringe Sanctum
first_tasks: escort Selveni Nethri outside

first_task_locations.name: Southfringe Sanctum
first_task_locations.description: the home of Bashnag's dangerous coven

characters.name: Bashnag
characters.description: a skilled male necromancer

tools: the player saved Selveni Nethri from a spiders' web
Selveni Nethri was a member of Bashnag's coven, but they chased her out and left her for dead
description:
Thanks for getting me out of that. Bashnag's coven chased me out and left me for dead down here. Nobody lasts too long with the spiders.
Please, will you help me get out of here? If the coast is clear, I'll make a break for it. We - well 'they', Bashnag's circle of mages, live here. They made it pretty clear that I'm no longer welcome. These are no dainty college mages. Bashnag has the skill of a magister and the mind of a warlord.
This is a dangerous bunch. They're good company if you want to study necromancy in peace, though.

name: Season Unending
objective: negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius
first_tasks: ask the Greybeards hold a peace council

first_task_locations.name: High Hrothgar
first_task_locations.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards, and neutral territory to both sides of the war

quest_giver.name: Balgruuf the Greater
quest_giver.description: the nobleman who rules over Whiterun

reward.description: Jarl Balgruuf the Greater will help the player

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the man leading one side of the war

characters.name: General Tullius
characters.description: the man leading the other side of the war

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: the player

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: an order of respected, wise old men

tools: the player asked Balgruuf the Greater to help the player trap a dragon in Whiterun: Ulfric and General Tullius want to capture Whiterun
getting both sides of war to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point
description:
I want to help you, Dragonborn. And I will. But I need your help first.
Ulfric and General Tullius are both just waiting for me to make a wrong move. Do you think they will sit idle while a dragon is slaughtering my men and burning my city? No. I can't risk weakening the city while we are under the threat of enemy attack. I'm sorry.
If only you could negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius. Then I would be glad to help you with your mad dragon-trapping scheme. But getting both sides to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point. The bitterness has gone too deep. Maybe... hmm... what of the Greybeards? They are respected by everyone. High Hrothgar is neutral territory. If the Greybeards were willing to host a peace council... then maybe Ulfric and Tullius would have to listen.

name: Scoundrel's Folly
objective: squeeze Gulum-Ei for information
first_tasks: find Gulum-Ei

quest_giver.name: Mercer Frey
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Gulum-Ei
characters.description: a male Thieves Guild informant within the East Empire Company

characters.name: Brynjolf
characters.description: a male member of the Thieves Guild

locations.name: Goldenglow Estate
locations.description: an estate that used to send protection money to the Thieves Guild

tools: Gulum-Ei acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate: he can finger the buyer
the player should talk to Brynjolf before they leave if they have any questions
description:
Ah, there you are. I have a job for you.
Gulum-Ei is our inside man at the East Empire Company in Solitude. I'm betting he acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate and that he can finger our buyer.
Get out there, shake him down and see what you come up with. Talk to Brynjolf before you leave if you have any questions.

name: Sanuarach Mine
objective: help Ainethach keep Sanuarach Mine
first_tasks: convince sellswords to leave

quest_giver.name: Ainethach
quest_giver.description: the owner of the Sanuarach Mine in Karthwasten

groups.name: Silver-Bloods
groups.description: a greedy, rich family of mine owners

tools: the Silver-Bloods are trying to get hold of Sanuarach Mine
sellswords showed up after Forsworn attacked Sanuarach Mine: sellswords won't let anyone work until Ainethach sells it off
description:
The Silver-Bloods are trying to muscle in on my land. Forsworn attack the mines, and suddenly all these sellswords show up in Karthwasten to 'help.' They won't let anyone work until I sell it off.
You can try to convince them to leave, but I'd keep your sword-arm ready if things get ugly.

name: Salty Sea-Dogs
objective: bring Fine-Cut Void Salts back to Captain Wayfinder
first_tasks: find the Fine-Cut Void Salts

reward.description: good gold

tools: Captain Wayfinder's mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house
Captain Wayfinder's sailors lost their last trade, Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold, after getting drunk
description:
I am a sea captain by inheritance, as my men are fond of saying. Can't blame them, my mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house.
I've been trying to find new areas of business, trying to win the sailors' respect, but I keep having problems. Take the last trade we did. Some Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold. Plenty of coin if you know who to sell it to.
What happened to the Salts? Sailors are what happened to them. They got drunk and ended up losing the merchandise in some cave. If you're not afraid of little exploring, I'll pay good gold to get those Salts.

name: Sanctuary
objective: begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
first_tasks: find the entrance to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, and answer "Silence, my brother." when questioned by the black door

first_task_locations.description: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's guildmaster in the Dark Brotherhood

items.name: "Silence, my brother."
items.description: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

locations.name: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
locations.description: the headquarters of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: Astrid officially welcomes the player to the Dark Brotherhood
description:
I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family: the Dark Brotherhood.
In the southwest reaches of the realm, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins.
I'll see you at home.

name: Salt for Arcadia
objective: deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
first_tasks: give the frost salts to Arcadia, the local alchemist

reward.description: Arcadia will provide something

characters.name: Arcadia
characters.description: a female alchemist

tools: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire whether he is the only wizard in Whiterun: Farengar Secret-Fire is the only wizard, but Whiterun is also home to a priest, a priestess, and alchemist, and others
description:
I believe I am, yes. Technically speaking, of course. The city is also home to a priest, a priestess, an alchemist, and I'm sure others who practice. Ah, that reminds me. Speaking of alchemists, I have some frost salts for Arcadia. She asked me to obtain them for one of her potions.
Would you be so kind as to deliver the frost salts for me? I'm sure Arcadia will provide some form of recompense…

name: Rogatus's Letter
objective: deliver a letter to Leontius
first_tasks: find Leontius

first_task_locations.name: Old Hroldan Inn
first_task_locations.description: and old inn to the south

quest_giver.name: Rogatus Salvius
quest_giver.description: a farmer who does not think highly of Leontius

reward.description: the player should make sure that Leontius tips them

characters.name: Leontius
characters.description: Rogatus Salvius' son, a drunk

tools: Rogatus Salvius does no think highly of his son
description:
My boy Leontius lives in Old Hroldan. Old inn to the south.
Damn drunk. The oaf doesn't even bother to visit these days. What am I supposed to do if the dragons burn down the farm?
You're a traveler, right? I have this letter for him. Let him know how much of a failure he is. You make sure the lug tips you when he gets it.

name: Rising at Dawn
objective: return to Falion with a filled black soul gem, and he will perform a vampirism cure ritual
first_tasks: get a black soul gem, and fill it by killing someone

quest_giver.name: Falion
quest_giver.description: a great mage who knows many things

reward.description: the player's vampirism will be cured

characters.name: Agni
characters.description: a young girl, and Falion's ward

tools: the player is a vampire
Falion has considered becoming a vampire himself, but that would endanger Agni
description:
I know many things. I have studied things beyond the reach of most humans, traveled the other planes, seen things one should not see.
I have met gods and long-dead races of people and everything in between and I know enough to see a vampire where others would see a man. I met several of your kind during my studies of life-extending magics. I even considered becoming a vampire myself. In the end, vampirism would endanger my ward Agni which would defeat the intended purpose.
It is possible to cure vampirism. I know of a ritual but I've never performed it. It requires a filled black soul gem. You will need to kill someone. When you have a gem and have filled it return to me and I will perform the ritual. I will bring life to your dead body, vampire.

name: Ringmaker
objective: gather jewelry materials for Madesi
first_tasks: get two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore
tools: Madesi is one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remain in Tamriel
description:
I make my own jewelry. Sadly, I'm one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remains in Tamriel; it's becoming a lost art. Only trouble is gathering materials has become hazardous. The roads to the mines and to the other cities are thick with bandits... and worse.
Would you be interested in gathering some materials for me? I'd certainly be happy to compensate you. I'm seeking a small list of items to complete my next creation: two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore.

name: Rjorn's Drum
objective: retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
first_tasks: find the drum

quest_giver.name: Giraud Gemane
quest_giver.description: a bard of the Bards College, and a former soldier

reward.description: Giraud Gemane teaches the player combat skills

characters.name: Rjorn
characters.description: the most famous battle drummer of the second age, a man

characters.name: Halldir
characters.description: a long-dead male ruler

tools: Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there
description:
They found it! They actually found Rjorn's drum!
You don't know who Rjorn is? You're joking, right? Rjorn? Only the most famous battle drummer of the second age. Well, famous among bards at least. That drum has been in half a dozen famous battles. It's a priceless artifact.
Nobody knows where he died, and therefore where his drum might be. Halldir was the missing link. Rjorn was always looking for new stories to tell. It seems he was writing a lay about Halldir when he vanished. Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there.
Now all I need to do is find someone to get it. Wait. You. You could do it. I need you to get me that drum. The college treasury is a bit thin right now. But I can show you some tricks I learned from my days with the army.

name: Rise in the East
objective: help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
first_tasks: steal Suvaris Atheron's logbook and bring it to Orthus Endario

quest_giver.name: Orthus Endario
quest_giver.description: an employee of the East Empire Company
quest_giver.location: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm

characters.name: Suvaris Atheron
characters.description: a female dark elf, and the meticulous overseer of the Shatter-Shields' shipping operation

groups.name: Shatter-Shields
groups.description: a powerful family in Windhelm that run a private shipping operation at the docks

tools: pirates have been raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell: the East Empire Company's security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in the war
description:
Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started. Pirates, you see. Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell.
Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war. We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.
Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe. They are a very powerful family here in Windhelm. They run a private shipping operation, and would love to have the docks to themselves. Wouldn't surprise me if they were in league with the pirates, somehow.
Not yet, no. But perhaps an intrepid person such as yourself could help with that. They have a dark elf who oversees their operations. Suvaris Atheron. She's meticulous to a fault, and keeps a logbook with every transaction she makes.
If you get me the logbook, I'll have proof of Shatter-Shield's treachery.

name: Return to Grace
objective: convince Svari's mother to go to temple
first_tasks: talk to Svari's mother

characters.name: Roggvir
characters.description: Svari's uncle

tools: Roggvir died: Svari's mother took his death hard
description:
Mum doesn't say much since Uncle Roggvir died. She doesn't even go to temple anymore. I wish she would. At least that way she'd have people to talk to.
Maybe you could convince her. You should go do it right now.

name: Retrieval
objective: retrieve a piece of Wuuthrad
first_tasks: find the group of Silver Hand who have the piece of Wuuthrad

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the companions

groups.name: Silver Hand
groups.description: a bandit gang who hate the Companions

tools: NONE
description:
The Silver Hand has been scouring the world for more pieces of Wuuthrad. A group of their members has managed to secure one of the pieces.
They have gone hidden out in Eastmarch, somewhere inside Cragslane Cavern. The piece of Wuuthrad should be there with them.
Get that piece of Wuuthrad back, for the honor of us all.

name: Revealing the Unseen
objective: learn the location of the Staff of Magnus
first_tasks: find the members of the Synod
tools: the Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim: the Synod will not be cooperative
description:
The Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim. They inquired about the ruins of Mzulft, but that's all I remember.
It sounded like they were heading there, though they were rather secretive about why. I suppose if you're intent on looking for the staff, there's a chance they might be in Mzulft yet. Just don't expect them to be cooperative.

name: Restoration Ritual
objective: learn more about restoration magic from the Augur
first_tasks: talk with the Augur, who's expecting you

quest_giver.name: Colette Marence
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the College of Winterhold

reward.description: the player will learn more about restoration

characters.name: Augur
characters.description: a powerful male mage gifted in restoration

tools: the player is a devoted student of restoration: most mages of the College of Winterhold look down on restoration magic
description:
Look at you. Such a devoted student of Restoration. It's comforting to see that not everyone has dismissed it as entirely as most members of the College. Truly comforting.
It looks like you're ready to speak with the Augur. He was a brilliant mage. Truly inspired. Mastered spells others could barely comprehend. He was especially gifted when it came to Restoration.
The Augur's... Well, he's very particular about who shares the knowledge. So you'll need his approval first. Go on, go talk to him. I'm sure he's been paying attention, and will be expecting you.

name: Restocking Soul Gems
objective: bring 7 Common Soul Gems to Sergius Turrianus
first_tasks: find 7 Common Soul Gems
tools: NONE
description:
I need some more supplies. Can you help out with that?
I'm running low on Common Soul Gems. Bring me another seven of them, if you can.

name: Retaking Thirsk
objective: help Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors retake Thirsk Mead Hall
first_tasks: fight Rieklings with Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors

first_task_locations.name: Thirsk Mead Hall
first_task_locations.description: a mead hall, the home of Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors, up there on the hill

quest_giver.name: Bujold the Unworthy
quest_giver.description: the leader of the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall

enemies.name: Rieklings
enemies.description: tenacious creatures that attack people in large packs

tools: the player asked Bujold the Unworthy what is going on here
description:
What's going on here is that we've been kicked out of our home. The Thirsk Mead Hall, up there on the hill. We were... some Rieklings have taken it over.
Rieklings overcame us with tenacity and numbers. Didn't help that we'd grown a little too comfortable up there. Too much mead. Too many stories. Too few battles.
Are you... offering to help? Some new blood should be enough to rouse these layabouts to actually fight again.

name: Rescue Mission
objective: rescue a kidnapped citizen
first_tasks: find the kidnapped citizen

first_task_locations.name: Faldar's Tooth
first_task_locations.description: a bandit lair in the Rift

quest_giver.name: Vilkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

reward.description: good pay

tools: NONE
description:
We've received a desperate missive. A citizen of the Rift has been kidnapped.
The Companions have been asked for assistance, and we shall answer. Particularly when the pay is as good as this.
Get moving. Find the kidnapped citizen at Faldar's Tooth and save them. I shudder to think what might happen if you're too late.
Bring honor to the Companions and yourself.

name: Rescue from Fort Neugrad
objective: rescue Stormcloak soldiers from the Imperials, and capture Fort Neugrad
first_tasks: meet some fellow Stormcloaks, and find a way slip into Fort Neugrad

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

tools: NONE
description:
You're going to Fort Neugrad. The Imperials have some of our boys locked up there. But with a little luck, we can turn that to our advantage.
I've sent some men to scout out the area. Meet them near Fort Neugrad, see if you can't find a way to slip in the fort, free our men, and take over the fort. They'll never suspect an attack from the inside. This won't be easy. But that's why I'm sending you.
You got the grit to get this done?

name: Repentance
objective: help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
first_tasks: follow Illia to the top of the tower

first_task_locations.name: Darklight Tower
first_task_locations.description: a tower filled with witches and Hagravens, and Illia's former home

quest_giver.name: Illia
quest_giver.description: a repenting mage who has never killed an innocent person

tools: Illia just killed a female witch in front of the player
Illia and the witch were supposed to find a human sacrifice: the witch attacked Illia because Illia could not do it
description:
By the gods! I know this looks bad. Let me explain...
I called Darklight Tower home, now I know that was a mistake. I am, or was part of a coven serving the Hagravens that live there. So was she.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill. We needed a sacrifice for the Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things, Hagravens. I can't be a part of that. Gods, I can't run away from this.
I'm going up there to stop her. This cycle must end. I don't know what brought you here, but I could use your help, if you're willing. Follow me. We have to fight our way up the Tower. I don't think anyone else here is about to have a change of heart.

name: Reparations
objective: make reparations for breaking the Thieves Guild rules
first_tasks: pay 1,000 gold to Vex for readmittance to the Thieves Guild

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: the player's passive-aggressive superior in the Thieves Guild

reward.description: restored membership of the Thieves Guild

tools: NONE
description:
I'm going to make this short and sweet, because frankly I don't think you deserve another shot. You've broken the rules and now you need to pay... and it's going to cost you quite a bit: 1,000 gold.
You claim to be a thief... act like one. Pick pockets, knock over houses... heck, I don't care if you have to bust into a palace. You do what you have to do to come up with the coin.
Anything you steal, you bring it straight to me. Now get out of here and don't come back until your pockets are full. Only then you're one of us again.

name: Pantea's Flute
objective: recover Pantea's flute for her
first_tasks: find the flute

reward.description: Pantea Ateia teaches the player magic skills

characters.name: Larina
characters.description: Pantea Ateia's foolish female student

tools: Larina stole Pantea's flute and sold it to a necromancer
description:
That damn fool! I should wring Larina's neck! That fool student of mine stole my flute and sold it to some necromancer in Hob's Fall Cave.
Apparently Larina told him some story about the flute being able to make the dead dance. It's just a flute. A really old and valuable flute, but just a flute. I just got a ransom note for it. That flute has been handed down for seventeen generations!
Well don't just stand there. Go get my flute! I don't have any money to give you. but I can show you a few tricks I learned playing for wizards.

name: Pain in the Necklace
objective: bring East Empire Pendants to Fethis Alor
first_tasks: find East Empire Pendants

first_task_locations.name: Solstheim
first_task_locations.description: an island with old East Empire Company mines

quest_giver.name: Fethis Alor
quest_giver.description: a merchant who used to sell East Empire Pendants

reward.description: Fethis Alor pays the player

items.name: East Empire Pendants
items.description: popular amulets that were made exclusively for the East Empire Company, a popular collectible

tools: the player asked Fethis Alor whether he sells special mining gear: he does not
description:
Mining gear? No. However, I used to sell East Empire Pendants until I ran out of them. Popular little item.
It's an amulet that was made exclusively for the East Empire Company. They gave them to their workers as an incentive at one point... a kind of reward for extra effort. They're no longer being made, so they've become collectible. I'd love to get my hands on a few of them.
They could be anywhere on the island. The mines might be a good place to start. If you find any while you're exploring Solstheim, bring them here and I'll pay you for them.

name: The Pale Lady
objective: Find out what happened in Frostmere Crypt
first_tasks: go deeper into Frostmere Crypt

first_task_locations.name: Frostmere Crypt
first_task_locations.description: a crypt that contains a whole forest with a big old monument out in the center

quest_giver.name: Eisa Blackthorn
quest_giver.description: a bandit from Kyr's gang, giving quest via "Eisa's Journal"

reward.name: Pale Blade
reward.description: a sword from Frostmere Crypt

characters.name: Kyr
characters.description: a male bandit leader

characters.name: Ra'jirr
characters.description: a tough male bandit

characters.name: Pale Lady
characters.description: a swamp lady who abducts children at night

tools: Kyr's bandit gang dug up Frostmere Crypt: Kyr took the Pale Blade from the monument within
Ra'jirr keeps muttering about a Pale Lady, who is going to kill all of Kyr's bandits if they do not return the Pale Blade
description:
Eisa's Journal
by Eisa Blackthorn

Night shift woke me to say they'd hit something big. Kyr, Ra'jirr, and I went down to take a look. It's huge, like a whole forest was just swallowed up by the earth, with a big old monument out in the center. Kyr took a sword from the monument as a trophy and dubbed it the "Pale Blade", proof his whole plan was finally paying off. For once, he might be right.

Ra'jirr's been having nightmares over the past few days. He keeps muttering about a "Pale Lady" - one of those swamp women who steal children away at night, I think. To think some fool story could turn the toughest bandit I know into a cowering kitten, frightened of his own shadow. I'm just glad none of the others see him like this.

It's getting worse. Ra'jirr can barely sleep at all now, and whenever he dozes off, he wakes up screaming - woke the whole place last night. He says the "Pale Lady" is coming for us - she's down in the forest, we have to return the sword or she'll kill us all. Not a chance - the boss clings to that thing like he was born with it. I've told everyone Ra'jirr just has a fever, but this can't go on. I've pulled a few things together. I'll slip out tonight and never look back.

name: Paid in Full
objective: recover the bonemold formula for Glover Mallory
first_tasks: find the bonemold formula

quest_giver.name: Glover Mallory
quest_giver.description: a Breton man, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

reward.description: some coin

characters.name: Esmond Tyne
characters.description: a Breton man

tools: Esmond Tyne stole Glover Mallory's bonemold formula
Esmond Tyne talked about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag
description:
Eager to make some coin, eh? That's the spirit. I'll tell you what. The Guild's got a problem out here that I've been trying to deal with for years, but haven't been able to handle.
A fellow Breton who went by the name Esmond Tyne showed up on my doorstep about a fortnight ago. He stole something from me: my own formula for improved bonemold. Took me years to perfect.
Before he ran off, he was talking some nonsense about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag. I told him he was crazy to even think about talking to those vicious little buggers, but he wouldn't listen. I'd bet a fat purse of coin that he's either dead or hiding out up there.

name: The Path of Knowledge
objective: find the Black Book
first_tasks: go to Nchardak with Neloth

reward.name: Black Book
reward.description: a book that is connected with Miraak

characters.name: Miraak
characters.description: the player's male enemy

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an ancient, extinct race of people who were specialized in forbidden knowledge

tools: the Dwemer discovered the Black Book that is connected with Miraak
Neloth found the Dwemer's "reading room" in Nchardak: Neloth was not able to open the protective case where the Black Book is sealed
description:
I know where to find the Black Book connected with Miraak. I haven't been able to get it, though. But maybe together we can unlock the secrets the Dwemer left behind.
Forbidden knowledge was somewhat a specialty of the ancient Dwemer. It seems they discovered this book and took it to study. I have found their "reading room" in the ruins of Nchardak. The book is there, but it's sealed in a protective case which I wasn't able to open.
But perhaps the two of us together will be able to get the book. To Nchardak, then. Follow me.

name: Blood to the Blades!
objective: kill Paarthurnax
first_tasks: go to Paarthurnax

reward.description: further aid from the Blades

characters.name: Paarthurnax
characters.description: the leader of the Greybeards, who is actually a dragon

characters.name: Alduin
characters.description: an evil dragon

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: a group of wise old men who helped the player

tools: Paarthurnax was the right hand of Alduin, and responsible for many atrocities during the ancient dragon war
description:
I'm afraid there's a problem. A serious one. I've discovered who the Greybeards' leader really is.
He's a dragon. Not just any dragon, but the right hand of Alduin, responsible for many atrocities during the ancient Dragon War. It's true that his crimes are long in the past, but justice does not count the passage of years.
Justice demands that he, Paarthurnax, dies for his crimes. Until he is dead, I'm afraid my oath as a Blade prevents me from offering you aid and comfort.

name: Out of Balance
objective: remove pollution from the various points of focus for magic energies with specially enchanted gloves, and return the gloves to Drevis Neloren afterwards
first_tasks: find the focus points for magical energy
tools: the College of Winterhold has gone to great lengths to purify and enhance the natural energies of the world
description:
There may be a matter in which your... skills... could be useful. The various points of focus for magic energies around the College have become polluted, and need cleansing.
As you may be aware, the College has gone to great lengths to purify and enhance the natural energies of the world. This both enhances our connection to the realm of magic, and eliminates possible interference from outside sources. These energies, on occasion, become... polluted. Effort must be made to see that they are kept pure, clean.
These specially enchanted gloves will allow you to delve directly into the focal points for these energies. Go to each focal point and remove whatever impurities you may find there. Return the gloves to me when you have finished. Please exercise caution. This is not a procedure without possible... consequences.

name: Onmund's Request
objective: help Onmund get his amulet from Enthir
first_tasks: talk to Enthir about Onmund's amulet

characters.name: Enthir
characters.description: a shady merchant

tools: Onmund traded Enthir his amulet, but now Onmund wants his amulet back
description:
I need your help with something. Something private.
I may have entered into an... agreement with Enthir. He had something I needed, so I traded him something of mine.
It was a mistake, and now I want back what I gave him. It's an amulet that belonged to my family, and I never should've given it to Enthir. But he won't deal with me. Talk to him; see what it'll take to get my amulet back.

name: No Stone Unturned
objective: talk to Vex after collecting the 24 Stones of Barenziah
first_tasks: find the 24 Stones of Barenziah

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

reward.description: Vex buys the whole set of 24 Stones of Barenziah

items.name: Stone of Barenziah, Stones of Barenziah
items.description: gem stones that were pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks

characters.name: Barenziah
characters.description: a legendary queen

tools: the player showed a Stone of Barenziah to Vex for appraisal
description:
Been a while since I've seen one of those. What you've got there is a Stone of Barenziah. The stone was pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks.
I think there were twenty-four in all; supposedly, all of them are in Skyrim. Most people keep them as a curiosity. Some of the Guild members have tried to locate them over the years, but they haven't been successful... well, until now.
I only buy things I can turn around quickly for a profit. And no one wants those stones unless they have the whole set. Tell you what, if you find the rest of them, talk to me again. Otherwise, keep it and maybe it'll bring you luck.

name: No News Is Good News
objective: find out information about Fura from Captain Aldis
first_tasks: talk to Captain Aldis

characters.name: Fura
characters.description: Angeline Morrard's daughter

characters.name: Captain Aldis
characters.description: a male officer of the Imperial army

tools: Fura was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial army
description:
You're a traveler, correct? Have you been to Whiterun?
My daughter, Fura, was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial Army. I was hoping you might have met her. I haven't heard from her lately. I've tried talking to Captain Aldis but he hasn't been any help.
It would be very sweet of you to get more information about my daughter. Anything you can find out from Captain Aldis would be welcome news.

name: Nimhe, the Poisoned One
objective: kill Nimhe
first_tasks: locate Nimhe

quest_giver.name: Calcelmo
quest_giver.description: a stressful man, and the most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel

reward.description: access to Nchuand-Zel and Calcelmo's Dwemer museum

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct, ancient race of people

tools: the player asked Calcelmo to let the player inside his Dwemer museum: the Dwemer museum is a private place where Calcelmo can catalog his research
description:
You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?

name: An Ill Meeting
objective: make incense with Kesh the Clean
first_tasks: gather a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust for making the incense

reward.description: the player will be able to speak with Peryite

characters.name: Peryite
characters.description: the god of infection and pestilence

tools: the player asked Kesh the Clean about speaking with Peryite
deathbell grow in the frozen tundra
the player might find the ruby and silver in a mine
vampire dust comes from vampires
description:
Not everyone has the stomach required to entreat my Lord. He is the pus in the wound. Oh, proper ones curl their noses, but it's pus that drinks foul humors and restores the blood. But Kesh likes you, friend.
There is a way Peryite may speak to us who will take Him in. If you wish to commune with Him, we'll need the incense. Fetch for me a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust. Then I will show you how.
How to gather the ingredients? This one would try a shop. You might prefer the direct route, hm? Deathbell grow in the frozen tundra. You might nip into a mine for the ruby and silver. Vampire Dust is tricky. Vampires, you know.

name: The Only Cure
objective: kill Orchendor, and return to Peryite
first_tasks: find Orchendor

quest_giver.name: Peryite
quest_giver.description: the god of infection and pestilence

reward.description: a powerful token: a dwarven-made escutcheon, capable of shielding the player from both the spell and sword

characters.name: Orchendor
characters.description: Peryite's male elven monk

groups.name: Afflicted
groups.description: people from Breton villages who were infected with Peryite's plague

tools: Orchendor was sent to gather Afflicted to Bthardamz: Orchendor betrayed Peryite afterwards
description:
I have watched you for some time, you know. The decisions you've made intrigue me, and I wonder if you are the proper agent for a task of mine.
I sent a blessing to the world, a wasting plague that infected a scattering of Breton villages. One of my monks, the elf Orchendor, was sent to gather these Afflicted. He shepherded them into Bthardamz for me, but has since lost his way.
I will not stand for betrayal. I want you to go to Bthardamz and kill Orchendor, in my name. I can grant you a powerful token for this task. An escutcheon of dwarven make, capable of shielding you from both the spell and sword. Return when the elf lies dead and it will be yours.

name: A Drink to Win
objective: win the drinking contest against Sam Guevenne
first_tasks: start drinking with Sam Guevenne

reward.description: a staff

tools: NONE
description:
You look like someone who can hold their liquor. How about a friendly contest to win a staff?
Ha! So you think that I don't have a chance against you. We'll see about that. This is a special brew, very strong stuff. Let's get started.

name: A Night to Remember
objective: find Sam as you recover from a bad hangover
first_tasks: clean up the mess that you made, and apologize to Senna

reward.description: Senna will aid the player

characters.name: Sam
characters.description: the player's friend, a man

characters.name: Dibella
characters.description: the goddess of love and compassion

tools: Senna wakes the player up: the player does not remember anything about coming to the Temple of Dibella, blathering about marriage or a goat, and throwing trash all over the Temple of Dibella
description:
Wake up! That's right, it's time to wake up, you drunken blasphemer!
Of course! You don't remember getting here. I'm guessing you also don't remember coming in here and blathering incoherently about marriage or a goat. Which means you don't remember losing your temper and throwing trash all over the temple.
You want to know where your friend Sam has gone? Dibella teaches love and compassion, but that doesn't mean we're just going to tell you what you want to know and let you walk away from this. Pick up your mess, then apologize, and if we think you're sincere we'll consider lending you aid.

name: No One Escapes Cidhna Mine
objective: discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
first_tasks: talk to Braig: tell him that Madanach sent you, and ask him why he is in Cidhna Mine

quest_giver.name: Madanach
quest_giver.description: a Forsworn man, and a prisoner who tried to have the player killed in the past

reward.description: Madanach will help the player escape

characters.name: Braig
characters.description: a man who has been in Cidhna Mine the longest beside Madanach

groups.name: Forsworn
groups.description: an organization that opposes the current rulers of Markarth

tools: the player has been imprisoned in Cidhna Mine without any reason
description:
Well, well. Look at you. The authorities of Markarth have turned you into an animal. A wild beast caged up and left to go mad.
So, my fellow beast, what do you want? Answers about the Forsworn? Revenge for trying to have you killed? You're one of us now, you see? A slave. The boot of the false, unjust law stepping on your throat. Maybe if you understood that, I could help you.
There's a man named Braig inside these mines. Besides me, he's been here the longest. Tell him I sent you. Ask him why he's here. I want you to know how widespread the injustice of Markarth is. Then, we might discuss about an early pardon.

name: A New Debt
objective: help Drovas Relvi with his debt to Mogrul
first_tasks: pay Drovas Relvi's debt

reward.description: Mogrul will stop sending his debt collectors after the player

characters.name: Drovas Relvi
characters.description: a man the player recruited for Neloth, and thus became untouchable

characters.name: Neloth
characters.description: a powerful male wizard

tools: Drovas Relvi owes Mogrul 1,000 septims: Mogrul thinks that the player should pay Drovas Relvi's debt
description:
It seems you've inherited a problem. Drovas Relvi owes me 1,000 septims. At least he did until you set him up with that powerful wizard. Now he's untouchable. The way I figure it, it's your fault he can't pay me. So I guess I'm going to have to collect it from you.
And if you don't pay me? Nothing for now. But watch your back. I'll be sending collectors to find you. They won't ask so nicely. One way or the other, I'll get my money.
When you are tired of looking over your shoulder, you'll pay me.

name: Mourning Never Comes
objective: assassinate an ex-lover for Muiri
first_tasks: speak with Muiri, set up the contract with her, and fulfill it

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: Astrid will let the player keep whatever Muiri pays, as this is the player's first assassination contract

characters.name: Muiri
characters.description: the apothecary's female assistant

items.name: Black Sacrament
items.description: a ritual to employ the services of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: Muiri has performed the Black Sacrament
do whatever Muiri wishes, be professional, represent the Dark Brotherhood well, and get the job done
description:
Ah, there you are. We've got some business to discuss.
You must go to the city of Markarth, and speak with the apothecary's assistant. You'll probably find her in the shop, The Hag's Cure. The girl's been running her mouth, wants an ex-lover killed. She's apparently performed the Black Sacrament. Her name is Muiri. I need you to talk to her, set up the contract, and carry it out.
Just do whatever the contact wishes. Be professional, represent us well, and get the job done. Since it's your first contract, I'll let you keep whatever Muiri pays. She'll be generous, I'm sure. They always are.

name: Moss Mother Cavern
objective: help Valdr avenge his fallen friends
first_tasks: kill 3 Spriggans with Valdr

characters.name: Ari
characters.description: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a woman

characters.name: Niels
characters.description: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a man

tools: Valdr, Ari and Niels tracked a bear to Moss Mother Cavern: Spriggans appeared and killed Ari and Niels
description:
Name's Valdr. I hunt out of Falkreath.
We tracked a bear to this den, Moss Mother Cavern. Good coin for those pelts. We had the big sow cornered when they showed up. Three of them, out of nowhere. Spriggans.
Niels went down before we even knew to run. Ari died just inside. I never even thought the things were real. But now what? I can't just walk away. Not with my friends' bodies in there, being torn apart by those beasts.
You would help me clear out the Spriggans? You'd do that for a stranger? I don't know what to say. Lead on, I suppose.

name: A New Source of Stalhrim
objective: find Baldor Iron-Shaper
first_tasks: search for any sign of Baldor

quest_giver.name: Deor Woodcutter
quest_giver.description: a Skaal man in a bad mood

reward.description: the Skaal would be grateful

characters.name: Baldor Iron-Shaper
characters.description: a Skaal man, the only blacksmith in the Skaal village

groups.name: Skaal
groups.description: a secluded tribe of hospitable people

tools: Baldor Iron-Shaper is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim
Deor Woodcutter saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them in the woods on the day Baldor Iron-Shaper disappeared: the elves went south and west
description:
I am in no mood to talk, outsider. One of the Skaal has gone missing. It is Baldor Iron-Shaper. As our only smith, Baldor is very important to the village.
Baldor is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. It is an art we Skaal hold sacred. If someone wanted to make such weapons, they would have to get that knowledge from Baldor.
I did see something in the woods on the day he disappeared. I saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them. Hunters often visit our lands, so I thought little of it.
The elves went south and west. If your road takes you that way, perhaps you could search for any sign of Baldor. The Skaal would be grateful.

name: Mistwatch
objective: help Christer locate Fjola
first_tasks: look for Fjola

first_task_locations.name: Mistwatch
first_task_locations.description: a tower hosting a bandit hideout

reward.description: some coin

characters.name: Fjola
characters.description: Christer's missing wife

tools: the player stumbled upon Christer while exploring Mistwatch
Christer heard that bandits in Mistwatch ransom captives and thinks that Fjola might be one of them: he managed to sneak in and look for Fjola, but he is not a warrior
Christer gives the player a key that will come in handy
description:
Please, stranger! I need your help! Divine mercy - you aren't one of the bandits. Please, you've got to help me!
It's my wife, Fjola! I think she's being held in this tower. Let me explain. Fjola, my wife, left the farm on errands and never came back. It's been months, and I've been searching for her since. I heard a rumor that these bandits were ransoming captives, so I thought she may be here. I managed to sneak past the guards and get this far, but... I don't think I can go on. I'm no warrior! Please, can you look for her?
I don't have much, but I can give you some coin for the trouble. One of the guards dropped this key while I hid. I wager it will come in handy for you. Please hurry!

name: Mine or Yours
objective: help Filnjar by clearing out spiders from the Redbelly Mine
first_tasks: kill the spiders

reward.description: money

characters.name: Grogmar
characters.description: a male miner

tools: the spiders of Redbelly Mine almost killed Grogmar and Filnjar
description:
Sorry, the Redbelly Mine's dry right now. What's wrong with the mine, you might ask. It's full of spiders, that's what's wrong with it!
Almost killed Grogmar and me when they showed up. I'm worried that they'll come out of the mine looking for food soon... then we're in even bigger trouble.
You'd  clear them out for us? Tell you what. Keep to your word, and I'll line your pockets with as much as I can scrape up.

name: Missing In Action
objective: find Thorald
first_tasks: talk to Fralia Gray-Mane privately about the Battle-Borns and their lies

characters.name: Thorald
characters.description: Fralia Gray-Mane's missing son

groups.name: Battle-Borns
groups.description: an influential family that supports the Empire

tools: Fralia Gray-Mane was told that Thorald was killed in the war against the Empire, but she knows that Thorald is alive: the Battle-Borns know that too
description:
All I can think about is my son, my Thorald... they say that he was killed, but I know better. I know my son is alive! Those Battle-Borns... they're in with the Imperials. They know it too, and yet they lie to my very face!
It's not wise to discuss how I know about their lies here. Please, if you truly wish to help, meet me at my home. I'll tell you the whole story.

name: Message to Whiterun
objective: make a delivery for Ulfric
first_tasks: deliver an axe to Balgruuf the Greater

quest_giver.name: Ulfric
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Stormcloaks, a man

characters.name: Balgruuf the Greater
characters.description: the Jarl of Whiterun, a man who has stayed neutral in the war between the Stormcloaks and the Empire

tools: if Balgruuf the Greater keeps the axe, Ulfric will bide his time
if Balgruuf the Greater returns the axe to the player, it means war
description:
I'm glad you're here. I have a message I need delivered to the Jarl of Whiterun. Deliver this axe to Balgruuf the Greater.
Men who understand each other often have no need for words. There are but a few simple truths behind one warrior giving another his axe. Balgruuf will know my meaning.
Give the man my axe. If he keeps it, I will bide my time. If he returns it to you, it means war.

name: The Mind of Madness
objective: gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
first_tasks: talk to Una or Erdi about entering the Pelagius Wing

first_task_locations.name: Blue Palace
first_task_locations.description: the large palace of the local ruler

quest_giver.name: Dervenin
quest_giver.description: a man who has been abandoned by his master

reward.description: Dervenin's master will repay the player: it will be worth any inconveniences

characters.name: Una
characters.description: a maid

characters.name: Erdi
characters.description: a maid

locations.name: Pelagius Wing
locations.description: a forbidden wing of the Blue Palace

tools: Dervenin's master says that Dervenin is interrupting his vacation
without Dervenin's master's guidance, Dervenin's homeland is falling apart
Dervenin's master went into the Pelagius Wing to talk with an old friend
Dervenin gives the player a hip bone: the player can't enter Pelagius Wing without it
description:
My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind. Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against the south! We need his return. Oh, but... I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the local ruler. No, no... such people are below him. No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea. Oh and you'll need the hip bone... it's very important. No entering Pelagius Wing without that.
The doors to the Pelagius Wing are locked. But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?

name: A Decisive Message
objective: deliver a sensitive intelligence message for General Tullius
first_tasks: deliver the message to Jarl Baalgruf

quest_giver.name: General Tullius
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Imperial Legion

characters.name: Jarl Baalgruf
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Whiterun

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the male leader of the Stormcloaks

tools: Ulfric has raised enough men to attack Whiterun, but Jarl Baalgruf refuses the Imperial Legion's support: the message should convince Jarl Baalgruf
description:
I need someone I can trust to deliver a message of great import to Jarl Baalgruf of Whiterun.
We have it on good authority that Ulfric has raised enough men to attack the city of Whiterun. The Jarl, however, refuses the Legion's support. This missive should convince him.
Be aware soldier, these documents contain sensitive intelligence for the Jarl's eyes only.

name: Meet the Family
objective: speak with some fellow members of the Thieves Guild and pick up your new armor
first_tasks: talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex and Tonilia for your armor

quest_giver.name: Brynjolf
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

reward.description: new armor

locations.name: The Ragged Flagon
locations.description: a bar that is actually a front to the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Delvin Mallory, Vex
characters.description: fellow members of the Thieves Guild who can give the player extra jobs

characters.name: Tonilia
characters.description: a female member of the Thieves Guild

tools: the player just joined the Thieves Guild: the player should do as they're told and keep their blade clean to get their share of the loot
description:
Welcome to the family, kid. I'm expecting you to make us a lot of coin, so don't disappoint me.
This is how you get your cut of the spoils. Do as you're told and keep your blade clean. We can't turn a profit by killing.
You should talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex. They know their way around this place and they'll be able to kick some extra jobs your way.
Oh, and talk to Tonilia in the Flagon... she'll set you up with your new armor.

name: The Man Who Cried Wolf
objective: investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave
first_tasks: clear out the Wolfskull Cave

first_task_locations.name: Wolfskull Cave
first_task_locations.description: a cave that is said to be haunted because of Potema the Wolf Queen's necromantic rituals some 500 years ago

reward.description: the player will be repaid

characters.name: Potema the Wolf Queen
characters.description: an infamous, feared, long-dead queen

tools: Falk Firebeard thinks that checking out the Wolfskull Cave is not worth his time with the war going on
description:
There have been reports of weird happenings near Wolfskull Cave. Travelers disappearing, odd lights. I suspect wild animals or perhaps bandits.
The cave has a bad history. Long ago, Potema the Wolf Queen used it for necromantic rituals. That's where it got the name. That was over 500 years ago. Nothing much down there now - but everyone's always convinced the cave is haunted.
I don't think it's worth our time with the war going on, but if you want to clear out the cave, I'll make sure you're repaid for your work.

name: March of the Dead
objective: stop the ash spawn attacks on Raven Rock
first_tasks: search for clues about where the ash spawn come from

quest_giver.name: Captain Veleth
quest_giver.description: the commander of the Redoran Guard

locations.name: Raven Rock
locations.description: a town ruled by the Redoran

tools: the player saved Captain Veleth's life: his guardsman was killed by an ash spawn though
the ash spawn have been coming from this direction to Raven Rock
description:
Thanks... I wasn't sure I'd make it off this farm alive. I wish I could have said the same for my man here.
Some of the Redoran Guard have taken to calling them "ash spawn". Me? I don't care what they're called... all I know is they're a danger to Raven Rock and they need to be stopped.
I was going to search for clues that might lead me to wherever they're coming from. I know it isn't the best place to start, but we know they've been coming from this direction.
Could you lend me a hand? We were searching the farm when the ash spawn ambushed us. Have a look around and see if you can turn up anything useful.

name: The Lover's Requital
objective: help Sibbi Black-Briar in his plans to kill Svidi
first_tasks: find Svidi

quest_giver.name: Sibbi Black-Briar
quest_giver.description: a pompous, womanizing nobleman, one of the Black-Briars

reward.description: compensation

characters.name: Svidi
characters.description: a buxom young woman with long flowing black hair and beautiful singing voice, Sibbi Black-Briar's former fiancée

characters.name: Wulfur
characters.description: Svidi's brother

tools: Svidi found out that Sibbi Black-Briar had an affair and told Wulfur about it
Wulfur attacked Sibbi Black-Briar: Sibbi Black-Briar killed Wulfur and was arrested for Wulfur's murder
Sibbi Black-Briar has to stay in jail for 8 months
description:
Look, we all have our flaws; mine is that women can't get enough of me. So I had this little affair going on while I was betrothed to a beautiful girl named Svidi. Well, she finds out and she tells her brother, Wulfur. Then her brother attacks me with a knife... I mean, I had to defend myself!
So I got arrested for his murder. And now I have to stare at these bars for eight months. Can you believe it? I was about to let that wench Svidi marry into the richest family in Riften, and this is how she repays me. I'd do anything to have that whore's head on a platter. All I need to know is where she is.
Find her and I promise you'll be well compensated. Svidi was a young woman... buxom, with long flowing black hair. She used to sing the most lovely songs to me when we were courting. I've never heard a voice so beautiful.
All that talent will go to waste when I'm finished with her.

name: A Lovely Letter
objective: use a forged letter to resolve a love triangle between Faendal, Sven, and Camilla Valerius
first_tasks: take the forged letter to Camilla Valerius and say that it is from Sven

quest_giver.name: Faendal
quest_giver.description: a worker at the Riverwood mill who dislikes Sven

characters.name: Camilla Valerius
characters.description: an intelligent, beautiful woman

characters.name: Sven
characters.description: a male Nord bard and a worker at the Riverwood mill, who is courting Camilla Valerius

tools: NONE
description:
Sven is a bard, so he says. Occasionally he finds time to do his job here at the mill. Thinks his ballads and sonnets are going to convince Camilla Valerius to marry him. As if she would say "yes".
An intelligent, beautiful woman like her wouldn't fall for that nonsense... I hope. I've been thinking... maybe Camilla needs a little help seeing Sven for what he is. Could you... could you give her this letter, and say it's from Sven? I think I've matched that Nord's lack of cleverness perfectly.
I would appreciate your help. You could take some gold I've saved up from working at the mill.

name: Loud and Clear
objective: teach Aringoth a lesson
first_tasks: burn down three bee hives without burning the whole Goldenglow Estate down, and clear out the safe in the main house of the Goldenglow Estate

quest_giver.name: Brynjolf
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Aringoth
characters.description: an arrogant wood elf man who owns the Goldenglow Estate

characters.name: Maven
characters.description: a powerful woman with criminal connections

characters.name: Mercer
characters.description: the man who leads the Thieves Guild

tools: the Thieves Guild had an arrangement with Maven: the Thieves Guild kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing, and Maven allowed the Thieves Guild to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout
Aringoth stopped sending the Thieves Guild extortion money: Mercer was angry
the player may kill Aringoth, but Maven would prefer him alive
description:
Goldenglow Estate is a bee farm; they raise the wretched little things for honey. It's owned by some smart-mouth wood elf named Aringoth.
We had an arrangement with Maven. We kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing. In return, Maven allowed us to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout.
Goldenglow Estate brought in a mountain of gold for the Guild. You could almost call it our sweetest deal. Then out of the clear blue, Aringoth stops sending us our cut. Mercer was... well, angry to put it kindly.
We need you to teach Aringoth a lesson by burning down three of the estate's hives and clearing out the safe in the main house. The catch is that you can't burn the whole place to the ground. Maven would be furious if you did. She also prefers that Aringoth remains alive, but if he tries to stop you from getting the job done, kill him.
The Guild has a lot riding on this. Don't make me look foolish by mucking it up.

name: Magic Student
objective: help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
first_tasks: raise your own warding spell and allow the aspiring wizard to cast a spell at it
tools: the aspiring wizard wants to join the College of Winterhold
description:
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the 'right' way to do things.

name: Lost Legacy
objective: protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
first_tasks: meet Tharstan

reward.description: Tharstan will pay the player

locations.name: Solstheim
locations.description: an island that is covered with ancient ruins

tools: the passage to Vahlok's Tomb must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions
description:
Yes, I think you're just the adventurous sort I need. I have a job offer for you.
As a scholar of history, I've always found Solstheim to be most intriguing. I've made many forays into the ancient ruins that cover the island. I've come to know those ruins so well, I could draw you a map from memory. That's why I noticed the new passage the moment I laid eyes on it.
it leads to an old tomb, I think. It must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions. I'd love to have a closer look, but those old ruins can be dangerous and I'm no adventurer. I'll pay you to watch my back down there.
I'll be heading back there soon. If you're interested, meet me at the ruins and we'll see what we can find. Now I'm off to pack for the expedition!

name: Lost Knowledge
objective: retrieve a Black Book so that Neloth can make a copy of it
first_tasks: find the Black Book

reward.name: Black Book
reward.description: one of the Black Books

items.name: Black Books
items.description: books created by Hermaeus Mora, each containing forbidden knowledge

characters.name: Xarxes
characters.description: the god of secrets and hidden knowledge

characters.name: Hermaeus Mora
characters.description: the devious demon of forbidden knowledge

tools: the player asked Neloth if he has found more Black Books
the Black Book might contain the final secrets of Xarxes
description:
Yes. Hermaeus Mora is devious, but then so am I. Now, it's only a rumor of a whisper of a conjecture. But I think this is the place. Benkongerike. One of the Books is hidden there.
Now, hurry and find that Black Book. That Book might contain the final secrets of Xarxes, for all we know. I'll just make a copy for myself. It's far too dangerous to carry the real Black Book around.
Of course, I'm sure you can handle yourself. Of course you can. You can keep the original Black Book.

name: Lisbet's Missing Shipment
objective: recover a stolen Dibella Statue for Lisbet
first_tasks: find the Dibella Statue

reward.description: a sum of gold

characters.name: Dibella
characters.description: the goddess of beauty, love, and affection

tools: NONE
description:
This store would finally be on its feet if I hadn't lost my last shipment to Forsworn attacks. A specially-made Dibella statuette.
You aren't for hire, are you? A sellsword? I'll pay you if you can recover that statuette from the Forsworn at Broken Tower Redoubt.
I'll have a sum of gold waiting for you when you return.

name: Lights Out!
objective: help run the Icerunner aground
first_tasks: put out the lighthouse fire
meet Jaree-Ra

reward.description: loot from the Icerunner

characters.name: Deeja
characters.description: Jaree-Ra's sister, a female treasure hunter

tools: Jaree-Ra and Deeja collect things nobody misses
with the war, many more ships come through Solitude Docks loaded with weapons and pay, but few people
description:
It's easy to find things to sell. Things nobody will miss. Things from underground, or just left lying around in someone's house. I bet the two of us, we're very alike. So why not take the next step? We can help each other.
My sister Deeja and I are treasure hunters. You could be too. We like to collect things. We are not thieves. We just take what will not be missed. What no one needs anymore. Maybe we take some weapons and stop a few deaths. Who would call that thievery?
With the war, many more ships come through these docks. Loaded with weapons and pay, but few people. And they pass through dangerous waters. We have an interest in one of those boats, the Icerunner. The Solitude Lighthouse will be guiding it in... but if its fire were to go out, the Icerunner would run aground.
If someone were to put out the lighthouse fire and then meet me on the docks afterwards... I could certainly direct them to that loot. That someone could be you.

name: Lifting the Shroud
objective: investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow
first_tasks: go to the barrow

first_task_locations.name: Shroud Hearth Barrow
first_task_locations.description: a haunted barrow on the east side of Ivarstead

characters.name: Wyndelius
characters.description: a male treasure hunter

tools: Wyndelius went into Shroud Hearth Barrow two years ago: Wilhelm warned him not to go in there
Wyndelius was never seen again
description:
If I were you, I'd keep away from the barrow on the east side of town...
There ain't much more to tell... it's haunted and you should stay away. Look, I've seen one of the spirits with my very own eyes. When it glared at me, I swear it burned right through my soul.
Fortunately, the spirits seem to be sticking to the barrow. I think they're guarding it. Certainly isn't helping my business any; who'd want to rent a room anywhere near a haunted barrow?
If you think there's anything you can do, be my guest. About a year or two ago, some fella named Wyndelius came through; said he was some kind of a treasure hunter. I warned him not to go in there, just like I warned you. The very next night we heard screams from the barrow, and that was it. We never saw him again.

name: Locate the Assassin of Old
objective: go on an adventure
first_tasks: find the final resting place of the assassin of old

first_task_locations.name: Hag's End
first_task_locations.description: a ruin far to the northeast of Deepwood Redoubt

reward.description: the earthly possessions of the assassin of old

tools: the player came to Olava the Feeble for a reading
description:
Come to Olava for a reading, did you? Hmph. Yes. Yes, I surely can give you a reading.
It's not something I do lightly, mind you, and it's not as specific as you might want. But yes. I will do this for you. Please, relax. Free your mind. Yes, that's it...
A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest... Through there is... Hag's End. The last resting place of an assassin of old. A dark brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
No... no, that is all. Now... now please. I find myself very weary all of sudden.

name: Kyne's Sacred Trials
objective: participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
first_tasks: defeat the guardian wolf, crab and skeever and return to Froki

reward.description: Kyne's blessing

characters.name: Kyne
characters.description: the ancient goddess of humankind and beasts, who teaches us to respect the beasts

groups.name: Divines
groups.description: a pantheon of gods who replaced the ancient gods

items.name: Kyne's Sacred Trials
items.description: an ancient tradition, and a test to prove yourself to Kyne

tools: Froki thinks that the Divines are impostor gods
Froki gives the player the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever: this will compel the guardian to appear when the player reaches the guardian's lair
description:
The Divines are stolen idols! Impostor gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
Kyne's Sacred Trials is an old tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down. You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne. I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

name: Kill the Vampire
objective: take care of a vampire problem
first_tasks: wipe out the vampires

reward.description: free Illusion magic training from Sybille Stentor

tools: NONE
description:
I'm busy, and I don't like being bothered unless I'm expecting something from you. Oh, don't give me that look. Fine. I supposed I can find some menial task to set your mind on.
Hmm.... We have something of a vampire problem. Bodies have been found with blood drained. I know of a den nearby you can wipe out as a precaution. Pinemoon Cave. I don't expect you to be capable of even that. Vampires are clever hunters. More clever than you, definitely.
I suppose I could show you a little about Illusion magic for free, couldn't I?

name: Kill the Giant
objective: slay a giant
first_tasks: find a giant

quest_giver.name: Skald the Elder
quest_giver.description: the nobleman who rules over the Pale

locations.name: Dawnstar
locations.description: the capital city of the Pale

tools: the Empire demanded Skald the Elder to leave giants be, but the Imperial authority does not apply here anymore
description:
Giants are a common problem in the Pale. The Empire always demanded I leave them be, but the Empire isn't here now.
Go and slay one of the beasts. It should let them know that Dawnstar is not to be trifled with. I'm counting on you.

name: Laid to Rest
objective: investigate Hroggar's house fire
first_tasks: find clues among the ashes

quest_giver.name: Idgrod Ravencrone
quest_giver.description: the noblewoman who rules over Morthal

reward.description: Idgrod Ravencrone will reward the player

characters.name: Hroggar
characters.description: a man who lusts after Alva

characters.name: Alva
characters.description: a woman

tools: Hroggar's wife and daughter died in the fire: Hroggar blames his wife for starting the fire because she spilled bear fat in the fireplace
rumors say that Hroggar started the fire himself so that he could get together with Alva
description:
I want you to look into Hroggar's house fire. He lost his wife and daughter in the blaze. My people believe the house to be cursed now. Who am I to gainsay them?
How the fire started? Hroggar blames his wife for spilling bear fat in the fire. Many folk think he set the fire himself. Lust can make a man do the unthinkable. The ashes were still warm when he pledged himself to to a woman named Alva.
I can't arrest Hroggar on rumor and gossip. But you, a stranger, might find the truth for us. Sift through the ashes at Hroggar's house that others are too fearful to touch. See what they tell you.
Should you prove him guilty or innocent, I will reward you.

name: Kill the Bandits
objective: slay bandits for Siddgeir
first_tasks: find all bandits, and kill them

quest_giver.name: Siddgeir
quest_giver.description: a corrupt nobleman who rules over Falkreath

tools: the player has proven themselves to Siddgeir
description:
You've proven reliable. There's a group of bandits in my hold that I... may have had a few discreet dealings with.
The cut they were giving me was good at first, but now it's time to clean things up. Go to Embershard Mine and take care of them. Teach them to stop paying me. Execute every last bandit. Spare no one.

name: Kill the Forsworn Leader
objective: kill a Forsworn leader
first_tasks: find the Forsworn leader

quest_giver.name: Igmund
quest_giver.description: an honorable nobleman who rules over Markarth

tools: NONE
description:
Are you a sellsword? I don't like your kind. No honor. No loyalty. Unreliable. But I can't turn away a potential ally in these times. Let's see if you're better than a common mercenary.
My scouts have tracked down one of the Forsworn leaders, hiding out in their blood-soaked camps at Serpent's Bluff Redoubt. Deal with that Forsworn leader.

name: Begging for Death
objective: assassinate Narfi
first_tasks: find Narfi

quest_giver.name: Nazir
quest_giver.description: a fellow assassin who does not like the player very much

reward.description: payment

characters.name: Narfi
characters.description: a hapless beggar

tools: NONE
description:
Go assassinate Narfi. He's a hapless beggar living in some ruins just outside the village of Ivarstead. Easy even for you.
You get to slaughter an emaciated beggar in cold blood. You are truly an opponent to be feared. I'll have your payment waiting for you.

name: Painting the Seas Red
objective: assassinate Safia
first_tasks: find Safia

first_task_locations.name: Red Wave
first_task_locations.description: Safia's ship, in the Solitude docks

reward.description: payment

characters.name: Safia
characters.description: a ruthless female pirate captain who is deadly with a blade

tools: this is Nazir's final, most challenging assassination contract
Safia's crew is loyal and bloodthirsty
description:
I have an assassination contract for you: Safia, a pirate captain. She can be found aboard her ship, the Red Wave. It's currently docked at the Solitude docks.
Safia is a ruthless she-devil, by all accounts. Deadly with a blade. And let's not forget her crew - loyal and bloodthirsty, the lot of them.
This is my final contract, and certainly the most challenging. Be careful with this one, my friend. If you are capable of pulling through this, you've not only earned your payment, but my respect as well. And believe me, friend - that does not come easily.

name: Deadly Research
objective: assassinate Maluril
first_tasks: find Maluril

characters.name: Maluril
characters.description: a dangerous, rogue male Dark Elf mage who studies dwarwen artifacts

tools: the player has done assassination contracts for Nazir before
description:
I have another assassination contract for you: Maluril. He's dangerous. Very dangerous. A rogue Dark Elf mage doing research into dwarven artifacts should be both respected... and feared. Just not by you.
Maluril is doing his research in Mzinchaleft. A Dwarven ruin... what an exotic place for a kill. I hope the elf doesn't give you too much trouble. I once got set on fire by a sorcerer. Nasty business, that. But I digress.

name: Silence at Last!
objective: assassinate Lurbuk
first_tasks: find Lurbuk

quest_giver.name: Nazir
quest_giver.description: a fellow assassin who dislikes bards

characters.name: Lurbuk
characters.description: the worst bard in Skyrim, a man

tools: NONE
description:
Your next assassination target is Lurbuk. He is staying at Moorside Inn in Morthal.
Lurbuk is, by all accounts, the worst bard in all of Skyrim. No one would hold it against you if you flayed that horrible bard alive and made a drum from his skin... Apparently so many people sought his death, a lottery had to be arranged to determine the client.
The only good bard is a dead one, as far as I'm concerned. All that singing and... mirth.

name: A Trip to Eternity
objective: assassinate Ma'randru-jo
first_tasks: locate Ma'randru-jo

characters.name: Ma'randru-jo
characters.description: an accomplished male wizard, who travels with the caravans

tools: NONE
description:
Ma'randru-jo is an accomplished wizard, and your assassination target. Locating him may be challenging, as he travels with the caravans.
Those caravaners can be an elusive bunch. Takes a fair bit of stalking to take one down. But then, that's half the fun, isn't it?

name: A Political Murder
objective: assassinate Helvard
first_tasks: locate Helvard

characters.name: Helvard
characters.description: the male housecarl of the Jarl of Falkreath

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Falkreath

tools: NONE
description:
You are going on a little vacation in Falkreath. You'll be able to enjoy the sights, sample the food... and kill the housecarl, Helvard.
You know what that means? He's the bodyguard to the Jarl of Falkreath himself. So be careful. That's sure to throw a branch into Falkreath's well-oiled political machine.

name: Undead to Plain Dead
objective: assassinate Hern
first_tasks: find Hern

first_task_locations.name: Half-Moon Mill
first_task_locations.description: a mill ran by Hern and Hert

characters.name: Hern
characters.description: a male vampire who has blended into the human society

characters.name: Hert
characters.description: a female vampire, Hern's companion

tools: Hert is always near Hern
description:
You are going to assassinate Hern. He's a vampire, and has blended into human society for years. He's never far from his female companion, Hert. Also a vampire.
The contract is for the male, Hern. But you'll probably have to contend with the female, too. They both live in Half-Moon Mill. So for Sithis' sake, watch yourself.
Face a vampire, and live to tell the tale!

name: Proven Paranoia
objective: assassinate Ennodius Papius
first_tasks: find Ennodius Papius

first_task_locations.description: in the woods near Anga's Mill

characters.name: Ennodius Papius
characters.description: a paranoid male hermit
characters.location: in the woods near Anga's Mill

tools: NONE
description:
Ennodius Papius lives just outside Anga's Mill, in the woods. He was once the miller. Now Papius is just a paranoid recluse who thinks someone is out to get him. And he's right.
You will assassinate him and prove his paranoia legitimate.

name: Hunt the Hunter
objective: assassinate Anoriath
first_tasks: find Anoriath

reward.description: payment

characters.name: Anoriath
characters.description: a male Wood Elf hunter who runs a market stall in Whiterun

tools: NONE
description:
There's Anoriath, a Wood Elf, who owns a market stall in the city of Whiterun.
He may run a stall in the city, but he retreats to the plains outside Whiterun to hunt. Kill him there, and no one will bear witness...
The hunter shall come to know the fear of the hunted, hmm? And I shall have your payment waiting for you, my friend.

name: Swim for Your Life
objective: assassinate Deekus
first_tasks: locate Deekus

first_task_locations.name: Hela's Folly
first_task_locations.description: a small waterlogged shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar

characters.name: Deekus
characters.description: a male Argonian layabout, and a shipwreck scavenger

tools: Argonians are unpredictable opponents, especially near water
description:
There's an assassination contract for you. You are to kill Deekus.
He is an Argonian layabout, likes to scavenge shipwrecks. My guess is he'll run if threatened. Or swim, if given the chance.
Personally, I've always found Argonians to be incredibly unpredictable opponents. Especially near water. Unfortunately, Deekus is at Hela's Folly, a small waterlogged shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar. Making him stay out of water will be difficult.

name: Lethal Competition
objective: assassinate Beitild
first_tasks: find Beitild

characters.name: Beitild
characters.description: an angry and desperate female mine owner

tools: Beitild and her ex-husband run competing mining operations in Dawnstar
description:
Someone has contracted us to kill Beitild. She separated from her husband several months ago. Now the two run competing mining operations in Dawnstar. I hear the mining business is extremely cutthroat. And those hours... they're murder.
Beitild's angry and desperate. A fighter.

name: Joining the Stormcloaks
objective: prove yourself worthy of becoming a Stormcloak
first_tasks: kill an Ice Wraith

first_task_locations.name: Serpentstone Isle
first_task_locations.description: a strange rock formation that attracts Ice Wraiths

reward.description: the player becomes a Stormcloak

tools: NONE
description:
The Stormcloaks need dedicated men and women who're devoted to the cause and willing to die for it. Before I can put you to use, I need to know how much you can take. I have a little test for you.
