I'm sending you to Serpentstone Isle. If you survive, you pass. If you die, well, you weren't going to be much use to me anyway. It's where men have tested their mettle for ages. There's a strange rock formation, built by the ancients. Something about that place attracts the Ice Wraiths.
You kill an Ice Wraith out there, and I'll have all the proof I need about you being Stormcloak material.

name: Serving the Empire
objective: prove yourself worthy of joining the Imperial Legion
first_tasks: wipe out bandits

first_task_locations.name: Fort Hraggstad
first_task_locations.description: a bandit fortress to be turned into an Imperial garrison

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: a female leader in the Imperial Legion

reward.description: induction into the Imperial Legion

tools: the ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim: most have fallen into disrepair and overrun with bandits
description:
I've got a good feeling about you. And I don't often get good feelings about anything. A warrior knows to trust her gut... I'm not going to go through the normal process with you. I've got a little test lined up. Pass that, and we'll talk about you joining the Legion.
The ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim. Sadly, most have fallen into disrepair. And nearly all have been overrun with bandits or other vagabonds. Fort Hraggstad is one of the few that remains mostly intact. We're going to install a garrison there, but first, you're going to clean out the bandits that have moved in.
Then, it's time for you to officially join the Legion.

name: The Jagged Crown
objective: find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric
first_tasks: meet Galmar Stone-Fist and your fellow Stormcloaks

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the man who leads the Stormcloaks, and who has declared himself the High King

characters.name: King Borgas
characters.description: a long-dead king

items.name: Jagged Crown
items.description: a crown made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons that symbolizes the power and might of a High King

tools: the High King always wore the Jagged Crown: the Jagged Crown is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it
description:
I've found the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. Can you believe it? Well, I'm almost certain.
The High King always wore the Jagged Crown. It was the symbol of his might and power. The crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and it is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it. True or not, who would dare deny Ulfric's claim, when the legendary Jagged Crown sits upon his brow?
We're headed to Korvanjund. But, if old King Borgas is indeed buried there, we're bound to run into trouble of some kind. Your fellow Stormcloaks are already assembling outside the tomb. I'll meet you there as soon as I'm finished up here.

name: No Crown for You
objective: find the Jagged Crown before Galmar Stonefist
first_tasks: meet Legate Rikke and her men

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: a power-hungry nobleman

characters.name: Galmar Stonefist
characters.description: Ulfric's right-hand man

tools: NONE
description:
Ulfric's right-hand man, Galmar Stonefist, has located what he believes is the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. We're going to make sure he doesn't get his hands on it.
The rest of my men are already assembling outside Korvanjund. I'll meet you there as soon as I finish up here.

name: J'zargo's Experiment
objective: help J'zargo test his new spells
first_tasks: use J'zargo's flame cloak scrolls against undead, and report back to J'zargo whether they work

quest_giver.name: J'zargo
quest_giver.description: a fellow mage student who is working hard on new spells

tools: J'zargo gives the player plenty of flame cloak scrolls
description:
Can you... can you possibly help J'zargo? You must be very skilled with magic, yes? J'zargo is working hard, but cannot do it alone.
J'zargo has worked hard on learning new spells, trying new things. This will make J'zargo stand out as a mage. But J'zargo works so hard, there is no time to test these new spells.
If you help with the testing, this will make learning easier. J'zargo will give you scrolls, you will use them and report the results. This is a good plan, no? Let's see... this one, I think. J'zargo has designed it to be an excellent flame cloak, with a twist. It is especially potent against the undead, and should burn them to a crisp in no time. J'zargo gives you plenty of these scrolls, so you try them and return when you can say whether they work.

name: It's All in the Taste
objective: spread the word about Geldis Sadri's new Sujamma
first_tasks: distribute 10 Sadri's Sujamma to people

reward.description: something extra

tools: NONE
description:
The house specialty is the finest Sujamma to cross your lips, friend. My own personal formula that I call 'Sadri's Sujamma'.
In fact, I've just added some new ingredients to the mixture that I think makes it taste better than ever. All I need to do is get the word out that it's ready and they'll flock here for it.
Here, take these ten samples of the Sujamma and spread the word. If you get rid of all of them, there's something extra in it for you.

name: Innocence Lost
objective: do an assassination contract for Aventus Aretino
first_tasks: kill Grelod the Kind, the evil, cruel woman who works as the headmistress

reward.description: Aventus Aretino's valuable family heirloom

items.name: Black Sacrament
items.description: a dark ritual used to employ the services of the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Grelod the Kind
characters.description: an evil, cruel woman, and the headmistress of Honorhall Orphanage

tools: Aventus Aretino did the Black Sacrament: he thinks that the player is an assassin from the Dark Brotherhood
Aventus Aretino was sent to Honorhall Orphanage after his mother died: he ran away back to Aretino Residence
description:
I did the Black Sacrament, over and over. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood!
It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract. My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament.
And you can kill Grelod the Kind! I have a family heirloom you can have. Supposed to be sort of valuable. I hope that's all right.

name: Infiltration
objective: help Stalleo to take back Treva's Watch from bandits
first_tasks: use the mine entrance behind Stalleo and his men, and open the front gate

first_task_locations.name: Treva's Watch
first_task_locations.description: Stalleo's home fortress, overrun by bandits

quest_giver.name: Stalleo
quest_giver.description: a man who is expecting reinforcements

reward.description: on top of the posted reward, the player can have whatever items they'd like

characters.name: Brurid
characters.description: a man who has been at odds with Stalleo since the king's death

tools: Stalleo and his men left to help with the war: meanwhile Brurid and his bandits seized Treva's Watch and kidnapped Stalleo's family
description:
Are you here to help? Finally, reinforcements have arrived. I was expecting more though, you'd better be good.
We left to help with the war and these filth bags swooped in and seized the place. I suspect Brurid planned this, there's been bad blood between us since the king's death. But to invade my home, kidnap my family...
The front gate is locked so you'll need to use the mine entrance behind us. Open the front gate and we'll try and give you some support. My family is everything to me. Clear the fort and on top of the posted reward you can have whatever items you'd like.

name: In My Time of Need
objective: help Alik'r Warriors locate Saadia
first_tasks: find Saadia
bring information about Saadia to the Alik'r Warriors

reward.description: Alik'r Warriors will pay good money for information

characters.name: Saadia
characters.description: a Redguard woman, a fugitive from Hammerfell

tools: NONE
description:
You there. We are looking for someone in Whiterun, and will pay good money for information.
We're looking for a fugitive who comes from Hammerfell. A woman -- a foreigner in these lands. Redguard, like us. She is likely not using her true name. She may be somewhere in this city. We will pay for any information regarding her location. We are not welcome here in Whiterun, so we will be in Rorikstead if you learn anything.
Our reasons are none of your concern. All you need to know is that we're paying for information. If that doesn't interest you, feel free to walk away.

name: Imitation Amnesty
objective: help Olfrid Battle-Born save Arn from getting executed for a serious crime in Solitude
first_tasks: steal a letter that was sent from Solitude warning the Whiterun guard to be on the lookout for Arn
change Arn's name in the prison registry to his new identity

first_task_locations.description: the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach
the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach

characters.name: Arn
characters.description: an old male warrior, and a close friend of Olfrid Battle-Born

tools: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild: the player was sent to do a job for Olfrid Battle-Born
Arn fled from Solitude to Whiterun, but was arrested for drunken behavior
the letter and the prison registry are inside : visitors are not allowed to enter them
Olfrid Battle-Born can't help the player if the player gets caught
description:
You're here! And not a moment too soon. If anything should happen to Arn, there'll be hell to pay.
Arn's a close friend of mine. We fought together on the battlefield for many years until old age got the better of us. Now it's up to me to save him one more time... this time from the executioner's block in Solitude.
The city guard in Solitude is seeking Arn for a serious crime. When he fled here, he was arrested for drunken behavior. Can you imagine? Fortunately, his identity isn't known to the authorities in Whiterun, so there's still a chance to save him.
The job is two-fold. First, steal a letter that was sent from Solitude warning Whiterun's guard to be on the lookout for Arn. The second is to change Arn's name in the prison registry to his new identity.
The job is relatively difficult. If it was easy, I would have hired a local thug instead of a professional from the Thieves Guild. You see both of these items are kept inside Dragonsreach, and they don't allow visitors inside the Jarl's or the Steward's chambers.
One more thing. If you get caught, I can't afford to be connected to you. Remember that before you do anything stupid.

name: In Plain Sight
objective: bring 4 books to Drevis Neloren
first_tasks: use the spell that Drevis Neloren teaches you to locate the 4 books

quest_giver.name: Drevis Neloren
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher in Illusion magic

reward.description: Drevis Neloren will inscribe the spells for the player

items.description: books, which contain powerful Illusion spells

tools: Drevis Neloren has taught the player all he knows about Illusion magic
description:
You have gone beyond my teachings, which is quite a feat. I did not think it possible. But there is always more to learn. I believe you are ready for the next step. Knowledge of truly powerful Illusion spells is here at the College, but it is hidden from those who might misuse it.
I shall teach you a spell to discern things hidden from others. With it, you will be able to acquire the texts you need. Bring all four to me, and I shall use them to inscribe the spells for you.

name: Ice Cold
objective: bring five ice wraith teeth to Marise Aravel
first_tasks: find five ice wraith teeth
tools: the player asked Marise Aravel how she keeps the food she sells so fresh
description:
I picked up a trick from a master butcher. He showed me a way to grind up ice wraith teeth and use it as a preservative. Keeps everything cold and fresh, but only for a limited time.
I'm always looking to replenish my supply, so if you ever come across five of them, I'd be more than happy to take them off your hands. The last traveler that traded me some said he found them at a place called Ancient's Ascent.
Careful though, rumor has it a dragon makes its home there.

name: Hunt and Gather
objective: retrieve Wylandriah's Dwemer Spoon, Orichalcum Ingot, and Grand Soul Gem
first_tasks: fetch Dwemer Spoon
fetch Orichalcum Ingot
fetch Grand Soul Gem

reward.description: Wylandriah will reward the player

characters.name: Boti
characters.description: Wylandriah's friend

tools: NONE
description:
I could use some help with getting organized. An assistant perhaps? No, no, no. Maybe a familiar. No, too messy. Well, at any rate, organization is not my strong suit. Not at all. I need as much help as I can get.
In fact, if you could retrieve a few things for me, I could start on my next set of experiments. What I need is my Dwemer Spoon, my Orichalcum Ingot and my Grand Soul Gem. In fact, I could use them immediately.
Well... why are you still standing here? Oh, right. You need to know where they are! That would help. Let's see. Last time I used the Dwemer Spoon was at my dear friend Boti's house in Ivarstead... Fellstar Farm I believe it's called. The Orichalcum Ingot should still be in Winterhold at the Frozen Hearth Inn. I don't know why I didn't just take it with me. And last is the gem. I left that one in Windhelm at the White Phial alchemy shop. It was a good trade too. Ah well.
Bring those items back to me and I'll be happy to experiment on you. No, no... that isn't right. I'd be happy to reward you.

name: Ill Met by Moonlight
objective: take the Ring of Hircine back to Hircine
first_tasks: hunt down the beast to draw out Hircine

items.name: Ring of Hircine
items.description: a ring that is supposed to control a werewolf's transformations, a relic of Hircine

characters.name: Hircine, Lord of the Hunt
characters.description: the god of hunting and monsters

tools: Sinding killed a little girl, because he lost control of his transformations
Hircine cursed the Ring of Hircine when Sinding obtained it: it transforms him at the worst of times
Sinding will escape from the prison after giving the quest
description:
Come to gawk at the monster?
A little girl is dead because of me. Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just... lost control. I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me.
It's all on account of this blasted ring. This is the Ring of Hircine. I was told it could let me control my transformations. Perhaps it used to. But I'll never know. Hircine didn't care for my taking it, and threw a curse on it. I put it on... and the changes just came to me. I could never guess when. It would be at the worst times. Like... with the little girl.
I don't suppose there's a point in keeping the secret if I'm going to die in here anyway. I'm sure you've heard of men who shift to beasts under the influence of the moons. I am one of them. A werewolf. It's my secret, and my shame. That's why I wanted the ring... it was said to give men like me control. Now I may look like a man, but I still feel the animal inside of me, as strong as ever.
You would take the ring back to Hircine? Oh my. You would do this for me? Here, take it. I don't want anything to do with this wretched thing anymore. Seek out the beast. He wanders these woods. Bring him down and... well, the Lord of the Hunt should smile on you and appear before you.
I wish you luck, but should leave here while I still have my skin. Should our paths cross again, I will remember your kindness. Farewell.

name: The House of Horrors
objective: investigate the Abandoned House with Tyranus
first_tasks: follow Tyranus inside the Abandoned House

first_task_locations.name: Abandoned House
first_task_locations.description: a house in Markarth that might have been used for Daedra worship

quest_giver.name: Tyranus
quest_giver.description: a member of the Vigil of Stendarr

tools: no one has seen anyone enter or leave the Abandoned House
description:
Excuse me, but do you know anything about this house? Seen anyone enter or leave? Seems no one in this city has.
I'm with the Vigil of Stendarr. We believe this house might have been used for Daedra worship. Evil rites and so forth. I was actually just about to head on inside. Be good to have someone watch my back.
Follow me, and keep your eyes open. Daedra are powerful creatures and tricksters. Never know what you'll find.

name: Dominion and Humiliation
objective: help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
first_tasks: save the priest of Boethiah from imprisonment

characters.name: Boethiah
characters.description: the goddess of destruction, Molag Bal's rival

tools: the player tried to take the mace on Molag Bal's shrine: Molag Bal imprisoned the player with sharp spikes
description:
Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you? What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
You definitely see the spikes of your cage. Sharp, aren't they? This was the last thing many saw before they were sacrificed in my name. But even a god has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. So long since it's tasted blood. Until you came.
I want submission. I want the priest who did this to bend his knee and give me his soul. He comes by to perform Boethiah's insulting rites at my altar, but he's been missing. Captured and bound. Left to rot.
You'll get the freedom your kind enjoys so much. Save the priest. Let him perform his rite one more time. And when he does, we will be waiting for him.
Then you will be finally rewarded. The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.

name: Honor Thy Family
objective: regain the trust of your fellow Dark Brotherhood members
first_tasks: pay 500 gold

quest_giver.name: Nazir
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: readmission into the Dark Brotherhood

tools: NONE
description:
You disrespected the Dark Brotherhood. And it'll cost you. You want back into the Family, you pay the price. 500 gold, and all is forgiven.
I suggest you "collect" it. Until you pay the fine, you are effectively cut off from all Dark Brotherhood duties and contracts.
No contracts. No rewards. No respect.

name: The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller
objective: retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller
first_tasks: find the horn of Jurgen Windcaller in his tomb

reward.description: formal recognition as Dragonborn

characters.name: Jurgen Windcaller
characters.description: the man who founded Greybeards

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: the masters of the way of the voice

tools: this is the player's last trial
description:
You are now ready for your last trial. Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav.
Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return. Then it is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.

name: Hired Muscle
objective: intimidate Erikur into submission without killing him
first_tasks: find Erikur

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

characters.name: Erikur
characters.description: a man who has been causing trouble to other citizens

tools: NONE
description:
We've gotten a letter about Erikur needing some muscle up in Solitude.
I don't know what the fight is about, and that's not our business anyway. I just need you to go out there, look tough, and scare this milk drinker Erikur into submission.
No more than that. I don't want to hear about a killing, understand? Go. Bring honor to yourself, and the Companions.

name: Hitting the Books
objective: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
first_tasks: talk to Orthorn

characters.name: Orthorn
characters.description: an ex-student of the College of Winterhold

tools: Orthorn stole books from Urag gro-Shub and left to join the summoners at Fellglow Keep
description:
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.

name: A Reminder
objective: bring a bunch of Rieklings' spears to Hilund
first_tasks: find Rieklings' spears
tools: Rieklings had invaded the Thirsk Mead Hall, but the player helped Hilund and her friends to drive them out: Hilund wants to ring the whole Thirsk Mead Hall with Riekling spears to remember that moment of weakness
description:
To tell you the truth, I've been a little distracted. I've got this... idea.
I want to ring the whole hall with Rieklings' little spears. Mocking us, from the past. Making us work harder. Fight better. The only problem is, I'm going to need a lot of spears. A lot. So, if you could find a bunch of them for me, that would make it easier on me.

name: The Heist Job
objective: steal an item from a store strongbox
first_tasks: break into a store strongbox

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

tools: NONE
description:
Every now and again, we like to remind the shopkeepers that we're in charge. If that means breaking into their strongboxes and stealing something valuable from them, then so be it.
Feel like doing a bit of shopping... the Guild way? The owner of this shop stiffed us on their last protection payment, but we're taking it anyway.

name: Helping Hand
objective: help Wujeeta cure her Skooma addiction
first_tasks: give Wujeeta a healing potion

quest_giver.name: Wujeeta
quest_giver.description: a worker at the Riften Fishery, and a Skooma addict

characters.name: Bolli
characters.description: the man who owns the Riften Fishery

tools: Bolli will fire Wujeeta if she shows up for work under the influence of Skooma
description:
My job at the Riften Fishery is in danger. The owner, Bolli, said that if I show up for work in this condition one more time, then I'm out.
I don't mean to do this to myself, but I can't help it. I tried some Skooma a year ago, and ever since then, I can't stop! If you could give me a healing potion, I could cleanse this poison from my body and get back to my life.

name: Heart Stones
objective: bring a Heart Stone to Neloth
first_tasks: find a Heart Stone

reward.description: Neloth pays the player

tools: every time the Red Mountain belches, more of Heart Stones land on Solstheim: the player may need to pick away at stone to pry the Heart Stone
description:
I'm running low on Heart Stones. If you have any with you, I'll buy one. Otherwise, I can tell you where you might find one.
Every time the Red Mountain belches, more of them land here on Solstheim. Look around for impact craters, exposed rock, that sort of thing. You may need to pick away at it to pry the heart stone itself loose, but you look... strong.
Good luck.

name: The Heart of Dibella
objective: find a new Sybil for the Temple of Dibella
first_tasks: retrieve the new Sybil, a young girl

first_task_locations.name: Karthwasten
first_task_locations.description: a small village pressed against the stone, to the north

reward.description: the blessing of Dibella

characters.name: Sybil
characters.description: a mortal woman who proclaims the will of Dibella

characters.name: Dibella
characters.description: the goddess of love and passion

items.name: Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
items.description: a secret ceremony known to the priestesses of Dibella, which is used to find a new Sybil after the death of the previous one

locations.description: Temple of Dibella, a temple for Dibella

tools: the player breached the inner sanctum of the Temple of Dibella and interrupted the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
description:
You have committed a breach, and must pay the penalty. Normally, a quick death would be required. Luckily for you, there are more pressing matters.
The ceremony you so rudely interrupted was the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil. I don't expect you to know what that means. Suffice to say that our Sybil was recently lost to us. Through the ceremony, we have seen the home of the next Sybil, to the north, in a small village pressed against the stone.
If you can travel there, and retrieve our young Sybil, your transgression will be forgiven. We believe the place in our vision to be Karthwasten. Now move quickly. The girl must be brought to the temple as soon as possible.
You, my dear, can earn the blessing of Dibella as your reward.

name: Healing a House
objective: help Elynea Mothren to repair Neloth's tower
first_tasks: find 3 taproots, soak them in the headwaters of Harstrad, and bring them to Elynea Mothren

quest_giver.name: Elynea Mothren
quest_giver.description: Neloth's mycologist, and an old woman

reward.description: Elynea Mothren pays the player

characters.name: Neloth
characters.description: a pompous master wizard

tools: NONE
description:
I don't care if he's a master wizard. He can't treat me like this! Master Neloth, that fetcher, told me to fix his house. If I don't, he'll find a new mycologist who will. Decades of loyal service, and he'd just throw me out like yesterday's breakfast!
I need three taproots soaked in the headwaters of the Harstrad river to fix Neloth's tower. I'm an old woman. I can't possibly make that trip. It's way too dangerous.
If you get some taproots, I'll pay you to dip them in the headwaters and bring them to me.

name: Harsh Master
objective: take care of a runaway sailor and his gang of thieves
first_tasks: find the runaway sailor

quest_giver.name: Kjar
quest_giver.description: the harsh captain of the North Wind

reward.description: a year's worth of pay

tools: NONE
description:
The North Wind is my mistress, and I'm her master. I don't tolerate any disloyalty. You looking for work? Got a sailor who thought running a gang of thieves would be more money than hauling my cargo.
You make an example of that gang, I'll give you a year's worth of pay.  Don't spend it all on mead.

name: Materials for Smithing
objective: bring Stalhrim or Ebony to Halbarn Iron-Fur
first_tasks: find Stalhrim or Ebony
tools: the player drove Rieklings away from Halbarn Iron-Fur's forge
description:
Cleaning out the forge was the easy part. But those blasted Rieklings made off with most of my materials. And I can't forge air.
You tend to wander around, don't you? If you come across any Stalhrim or Ebony in your travels, bring them back to old Halbarn. Help each other out.

name: Hail Sithis!
objective: assassinate Titus Mede II
first_tasks: get onboard

first_task_locations.name: Katariah
first_task_locations.description: Titus Mede II's ship, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet

quest_giver.name: Amaund Motierre
quest_giver.description: a man who has contracted the Dark Brotherhood to kill Titus Mede II

reward.description: Amaund Motierre will reveal the location of the dead drop that holds the player's payment

characters.name: Titus Mede II
characters.description: the Emperor

tools: the player is a member of the Dark Brotherhood
Titus Mede II will be surrounded by elite bodyguards, but they might be more lax than usual because everyone assumes that the Dark Brotherhood has been destroyed
description:
The Emperor is still in Skyrim, but not for long. He's onboard his ship, the Katariah, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet. But you must hurry!
If you can get onboard that ship. Kill Titus Mede II, as contracted... I will reveal the location of the dead drop that holds your payment.
This is the true Emperor, not some half-penny lookalike. He'll be surrounded by elite bodyguards, I'm sure. You'll have your work cut out for you. Still... everyone assumes the Dark Brotherhood has been completely destroyed. They may be a bit more lax than usual.

name: Grin and Bear It
objective: bring 10 bear pelts to Temba Wide-Arm
first_tasks: get 10 bear pelts by killing bears

reward.description: Temba Wide-Arm will pay the player

tools: NONE
description:
Have you ever seen what a bear does to the trees? They jump up on their hind legs and scratch them to bits... marking their territory or something.
It's getting to the point where I have to scour Skyrim for untouched trees at the right size. Costs me too much time and money.
Tell you what. Bring me ten of bear pelts from anywhere in Skyrim I'll gladly pay you for thinning out the herd.

name: Grimsever's Return
objective: recover Grimsever for Mjoll the Lioness
first_tasks: find Grimsever

first_task_locations.name: Mzinchaleft
first_task_locations.description: a Dwemer ruin, the home of a dangerous Dwemer colossus

items.name: Grimsever
items.description: Mjoll the Lioness' beloved, lost sword

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct race of people famed for their mechanical constructions

tools: NONE
description:
My blade, the Grimsever, was lost years ago in a Dwemer ruin. Without it, I feel almost as defenseless as a newborn. I don't think I'll ever be able to find a replacement.
I was adventuring in the depths of the ruins when I was attacked by a massive construct... like nothing I had ever seen. When the colossus struck, Grimsever was knocked from my grasp and I was wounded badly. It was only through blind luck that I was able to crawl away from the Dwemer abomination and make my way to the surface.
I couldn't ask you to undertake such a treacherous journey, it would be a fool's errand. But I see that spark in your eye and I know better than to warn you away. Grimsever rests with the Dwemer ruin of Mzinchaleft. Tread carefully, friend... those same ruins almost took my life.

name: Good Intentions
objective: deal with the Eye of Magnus
first_tasks: seek out the Augur of Dunlain

quest_giver.name: Quaranir
quest_giver.description: a member of the Psijic Order

characters.name: Augur of Dunlain
characters.description: a wise, reclusive male wizard

items.name: Eye of Magnus
items.description: a dangerous object that radiates power, in the College of Winterhold

groups.name: Psijic Order
groups.description: a powerful, secretive order of mages

tools: Quaranir stopped time around the player for speaking privately: the player is a student at the College of Winterhold
the Psijic Order has tried to contact the player previously with visions to warn the player about the Eye of Magnus
description:
I've given us a chance to speak privately, but I'm afraid I can't do this for long. We must be brief.
The situation here at your College is of dire importance, and attempts to contact you as we have previously have failed. I believe it is due to the very source of our concern. This object... The Eye of Magnus as your people have taken to calling it. The energy coming from it has prevented us from reaching you with the visions you have already seen. The longer it remains here, the more dangerous the situation becomes. And so I have come here personally to tell you it must be dealt with.
I fear I have already overstepped the bounds of my Order, but I will offer this: seek out the Augur of Dunlain here in your College. His perception may be more coherent than ours.

name: The Golden Claw
objective: retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius
first_tasks: find the golden dragon claw

quest_giver.name: Lucan Valerius
quest_giver.location: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town

reward.description: some coin

tools: the golden dragon claw was stolen from Lucan Valerius' shop
description:
We did have a bit of a... break-in. But we still have plenty to sell. Robbers were only after one thing. An ornament, solid gold. In the shape of a dragon's claw.
I've got some coin coming in from my last shipment. It's yours if you bring my claw back. If you're going after those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.

name: Get Outfitted
objective: get a free set of armor
first_tasks: select light, medium, or heavy armor

reward.description: armor

tools: the player came for their free armor
the player only gets one free outfit
description:
I have just one question for you. Light, medium, or heavy?
Light armor for scouting detail, heavy armor for full on combat, or something in between?
Now, that'll be it. One free outfit per soldier. You lose that, or get it banged up, you'll need to pay like everyone else.

name: The Gardener of Men
objective: bring the secrets of the Skaal to Hermaeus Mora
first_tasks: convince the Skaal to reveal their secrets

quest_giver.name: Hermaeus Mora, Gardener of Men
quest_giver.description: knower of the unknown, master of fates, an immortal god

reward.description: Hermaeus Mora will give the player what the player seeks

characters.name: Miraak
characters.description: the player's enemy, a man who sought out Hermaeus Mora's forbidden knowledge and received it

groups.name: Skaal
groups.description: a tribe of people who consider Hermaeus Mora a demon

tools: NONE
description:
I am Hermaeus Mora, the Gardener of Men, knower of the unknown, master of fates. You stand in my realm, mortal.
You have sought out the forbidden knowledge that only one other has obtained. You are a seeker of knowledge and power, like Miraak before you.
The Skaal have withheld their secrets from me for many long years. The time has come for this knowledge to be added to my library. Convince them to give up their secrets. My word is as true as fate, as inevitable as destiny. Bring me what I want, and I will give you what you seek.

name: The Ghost of Old Hroldan
objective: put the Ghost of Old Hroldan to rest
first_tasks: find Hjalti's sword ,and give it to the Ghost of Old Hroldan

quest_giver.name: Ghost of Old Hroldan
quest_giver.description: an ancient ghost of a soldier

characters.name: Hjalti
characters.description: Ghost of Old Hroldan's long-dead brother-in-arms

tools: the Ghost of Old Hroldan thinks that the player is Hjalti
description:
You don't remember me, Hjalti? Two campaigns we served together. You saved my life time and time again. You promised me, Hjalti. You promised that when we sacked Hroldan, you would make me your sworn brother.
And I've waited. Even after the enemies' arrows dug into my chest and their hammers crushed my bones. I've waited.
Give me your sword, Hjalti. That we may become brothers as you promised.

name: From the Ashes
objective: help Talvas Fathryon by killing an Ash Guardian
first_tasks: kill the Ash Guardian

reward.description: a staff

characters.name: Neloth
characters.description: a powerful male wizard

tools: Talvas Fathryon conjured an Ash Guardian without Neloth's approval: the Ash Guardian is not under Talvas Fathryon's control
description:
You've got to help me! I conjured an Ash Guardian and now it's running amok in Tel Mithryn.
Master Neloth refused to teach me the Ash Guardian spell. So I read his spell book on my own and learned it. Something went wrong when I cast it. The creature is attacking everything in sight.
I need to keep Master Neloth distracted so he doesn't find out what I did. There is no telling what he would do to me. While you are taking care of the creature, I'll try to figure out what went wrong.
I don't have any gold to pay you with, but I can give you this staff.

name: A Tragedy at Frostflow
objective: uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
first_tasks: investigate the cellar

first_task_locations.name: Frostflow Lighthouse
first_task_locations.description: an old lighthouse on an icy coast

quest_giver.name: Habd
quest_giver.description: a retired sailor, giving quest via "Habd's Journal"

characters.name: Ramati
characters.description: Habd's wife, a former sailor

characters.name: Sudi
characters.description: a woman, Ramati and Habd's daughter

characters.name: Mani
characters.description: a man, Ramati and Habd's son

tools: Habd and Ramati sailed for years from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back: Habd and Ramati bought Frostflow Lighthouse to settle down with Mani and Sudi
things went missing from the cellar and strange noises came from there as well

Habd went away from Frostflow Lighthouse to buy some traps: after returning home, he found out that Ramati was killed by a bug-like creature; Habd killed the creature and went into the cellar to save his family, locking the door behind him
description:
Habd's Journal
by Habd

After years of sailing from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back, Ramati and I have finally saved enough money to buy that old light house we spotted on the coast and we are moving in next month.
These northerners really know how to live. It may be cold, but you can't beat the tranquility of the watching icebergs to live out your silver years. Ramati loves the place too, despite the occasional leaky ceiling. Mani and Sudi, unfortunately, seem miserable here; I know the kids are old enough to strike out on their own, but I hope they'll grow to love the peace and quiet here as I have.
Mani and Sudi continue to bicker and harass each other and they seem to have started in on their mother as well. Ramati keeps finding things missing from the cellar. Sudi said she heard a noise down there but Mani just thinks their mother is going mad from isolation. The very thought of it is ridiculous, she's always wanted to retire here!
Sudi keeps saying that she hears scratching coming from the cellar at night. I think she's just trying to get her mother's goat, but I'd better head into town to get a few traps just in case it's rats. Should only take a couple days. I just hope those two go easy on Ramati while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful Ramati killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor Ramati. It must have come out of the cellar. I'm going down there and locking the door behind me to make sure they don't escape. I don't know if I'll make it out, but I have to save my family!

name: Forgotten Names
objective: complete a summoning ritual in the Midden
first_tasks: find the 4 rings needed in the ritual

first_task_locations.name: Arcanaeum
first_task_locations.description: the library in the College of Winterhold

quest_giver.name: Anonymous
quest_giver.description: an investigator from the College of Winterhold, giving quest via "Midden Incident Report"

items.name: Deadric Relic
items.description: a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, with the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm

locations.name: Midden
locations.description: a sewer system underneath the College of Winterhold

tools: Anonymous found the missing students of the College of Winterhold dead in the Midden: they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities
the Deadric Relic in the Midden is related to the students' death: Anonymous pried 4 rings from the Deadric Relic
description:
Midden Incident Report
by Anonymous

The missing students were found in the Midden this morning. Dead, as expected. None of us bothered keeping a detect life charm for the search at this point.
The bodies were found together, each suffering the same deformities; peeled and bubbling skin on the arms and face. Conjurer's burn, as it's commonly referred to around the College. There's little doubt they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities.
The relic nearby put any doubt in this theory to rest. I admit that I've never seen one like it - a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm. Attempts to move it were in vain. I must show it to the Archmage during his upcoming visit. Perhaps he will know more.
While we couldn't move the relic, I was able to pry four "rings" from it. I'm sure there's a connection between them and the ritual the students were attempting.
I'll store these in the Arcanaeum until we can consult with a conjuration master to learn more.

name: The Forgemaster's Fingers
objective: bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
first_tasks: find the Forgemaster's Fingers

reward.description: the player will become Blood-Kin to the Orcs: the player will be allowed to enter Orc strongholds

characters.name: Malacath
characters.description: the god of the Orcs

tools: the player is not an Orc or blood-kin to the Orcs: the player is not welcome at the Orc stronghold by the code of Malacath
description:
Halt, outlander. By the Code of Malacath, this stronghold belongs to the Orcs. Your kind are unwelcome. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.
Hmm... there is a way to become Blood-Kin, if you truly insist on entering our stronghold. We've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse.
They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Find them at Stony Creek Cave. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs.

name: For the Good of Morthal
objective: help Gorm to address his worries about Idgrod's leadership
first_tasks: deliver Gorm's letter to Captain Aldis

characters.name: Idgrod
characters.description: the noblewoman who rules over Morthal, and a seer

characters.name: Captain Aldis
characters.description: a male official

tools: Idgrod gets lost in her visions
description:
My mind weighs heavy enough. Idgrod's so lost in her visions, and it's only getting worse. I've looked after her safety for so long... If she can't tell what's real and what's not, how will she continue to lead Morthal?
There is a letter, one I have had for some time now. I think it is time it gets delivered. I cannot leave Idgrod's side, so I must stay here. Could you see that it reaches Captain Aldis in Solitude?
Please, do not open it. It is... private.

name: Flight or Fight
objective: tell Liefnarr that he is not welcome home
first_tasks: find Liefnarr

first_task_locations.name: Broken Helm Hollow
first_task_locations.description: a camp east towards the border of Morrowind

characters.name: Liefnarr
characters.description: Grosta's missing husband

tools: Liefnarr went to trade some grain with people at Broken Helm Hollow: he never came back
description:
My husband Liefnarr said he was going east towards the border of Morrowind to trade some of our grain to some folks at Broken Helm Hollow.
I waited and waited, and he never came back. Probably shacked up with some elven whore. Good riddance to him I say. If I only knew where he was, I'd sure give him a piece of my mind.
If you see him, tell him Grosta said he can go straight to hell... he's not welcome here any more.

name: Forbidden Legend
objective: investigate the forgotten legend of Gauldur, and find the 3 pieces of the Gauldur Amulet
first_tasks: find Mikrul's amulet piece
find Jyrik's amulet piece
find Sigdis' amulet piece

first_task_locations.name: Folgunthur
first_task_locations.description: the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude

quest_giver.name: Daynas Valen
quest_giver.description: a historian, giving quest via "Daynas Valen's Notes"

reward.name: Gauldur Amulet
reward.description: a powerful amulet that belonged to Archmage Gauldur

characters.name: Archmage Gauldur
characters.description: a man revered throughout the north for his wisdom, wealth, honor, and power, who lived during the first era

characters.name: Mikrul
characters.description: the youngest of Archmage Gauldur's three sons

characters.name: Jyrik
characters.description: the oldest of Archmage Gauldur's three sons

characters.name: Sigdis
characters.description: the middle child of Archmage Gauldur's three sons

characters.name: Archmage Geirmund
characters.description: a tough male wizard

tools: the Gauldur name wiped out from the annals of history
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis lusted after Archmage Gauldur's power and prestige: they discovered Archmage Gauldur's source of power, the Gauldur Amulet
Archmage Gauldur was murdered by his sons Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis: they split the Gauldur Amulet between them
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis laid waste to surrounding villages: the high king sent Archmage Geirmund and his battlemages after Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis
description:
Daynas Valen's Notes
by Daynas Valen

How to summarize a lifetime of research? So little of what I have learned matters now - the petty politics of ancient times, the age-long campaign to wipe out all mention of the Gauldur name.
In the opening days of the First Era, the Archmage Gauldur was revered throughout the north. Wisdom, wealth, honor, and power were his, and even the legendary heros' heirs sought his counsel.
Smothered by his shadow, Gauldur's three sons grew cruel and resentful. They lusted after their father's power and prestige, and eventually Jyrik, the eldest, discovered its source: a mysterious amulet, from which he never parted. Together, they conspired to murder their father in his sleep and divide his amulet between them. And so it was done.
Consumed by their newfound power, the brothers laid waste to the surrounding villages. So great was the carnage that the High King himself intervened, sending a company of battlemages led by the Archmage Geirmund to subdue the brothers. And after a devastating battle, the three fled the field.
Mikrul, the youngest, was run to ground in Folgunthur, the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude. Geirmund pursued Jyrik to the shattered crypts of Saarthal, half-buried even then. And at last, Sigdis was cornered in the southernmost reaches of land and later entombed in Geirmund's Hall.

name: Fit for a Jarl
objective: promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
first_tasks: wear one of the Radiant Raiment's outfits, and speak to Elisif about it

reward.description: the player gets to keep the Radiant Raiment outfit, and Taarie pays the player

characters.name: Elisif
characters.description: the female Jarl of Solitude

tools: the player told Taarie that the player is going to the Blue Palace
description:
You're really going to the Blue Palace? That presents an opportunity.
If you were willing to wear one of Radiant Raiment's outfits and speak to the Jarl I would not only pay you but let you keep the outfit.
Here's the outfit. Try to get Jarl Elisif's opinion on it and if she likes it mention it's from Radiant Raiment.

name: The Fishing Job
objective: steal an item out of a mark's pocket for the Thieves Guild
first_tasks: find the mark

quest_giver.name: Delvin Mallory
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

reward.description: the usual pay

tools: NONE
description:
There are all sorts of people wandering around carryin' their valuables on their person... just waitin' for someone like you to pick their pocket. So, you in for a little fishin'?
One of our marks seems to have an item of value we want to add to our vault. Get it for us and you'll receive the usual pay. Sound good?

name: Finn's Lute
objective: return Finn's Lute to Inge Six Fingers
first_tasks: find Finn's Lute

reward.description: Inge Six Fingers will teach the player a few tricks

characters.name: Finn
characters.description: a famous male bard

tools: thieves broke into the Bards College and made off with a lot of valuable things: Finn's Lute included
Finn invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today
description:
Hmm? Oh, sorry. My mind wanders sometimes. I was just thinking about Finn's Lute.
Over a year ago, thieves broke into the College and made off with a lot of valuable things. Mostly gold and silver. But they also stole Finn's Lute. We just learned where the bandits fled to, and I very much want that lute back. They are at Stony Creek Cave.
Finn was the bard who invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today. Until he found a way to string the extra courses, bards only had six course lutes. The lute they stole is Finn's original eight course lute. I doubt they even realize its true value.
There is no way I can pay you what this Lute is worth. But I can teach you a few tricks I've learned over the years.

name: Assassin at Large
objective: kill the Khajiit who wants to assassinate Malborn
first_tasks: find the Khajiit

first_task_locations.description: around the main gate of Windhelm

characters.name: Khajiit
characters.description: a suspected male Thalmor assassin
characters.location: around the main gate of Windhelm

locations.name: Morrowind
locations.description: a land inhabited by the Dunmer

groups.name: Thalmor
groups.description: an organization that kills anyone who oppose them

groups.name: Dunmer
groups.description: a race of people who do not like the Thalmor

tools: the player saved Malborn from the Thalmor in the past
Malborn could not leave Windhelm for Morrowind because of the Khajiit
description:
Oh, it's you. I didn't expect to see you again.
I'm trying to stay alive. I think time's running out though. I'm pretty sure the Thalmor know where I am. Maybe you can help me.
I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere, that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave Windhelm so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.
You'd be saving my life. Again. I know I probably seemed ungrateful... I've just been so scared. Expecting a knife at my throat any minute.

name: First Edition
objective: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
first_tasks: find the Folio

first_task_locations.name: Strident Squall
first_task_locations.description: a ship that sank off the coast of Solstheim, and turned into a reaver den

locations.name: First Edition
locations.description: a famous bookshop far away from Solstheim

tools: Cindiri Arano sent the Folio to the First Edition to be rebound: they sent it back on the Strident Squall
description:
A few months ago, I had sent an important Folio to the First Edition to be rebound. They sent it back to me recently, but it never arrived.
The Folio was aboard the "Strident Squall" or something like that. The damn thing sunk right off the coast of Solstheim. Can you imagine? One of the sailors survived. Poor thing crawled all the way to Raven Rock on his hands and knees. Before he died, he told the guard about the wreck and warned us that it was going to be crawling with reavers.
Could you find the Folio for me? You have no idea how much it hurts losing such a precious item!

name: First Lessons
objective: join the College of Winterhold
first_tasks: cast Mage Light on the seal on the ground

quest_giver.name: Faralda
quest_giver.description: a mage gatekeeping the College of Winterhold

reward.description: membership of the College of Winterhold

tools: NONE
description:
It would seem that the College has what you seek. The question now is what you can offer the College.
Not just anyone is allowed inside. Those wishing to enter must show some degree of skill with magic. A small test, if you will.
The Mage Light spell is useful to any mage, not just those specializing in Alteration. Can you cast one on the seal on the ground?

name: Filial Bonds
objective: find Torkild
first_tasks: see if Torkild is with the werebears of the glacier

quest_giver.name: Wulf Wild-Blood
quest_giver.description: a hunter, and a worried brother

characters.name: Torkild
characters.description: Wulf Wild-Blood's brother, a wild man and a fearsome warrior

tools: Torkild may have become a werebear: a bear-like cursed creature
description:
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Torkild had a wild gleam in his eye, more than most. In my darkest times, I fear he fell in among the werebears of the glacier.
Werebears are twisted, cursed beasts. True bears are noble and great creatures of the wild. I've heard tell of men who, by curse or by heart's desire, become transformed into one of those vile things. It is a pitiable fate. And one that I fear has fallen to my brother.
If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.

name: The Final Descent
objective: find out what happened to Gratian Caerellius
first_tasks: find and unlock the locked off section of the mine

first_task_locations.name: Raven Rock Mine
first_task_locations.description: a worthless and tainted mine in Raven Rock

characters.name: Gratian Caerellius
characters.description: the great-grandfather of Crescius Caerellius, who worked for the East Empire Company

tools: the East Empire Company swept something big under the rug two centuries ago: it killed Gratian Caerellius and ruined the Raven Rock Mine
Crescius Caerellius and his wife found Gratian Caerellius' things in their home: an unsent letter to the East Empire Company, and a key to the locked off section of the Raven Rock Mine
description:
Who in the blazes are you?! Can't you see I'm busy? Or, perhaps you could help me. Hmph, maybe. Been difficult trusting people lately, they think I'm crazy.
Mark my words, these mines hold a secret that could put Raven Rock back on the map. A secret the East Empire Company swept under the rug two centuries ago. It killed my great-grandfather, Gratian Caerellius, and left Raven Rock with a worthless and tainted mine.
East Empire Company called it "a terrible accident", claiming that he was lost in a rockfall, but I know better. My wife and I were cleaning out our home, and we came across some of my great-grandfather's things locked in an old chest. I found an unsent letter he'd written to the East Empire Company, and a key.
The letter describes a discovery that was made in the mine by some of the diggers. They wanted Gratian to take a closer look. The East Empire Company must have felt it was of great value, as they locked that section of the mine off from everyone else. I assume the key unlocks that section of the mine. I haven't been able to find the entrance.
I'm telling you... there's something big down there, something that the East Empire Company wanted to hide from everyone.

name: Few and Far Between
objective: help Ingun Black-Briar restock rare ingredients
first_tasks: find 20 deathbell, 20 nightshade, and 20 nirnroot

characters.name: Elgrim
characters.description: a male master alchemist

tools: NONE
description:
I'm aspiring to earn the title of an alchemist. However, the road ahead is paved with loose cobbles and deadly pitfalls.
Master Elgrim says I'm a natural; that I have a unique talent. But I fear his approval masks his intolerance for my mistakes. My errant formulas have cost Master Elgrim a fortune in ingredients; some of which are almost irreplaceable.
To restore Master Elgrim's supply I would need 20 deathbell, 20 nightshade and 20 nirnroot. Am I sensing that you may be interested in gathering these rare ingredients for me? That means more time for my experiments and less time in the field. Much appreciated.

name: Feeding the Addiction
objective: convince Geldis to let Bralsa Drel drink at The Retching Netch
first_tasks: talk to Geldis about Bralsa Drel

quest_giver.name: Bralsa Drel
quest_giver.description: a former great miner who lost her job when the mine dried up

reward.description: the player gets what's coming to them

characters.name: Geldis
characters.description: a male barkeeper who owns the The Retching Netch

tools: NONE
description:
Doesn't everyone pity the hopeless? Look at me... I'm no better than a beggar.
I used to be a miner, a good one too. I made more gold digging up ore in a month than some people earn in a lifetime. When the mine dried up, I was lost. I have no other trade, so I spend my time drinking my fortune away at the Retching Netch... or I used to anyway.
That fetcher Geldis won't even allow me inside. Said I was bad for business. If I want to spend my last bag of coins getting drunk, that's my business. What does he care?
If you can get that stubborn mule to let me into the Netch, I'll make sure you get what's coming to you.

name: Fetch the Netch
objective: obtain five samples of Netch jelly for Milore Ienth
first_tasks: find Netch

reward.description: something for the effort

tools: NONE
description:
I'm proud to say that I grow or harvest most of my exotic ingredients myself.
I only wish I had a better source for Netch jelly. Those creatures are difficult to track down since it's so dangerous beyond the the town walls.
Could you gather some Netch jelly for me? That would be splendid! Five samples should be enough. I'd be more than happy to give you something for the effort.

name: A Few Words with You
objective: convince Mikael to leave Carlotta Valentia alone
first_tasks: talk to Mikael

reward.description: some coin

characters.name: Mikael
characters.description: a male bard who boasts about conquering Carlotta Valentia

tools: NONE
description:
That bard Mikael is begging for a dagger up against his throat, the way he goes on about me.
I've heard him boasting at the Bannered Mare, saying he'll "conquer me as a true warrior conquers any harsh beast." Hmph.
You could try to convince that lute player to stop chasing me. If you want to try, go right ahead. I don't think anything will get through that thick skull of his, though.
If you do convince Mikael, I'd thank the gods, but I'll settle for thanking you. There'll be some coin for your help.

name: A Fair Wage
objective: convince Torbjorn Shatter-Shield pay his Argonian dockhands fairly
first_tasks: talk to Torbjorn Shatter-Shield

characters.name: Torbjorn Shatter-Shield
characters.description: a cheapskate Nord male business owner

tools: NONE
description:
Torbjorn Shatter-Shield is giving me trouble. I wish someone would beat the coin out of his fat fists. He clings to every coin.
He says an Argonian's labor is only worth a tenth of a "proper Nord worker." My people are not slaves! You can try talking with him, but we've gotten nowhere talking to him ourselves.

name: Workplace Enjoyment
objective: convince Mulush treat his workers better
first_tasks: talk to Mulush

quest_giver.name: Omluag
quest_giver.description: a frustrated smelter worker for Mulush

reward.description: coin

characters.name: Mulush
characters.description: the harsh male smelter overseer for the Silver-Bloods

tools: NONE
description:
Mulush is a damn tyrant. Always being goaded on by the Silver-Bloods to get more work out of us.
They pay us next to nothing. We get beaten if we make a mistake, and where are our kind Silver-Blood rulers? What are they doing? Typical.
You would stick up for us. You're going to try to talk sense into that man? I'll believe it when I see it.
It's a week's wages for me, but you've earned every coin if you talk some sense into Mulush.

name: Drinks for Stories
objective: convince Roggi that he should not worry about his bar tab to Iddra
first_tasks: talk to Roggi

reward.description: things Roggi pawned to Iddra

characters.name: Roggi
characters.description: a male Nord storyteller

tools: NONE
description:
Roggi has been in Kynesgrove forever. Great storyteller. Keeps everyone's spirits up. Owes me a lot of coin for drinks. I keep telling him not to worry about it, but he's got the stubborn Nord blood.
Damn fool doesn't have the coin to pay me back, so he just beats himself up over it, and then he gets thirsty, and it cycles all over again. If you could convince him that I don't care about his tab, it'd certainly make me feel better.
Roggi pawned a few of his things back when he still had things to pawn. Take them as your reward.

name: A Tab to Pay
objective: convince Ranmir pay his debts to Haran
first_tasks: talk to Ranmir

characters.name: Ranmir
characters.description: a male drunk

tools: NONE
description:
Ranmir owes this tavern enough coin to burn it down, build it back up, then burn it down again just for laughs.
He's had some troubles in his life, but I can't have him drinking here without at least paying back some of the coin he owes.
Go right ahead and talk to him. He just might be sober enough to listen to you.

name: Fetch Me That Book!
objective: find a book for Urag gro-Shub
first_tasks: read the note
tools: Urag gro-Shub gives the player a note that tells the player the location of the book
description:
If you're feeling adventurous, I'm always looking for someone to procure valuable books from some more... dangerous locations.
Here, I scribbled down the last place I'd heard about. Check it out, but be careful.

name: The Fate of the Skaal
objective: free the Skaal at the Wind Stone from control
first_tasks: learn the word of power that Miraak learned long ago
use the word of power on the Wind Stone

first_task_locations.name: Wind Stone
first_task_locations.description: a sacred stone of the Skaal

characters.name: Miraak
characters.description: a man

tools: NONE
description:
Our time here is running out. The few of us left free of control cannot protect ourselves for much longer.
You must go to Saering's Watch. Learn there the Word of Power that Miraak learned long ago, and use that knowledge on the Wind Stone.
You may be able to break the hold on our people there, and free them from control.

name: Family Heirloom
objective: retrieve a stolen family heirloom from a group of wizards
first_tasks: find the family heirloom

quest_giver.name: Vilkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

reward.description: good pay

tools: NONE
description:
We have a bit of a sensitive matter this time. A wealthy family has... misplaced one of their heirlooms.
Of course, it's a group of wizards they're pointing their fingers at. Who knows what they want it for, but we want it back.
Move quickly so we can have this over and done with. These aren't the most glorious jobs, but they pay well.

name: Dragon Seekers
objective: kill a dragon with Farkas
first_tasks: lead Farkas to the dragon

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

tools: Farkas knows where the player might find the dragon
description:
Travelers have been coming to Whiterun. They tell stories about dragons. I've heard of them, but didn't think they were real.
Rumors also claim that you have defeated dragons before. You are a very brave person worthy of being a Companion. But I already knew that.
Let's go kill a dragon together. That's one way to find out if they're real. I even know where we might find one. Lead on!

name: Dragon Research
objective: help Esbern complete his research on dragons
first_tasks: bring Esbern dragon scales and bones

reward.description: a potion made out of dragon scales and bones

tools: NONE
description:
I need to finish my research on dragons.
While you're out hunting dragons, keep a sharp eye open for any dragon scales and bones you might find. I'd be interested in looking at them.
Have you ever heard of the expression, "the scale of the lizard that bit you?" No, I guess not. Well, the principle applies here. I'll make you a potion, made from those dragon parts.

name: Dragon Hunting
objective: kill a dragon with the Blades
first_tasks: ask Esbern to send the Blades to the dragon

reward.description: the dragon's soul

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: the only person who can defeat dragons for good

tools: the player is Dragonborn
description:
The Blades of the old hunted down many dragons in their day, and they have records of where the beasts lived.
Only you can truly defeat these monsters, Dragonborn, but you do not have to do so alone. The Blades can help you.
Just ask whenever you're ready to take on a dragon. We will send the Blades to help you fulfill your destiny. The dragon's soul should make you stronger.

name: Distant Memories
objective: help Brand-Shei uncover his past
first_tasks: find clues about Brand-Shei's past

quest_giver.name: Brand-Shei
quest_giver.description: an orphaned dark elf who was raised by Argonians in the Black Marsh

groups.name: House Telvanni
groups.description: one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago

locations.name: Morrowind
locations.description: the land of the dark elves

tools: when Brand-Shei was found by his Argonian father, Brand-Shei was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni
description:
I may be dark elf by birth, but I was raised Argonian. Through reasons I'm still trying to discover, I ended up orphaned then taken in by a kindly Argonian family in Black Marsh. I hope one day to find out what happened to me... how I ended up like that.
I know when I was found by my Argonian father, I was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni. It was one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago. Whether that means I was one of them or not, I'm uncertain.
If you come across anything in your travels that might provide me with the answers I'm looking for, I'd be grateful.

name: Mastering Destruction
objective: learn powerful Destruction magics lost to the ages
first_tasks: read the "Power of the Elements" that Faralda gives you

quest_giver.name: Faralda
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher in Destruction magic

reward.description: powerful Destruction magics

items.name: "Power of the Elements"
items.description: a book that contains clues about powerful Destruction magics

tools: Faralda has taught the player everything she can about Destruction magic
description:
I daresay you've learned all I can teach you about Destruction magic. But... That doesn't mean there isn't more out there.
Over the years I've heard things. Powerful magics lost to the ages, incredible spells that only the most skilled mages can master. This book, "Power of the Elements", is the only thing I've ever found. I think it's better off in your hands.

name: Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!
objective: destroy the Dark Brotherhood
first_tasks: use "Silence, my brother." to enter the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

first_task_locations.description: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood

quest_giver.name: Commander Maro
quest_giver.description: an army officer who has tracked the movements of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: a handsome reward

items.description: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: "Silence, my brother."

characters.name: Astrid
characters.description: the female leader of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: the player told Commander Maro that the player killed Astrid
description:
The leader of the Dark Brotherhood? You mean that woman Astrid? Dead? And this is no jest? Ha! This is a stroke of good fortune. Long have I watched the Dark Brotherhood's movements... waiting for the time to strike. That time is now!
My agents have recently acquired the passphrase to their Sanctuary. It is, "Silence, my brother." Every assassin in that hole must be put down! You, my friend. You've slain their leader. This honor should be yours. Do this, and you will be rewarded most handsomely!

name: Delivery to Calcelmo
objective: deliver a ring to Calcelmo for Kerah
first_tasks: find Calcelmo

characters.name: Calcelmo
characters.description: a male historian

locations.name: Markarth
locations.description: a city of stone and silver

tools: NONE
description:
My family came here centuries ago. We've made a good living smithing the silver that flows through the city. But you probably wanted to know about the fancy carvings and stonework, didn't you? Travelers always do.
Here, I have a delivery I need to make to Calcelmo in Understone Keep. Why don't you take the ring to him? He knows the history of Markarth better than anyone. He can be a bit difficult, but I'm sure he'll appreciate your help.

name: Discerning the Transmundane
objective: uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
first_tasks: gather the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer with an extractor Septimus Signus gives you

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct race of crafty elves of superior intelligence

tools: the player looks at the Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
Dwemer blood can unlock the Dwemer lockbox: the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer, can be used instead
description:
You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them.
The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when its set is complete.

name: Sating the Steward's Thirst
objective: deliver a bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum to Falk Firebeard
first_tasks: find Falk Firebeard

characters.name: Jarl Elisif the Fair
characters.description: the noblewoman who rules over Solitude, who recently lost her husband, the king

characters.name: Falk Firebeard
characters.description: Jarl Elisif the Fair's male steward

tools: the player asked Sorex Vinius who is in charge of Solitude
description:
Jarl Elisif the Fair is in charge of solitude. Poor woman. Losing her husband and king like that. It was a dark day for us all.
Damn, that reminds me, I have a delivery to make to her steward, Falk Firebeard. He ordered a special bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum.
You could deliver it for me. Save me a lot of trouble. Here. Take it to the Blue Palace.

name: The Mastermind
objective: infiltrate the Thalmor Embassy, and find out who's behind the dragons
first_tasks: meet Delphine to talk about her plan to get inside the Thalmor Embassy

quest_giver.name: Delphine
quest_giver.description: a paranoid member of the Blades

groups.name: Thalmor
groups.description: a foreign power who knows who is behind the dragons

locations.description: Thalmor Embassy, the center of the Thalmor's operations in Skyrim that is locked up tight

tools: NONE
description:
The first thing we need to do is figure out who's behind the dragons. The Thalmor are our best lead. If they aren't involved, they'll know who is.
If we could get into the Thalmor Embassy... it's the center of their operations in Skyrim... Problem is, that place is locked up tighter than a miser's purse. They could teach me a few things about paranoia...
I have a few ideas about getting inside the Embassy, but I'll need some time to pull things together... Meet me back in Riverwood. If I'm not back when you get there, wait for me. I shouldn't be long.
Keep an eye on the sky. This is only going to get worse.

name: Diplomatic Immunity
objective: infiltrate the party at the Thalmor Embassy, and find Elenwen's secret files
first_tasks: talk to Malborn
meet Delphine

quest_giver.name: Delphine
quest_giver.description: a paranoid member of the Blades

locations.description: Thalmor Embassy, the embassy of the Thalmor

characters.name: Elenwen
characters.description: the female Thalmor ambassador

characters.name: Malborn
characters.description: a male wood elf who is Delphine's trusty contact inside the Thalmor Embassy

tools: Elenwen regularly throws parties: while the player is talking with Malborn, Delphine gets the player an invitation to one of Elenwen's parties
description:
The Thalmor ambassador, Elenwen, regularly throws parties where the rich and connected cozy up to the Thalmor.
I can get you into one of those parties. Once you're inside the Embassy, you get away and find Elenwen's secret files. I have a contact inside the Embassy. He's not up for this kind of high-risk mission, but he can help you. His name's Malborn. Wood elf, plenty of reason to hate the Thalmor. You can trust him.
I'll get word for him to meet you in Solitude, at the Winking Skeever -- you know it? While you're doing that, I'll work on getting you an invitation to Elenwen's little party.
Meet me at the Solitude stables after you've arranged things with Malborn.

name: Who to Poison?
objective: deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
first_tasks: find Wuunferth

characters.name: Wuunferth
characters.description: the male court wizard

locations.name: Hollyfrost Farm
locations.description: a farm owned by Hillevi Cruel-Sea's family

tools: Hillevi Cruel-Sea's goods are grown at Hollyfrost Farm
description:
Everything you see is grown at my family's own Hollyfrost Farm. Fresh and filling.
I also do a little herb growing. The court wizard, Wuunferth, pays us to plant a little Nightshade. Who knows what he uses it for? A poison like that?
Hey, could you deliver this bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth?

name: The Impatient Jarl
objective: deliver a note to Skald the Elder
first_tasks: tell Skald the Elder that he will get his lumber

characters.name: Skald the Elder
characters.description: the impatient Jarl of Dawnstar

tools: NONE
description:
If you're one of the Jarl's men, you'll get your lumber. Anga's Mill pays its debts.
Sorry, I thought Skald the Elder sent you. We've got an order to fill, and he's not known for patience.
Look, if you're heading towards Dawnstar anytime soon, can you give the Jarl this note? Let him know he'll get his lumber.

name: Ashes to Eternity
objective: deliver Berit's ashes to Runil, the priest of Arkay
first_tasks: find Runil

first_task_locations.name: Falkreath
first_task_locations.description: a town known for its graveyard

characters.name: Runil
characters.description: a male priest of Arkay

characters.name: Berit
characters.description: Thadgeir's old, dead male war companion

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of funeral rites

tools: NONE
description:
Falkreath is known for its graveyard, traveler. We've buried more dead than you can imagine.
I just finished giving my old war companion, Berit, a proper burial by fire. Old hard head hated the idea of being lost cold in the ground.
Could you deliver the ashes to Runil, the priest of Arkay? He'll know the right blessings to make for Berit's soul.

name: A New Book to Read
objective: deliver "Olaf and the Dragon" to Giruad Gemane
first_tasks: find Giruad Gemane and ask for a tip

characters.name: Giruad Gemane
characters.description: a male bard

items.name: "Olaf and the Dragon"
items.description: a new book written by Adonato Leotelli

tools: NONE
description:
I write drama, friend. The legends and history of the world made to excite and inspire.
Poor Giruad Gemane at the Bards College has been waiting for my latest work, "Olaf and the Dragon," for weeks now. Roads are a mess.
You'll deliver the book for me? You're sure? When you see Giruad, ask for a tip. I'm sure he'll be in a good mood after reading this.

name: Hungry Pups
objective: deliver spiced beef to Voada
first_tasks: find Voada

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: a nobleman

characters.name: Voada
characters.description: the Jarl's female dog handler

tools: NONE
description:
My family has been breeding and training dogs for years. You need one out in the wilderness. Don't want to be alone when some bandit comes swinging.
I personally trained a whole litter for the Jarl. That reminds me, I was going to deliver some dog food to the Keep. Spiced beef. Their favorite.
You volunteer to make trip and deliver the food? Well, look at you, thanks. Take it to Voada, she handles all the dogs for the Jarl.

name: A Bad Cough
objective: deliver a message about medicines for miners to Quintus
first_tasks: find Quintus

quest_giver.name: Sondas Drenim
quest_giver.location: a mine whose tunnels are getting deep into the rock

tools: the miners need medicines to combat the ore dust
description:
This mine is only a few years old, but I've been digging up ore for over a century.
We're getting to the point where the tunnels are getting deep into the rock. People complain of bad coughs and foul air. I've seen this before. We need some medicines to combat the ore dust. I was about to send a message to Windhelm for aid.
Could you deliver that message on my behalf? Take it to Quintus, in the White Phial.

name: A Sickly Brother
objective: deliver a note about Joric's health to Danica Pure-Spring
first_tasks: find Danica Pure-Spring

characters.name: Joric
characters.description: Idgrod the Younger's brother, a sensitive boy

characters.name: Danica Pure-Spring
characters.description: a priestess

tools: NONE
description:
My brother Joric is... sensitive. He has trouble focusing his attention on things.
We were taking him to the Temple of Kynareth in Whiterun, just so the healers could make sure he was in good health, and they say he's fine.
Are you heading to Whiterun? Could you take this letter to the priestess, Danica Pure-Spring? It's a note about Joric's health.

name: Delayed Burial
objective: convince Loreius fix the wheel of Cicero's wagon
first_tasks: talk to Loreius

quest_giver.name: Cicero
quest_giver.description: a madman who is transporting his dead mother to a new crypt
quest_giver.location: on the road near Loreius Farm

reward.description: coin

characters.name: Loreius
characters.description: a male farmer with tools

tools: NONE
description:
Poor Cicero is stuck. Can't you see? I was transporting my dear, sweet mother. Well, not her. Her corpse! She's quite dead. I'm taking mother to a new home. A new crypt. But... aggh! Wagon wheel! Damnedest wagon wheel! It broke! Don't you see?
Oh. Oh yes! Yes, the kindly stranger can certainly help! Go to the farm - the Loreius Farm. Just over there, off the road. Talk to Loreius. He has tools! He can help me! But he won't! He refuses! Convince Loreius to fix my wheel! Do that, and poor Cicero will reward you. With coin! Gleamy, shiny coin!

name: Death Incarnate
objective: fulfill Astrid's contract
first_tasks: kill Astrid

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's dying leader in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: the player becomes the new leader of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.name: Blade of Woe
reward.description: a dagger

characters.name: Maro
characters.description: the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus

characters.name: Night Mother
characters.description: a female spirit

tools: Astrid betrayed the player by giving the player to the Penitus Oculatus: the Penitus Oculatus destroyed the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid opposed the old ways that guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries unlike the player and the Night Mother
description:
Alive.... You're alive... Thank Sithis...
Ssshhh.... Please. There is much... I have to say. And... not much time... I'm sorry. So very sorry. The Penitus Oculatus... Maro... He said that by giving you to them, he would leave the Dark Brotherhood alone. Forever. By Sithis, I was such a fool. All of this... it's all my fault. You are the best of us, and I nearly killed you... as I've killed everyone else...
