I'm saying you were right. The Night Mother was right. The old ways... they guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries. I was a fool to oppose them. And to prove my... sincerity, I have prayed for a contract. You lead this Family now. I give you the Blade of Woe, so that you can see it through.
You must kill... Me.

name: Dark Ancestor
objective: destroy Vighar
first_tasks: find Vighar

characters.name: Vighar
characters.description: a male vampire

tools: there is an open grave in Falkreath graveyard: Vighar broke free from the grave
Dengeir of Stuhn's family is entrusted with keeping Vighar buried: somebody stole the wardstone that kept Vighar in the grave
description:
You may have seen the open grave in our graveyard. Most of the townsfolk think it's the work of a corpse thief. The truth is less pleasant. It is...was, the grave of Vighar, my own ancestor, dead for centuries now.
Vighar is a vampire. My family is entrusted with keeping him buried, but recently someone stole the wardstone that sealed him in the grave, and Vighar escaped. It's too late for the wardstone. Vighar must be destroyed. If this gets out, my family will suffer great shame.
See that Vighar is destroyed. He will have fled to gather others of his kind at Bloodlet Throne.

name: Dampened Spirits
objective: put the Honningbrew Meadery out of business by putting Sabjorn in prison
first_tasks: talk to Mallus Maccius for details

characters.name: Sabjorn
characters.description: the male owner of the Honningbrew Meadery

characters.name: Mallus Maccius
characters.description: Maven Black-Briar's inside man at the Honningbrew Meadery

tools: NONE
description:
This is an important job. I have a competitor called Honningbrew Meadery that I want to put out of business. I also want to know how they managed to get the place up and running so quickly.
Some layabout named Sabjorn runs the Honningbrew Meadery. Been a thorn in my side for the last few years now. With Sabjorn in prison, his meadery will be forced to close. Then I swoop in and take over the place. No more competition.
Head to the Bannered Mare in Whiterun and look for Mallus Maccius. He'll fill you in on all the details.

name: The Dainty Sload
objective: frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband
first_tasks: get some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette
plant the Balmora Blue in Captain Volf's footlocker

characters.name: Delvin
characters.description: the player's male superior in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Captain Volf
characters.description: a male sea captain

characters.name: Sabine Nyette
characters.description: the female first mate of the Red Wave

tools: Delvin sent the player to Erikur
Captain Volf neglected to honor a trade agreement between him and Erikur
description:
It's about time you got here. I'm not accustomed to dealing with people who are unreliable. That's why I asked Delvin to send me his best.
Nothing raises my ire more than having an agreement broken. It's bad for business and it wastes time. Captain Volf of the Dainty Sload has decided to test my patience on this matter by neglecting to honor a trade agreement we had established.
I need you to help me show him the error of his ways by sneaking on board the Sload and planting some contraband. You'll need to get your hands on some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette down by the docks. She's the first mate on another ship, the Red Wave.
Once you get your hands on it, I want you to plant it in Captain Volf's footlocker. I'll take care of the rest. Captain Volf is ashore right now and I want the authorities waiting for him when he gets back.
Now get going... I don't want to see your face until the job's done.

name: Darkness Returns
objective: walk the Pilgrim's Path, and return the Skeleton Key to the Ebonmere
first_tasks: find and read the journal of the man who died attempting to walk the Pilgrim's Path

quest_giver.name: Nightingale Sentinel
quest_giver.description: a ghost who is dying, trapped in this chamber

locations.name: Pilgrim's Path
locations.description: a dangerous path to the Ebonmere

locations.name: Ebonmere
locations.description: a portal held open by the Skeleton Key

tools: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
the player has the Skeleton Key: the player has done the Thieves Guild a great deed
description:
The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again.
You've done the Guild a great deed. And although they may not show it, I'm certain they appreciate your sacrifices. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
Nothing would bring me more pride than to return the Key, but I'm afraid it's impossible. From the moment I arrived here, I've felt myself... well... dying.
I'm afraid you have return the Key alone. I'm weakening, and I can feel myself slipping away. The years without restoration of my power have taken their toll. Whatever damage has been caused can only be corrected by following the Pilgrim's Path to the Ebonmere and replacing the Key.
The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?

name: The Cursed Tribe
objective: Help lift the curse placed on Yamarz
first_tasks: bring Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart to Atub

quest_giver.name: Atub
quest_giver.description: the wisewoman of the orc clan

characters.name: Yamarz
characters.description: the male chief of the orc clan, who was a strong and proud warrior

characters.name: Malacath
characters.description: the god of orcs

tools: Yamarz became weak: the giants sense Yamarz's weakness, and intrude on the orc clan's territory
Atub must petition Malacath for relief: the ritual must be done at the walled orc camp
description:
Please, our tribe suffers and we need help.
Our Chief, Yamarz, was once a strong and proud warrior. Now he is stricken, cursed. He is weak, and so our tribe is weak. The giants sense this, and intrude on our territory. Now they assault our very home.
Yamarz refuses help, but I sense that you may be just what we need. He has demanded we stay inside the walls. We cannot leave. I must petition Malacath for relief. This curse must be lifted. But I cannot travel to Malacath's shrine. The ritual must be done here, and I do not have the materials I need.
I beg of you, can you bring me Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart? I have no wish to depend on a stranger, but I have no choice.

name: The Cure for Madness
objective: confront Cicero and kill him
first_tasks: find Arnbjorn and make sure he is alright
search Cicero's room for clues about where he has gone and let Astrid know about your findings

first_task_locations.description: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, the hideout of the Dark Brotherhood

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's guildmaster in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: Astrid lets the player take Shadowmere, when the player goes to find Arnbjorn

characters.name: Cicero
characters.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, a dangerous madman

characters.name: Night Mother
characters.description: the spiritual female leader of the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Veezara
characters.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, a man

characters.name: Shadowmere
characters.description: Astrid's male horse

characters.name: Arnbjorn
characters.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, a man

tools: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Cicero went berserk because he overheard Astrid complain about the Night Mother and the player being the listener: Cicero wounded Veezara and tried to kill Astrid before fleeing
description:
The fool Cicero went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
Nothing set Cicero off. At least nothing I'm aware of. Well... If I'm being honest, I haven't exactly been discreet lately in expressing my frustration with this whole situation. Obeying the Night Mother. You being the Listener. It's ridiculous. No offense. Cicero may have overheard me talking to one of the others about the Night Mother. It's possible I was... not entirely respectful. But to go this far. To attempt to murder the leader of a Sanctuary. Cicero must pay with his life. There is no other option.
I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life! But first... find my husband. Make sure he's all right. After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left... Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild. Take my horse, Shadowmere. You'll find him outside, by the pool, when you go find Arnbjorn. Search Cicero's room here. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone.
Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.

name: Your Will Be Done
objective: learn powerful, new conjuration spells
first_tasks: summon an unbound Dremora, prove that you are in control, and order the Dremora bring you a sigil stone from an Oblivion gate

first_task_locations.description: the top of the Hall of Attainment

quest_giver.name: Phinis Gestor
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher in conjuration magic

reward.description: Phinis Gestor inscribes powerful, new conjuration spells for the player

characters.name: Dremora
characters.description: a humanoid creature from the planes of Oblivion

tools: the player has advanced quickly in their conjuration studies
Phinis Gestor will teach the player the spell to summon the Dremora, but it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event
description:
How quickly you've advanced. Most impressive. There are spells yet to be learned, powerful spells that can more closely and more permanently bind creatures to your will. These spells are difficult, even for one as skilled as I. To even begin to inscribe them, I need something very special. A sigil stone from an Oblivion gate.
I do not have one in my possession. Nor do you, I'm sure. So we require a Dremora to retrieve one for us. You will summon one, and order it to bring a sigil stone to you. I will then inscribe the spells for you.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora. Summoning an Unbound Dremora is not like other Conjuration spells. It will not simply do your bidding. You must first prove you are in control.
I will teach you the spell to summon the Dremora, but know that it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event. Here is the spell you need. Go to the top of the Hall of Attainment; I have prepared a place for you there.

name: A Daedra's Best Friend
objective: settle the disagreement between Barbas and Clavicus Vile
first_tasks: talk to Clavicus Vile at his shrine

first_task_locations.name: Haemar's Shame
first_task_locations.description: a den of cultists worshiping Clavicus Vile

quest_giver.name: Barbas
quest_giver.description: Clavicus Vile's dog who was kicked out by Clavicus Vile

reward.description: the player is rewarded: the player just should not trust any offer Clavicus Vile makes them

characters.name: Clavicus Vile
characters.description: the prince of wishes, a Daedra

tools: Clavicus Vile is weak, since he banished Barbas: Clavicus Vile can only manifest at his shrines
description:
You are exactly what I was looking for. You see, my name is Barbas. And I have a problem I think you can help sort out.
My master and I had a bit of a falling out. We got into an argument and it got rather... heated. He's kicked me out until I find someone who can settle our disagreement. That's where you come in.
My master is Clavicus Vile, the prince of wishes. As you can imagine, he's quite the important person.  Now, since he banished me, Vile's been rather weak. He can't manifest very far from one of his shrines. I know there's a cult that worships him at Haemar's Shame. We should be able to talk to him there.
If this works out, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Just don't trust any offer he makes you... okay?

name: Pushing Beliefs
objective: blackmail Raerek into helping the Stormcloaks
first_tasks: find proofs of Raerek's Talos worship in his quarters, and use them to blackmail Raerek

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

groups.name: Stormcloaks
groups.description: rebel forces opposing the Empire in Skyrim

characters.name: Raerek
characters.description: the Jarl's male steward, and a secret Talos worshiper

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the hero-god of humans, whose worship has been banned in the Empire

tools: Raerek is not a true son of Skyrim, as he still supports the Empire
the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Raerek's quarters
description:
Get over to Markarth. Rumor has it the Jarl's Steward, Raerek, is a faithful Talos worshiper, if not a true son of Skyrim - he still supports the Empire, after all.
But, if confronted with proof of his belief, you might be able to 'persuade' him to aid our cause, indirectly of course. Wouldn't want to sully his reputation, would we?
You'll need to be careful with this one. The Jarl's men won't look kindly on you rummaging through the steward's quarters.

name: Compelling Tribute
objective: use Anuriel to gain intelligence on the Stormcloaks
first_tasks: find evidence about Anuriel's corrupt activities in her private quarters, and use it to blackmail her

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion

characters.name: Anuriel
characters.description: the Jarl's corrupt female steward who has secret arrangements with the Thieves Guild

tools: the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Anuriel's private quarters
description:
You're going to Riften. My spies report the Jarl's Steward, Anuriel, has arrangements with the Thieves Guild that would be rather embarrassing if made public.
I need you to find evidence of her corrupt activities, and use it to gain a measure of her "cooperation."
This will require stealth and discretion. The Jarl's guards won't take kindly to anyone rummaging through the steward's private quarters.

name: Climb the Steps
objective: deliver a bag of food supplies to the Greybeards for Klimmek
first_tasks: climb the 7,000 steps to High Hrothgar, and put the bag of food supplies in the offering chest at the top of the steps

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: an order of wise old men

locations.name: High Hrothgar
locations.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards

tools: NONE
description:
Passing through on your way to High Hrothgar? About to make a delivery up there myself.
I mostly deliver food supplies like dried fish and salted meats; you know, things that keep fresh for a long time. The Greybeards tend not to get out much, if you catch my meaning.
It's kind of an understanding between us. I mean, it just wouldn't feel right to charge them for a bit of preserved food. Trouble is, my legs aren't what they used to be and climbing the 7,000 Steps takes its toll.
You'd like to make the delivery for me? Really? That would be kind of you. Here, take this bag of supplies. At the top of the steps you'll see the offering chest. Just leave the bag inside and you're done.

name: Clean Sweep
objective: cleanse the Ancestral Tomb
first_tasks: kill the ash spawn that defile the Ancestral Tomb

first_task_locations.description: an Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple

locations.name: Ancestral Tombs
locations.description: tombs where dark elves inter their dead

tools: Elder Othreloth gives the player a key that opens the door to the Ancestral Tomb
description:
The Ancestral Tombs are where we inter our dead. They are sacred places, meant to honor their passing. Sadly, we've been unable to use the Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple as of late, and have resorted to other locations to scatter the remains.
Those foul vermin... the abominations we call ash spawn have risen from the ashes of our own ancestors. They're befouling the memories of our forefathers by defiling their remains.
Could you cleanse the tomb for us, wanderer? That would be most kind. Here, this key should open the door to the tomb.

name: A Chance Arrangement
objective: put Brand-Shei out of the business permanently
first_tasks: tell Brynjolf when you are ready, steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand, and place Madesi's silver ring in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing

reward.description: the player will be well-paid

characters.name: Madesi
characters.description: a male merchant

characters.name: Brand-Shei
characters.description: a male merchant

tools: Brynjolf will cause a distraction
description:
I've got a bit of an errand to perform, but I need an extra pair of hands. And in my line of work, extra hands are well-paid.
It's simple... I'm going to cause a distraction and you're going to steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand. Once you have it, I want you to place it in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing.
There's someone that wants to see Brand-Shei put out of business permanently. That's all you need to know. Now, you tell me when you're ready and we'll get started.

name: Caught Red Handed
objective: help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
first_tasks: gather 3 Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn, and confront Haelga with the Marks of Dibella

characters.name: Haelga
characters.description: a devout female worshiper of Dibella

characters.name: Dibella
characters.description: the goddess of love and passion

characters.name: Bolli, Hofgrir, Indaryn
characters.description: the three men Haelga slept with

items.name: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella

tools: when Haelga sleeps with a man, Haelga gives the man a Mark of Dibella
description:
I hate Haelga! It's everything about her. She's disgusting. I think she takes her worship of Dibella a bit too seriously.
Do you know she's slept with three different men in the last month alone? What kind of a woman would do such a thing? Just for once, I'd like to see her squirm... to rub her nose in it.
Actually, there is a way to do this, but I don't think I could get away with doing it. She'd kill me if she found out. You see, I happen to know after she makes love, she gives her partner a token of her affection called a Mark of Dibella. If you confront her with three of the Marks of Dibella, she'd be so embarrassed... well, I don't know what she'd do!
Oh, this is going to be great! You need to get the Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn. Not sure how you're going to do that, but try your best. Then just confront Haelga with them and the rest works itself out.

name: An Offer
objective: help Calcelmo with his research
first_tasks: bring the Dwemer sword you bough from Warmaiden's to Calcelmo

quest_giver.name: Calcelmo
quest_giver.description: a scholar researching the Dwemer, giving quest via "Letter from Calcelmo"

reward.description: handsome pay

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: the player

tools: "Letter from Calcelmo" is addressed toward the player
description:
Letter from Calcelmo
by Calcelmo

Dragonborn,
It has come to my attention you may have recently acquired a certain Dwemer sword from Warmaiden's.
I'm not sure how such an object came to find itself resting there... but I've been trying to obtain one for my research.
If you still have it, or if not, find another one, I would be most appreciative if you were to bring it to me here in Markarth. I will pay handsomely.

Sincerely,
Calcelmo

name: The Burglary Job
objective: commit a burglary
first_tasks: break into a house, and steal a specific item

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

tools: the player can't kill anyone who lives in the house or they forfeit the payment
description:
I have a little job for you. Pretty simple. Break into a house, grab a specific item and get out before they realize what's going on.
The catch is you can't kill anyone who lives there or you forfeit the payment. You ready for some good old-fashioned burglary?

name: Bullying Braith
objective: convince Braith to stop bullying Lars Battle-Born
first_tasks: talk to Braith

quest_giver.name: Lars Battle-Born
quest_giver.description: a young boy who can't fight

reward.description: the player will be Lars Battle-Born' best friend forever
septims

characters.name: Braith
characters.description: a girl

tools: NONE
description:
I'm having trouble. Braith bullies me all the time. All the elders think I'm a milk drinker 'cause I can't fight. Nobody understands.
If you can get Braith to leave me alone, I'll be your best friend... forever! I'll pay you, too! My whole life's savings - two septims!

name: Briarheart Necropsy
objective: examine a Briarheart for Neloth so that he can improve his heart stone experiments
first_tasks: find a Briarheart

first_task_locations.description: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim

groups.name: Briarhearts
groups.description: fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes

tools: Briarhearts remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds, putting their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces
description:
I've been having difficulties with my heart stone experiments.
Have you heard of the Briarhearts? They are fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes. They actually remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds. It puts their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces.
Well, I'm hoping to do something similar... if I could connect a living being to the forces of nature... well... that would be formidable. I've done some experiments in this area, but, well, my test subjects are far too fragile. I'm hoping to learn some of the Briarheart techniques, their methods.
I need you to examine one of them. Just investigate as much as you can. The Forsworn live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim. From there, you're on your own. I'm given to understand that they are not difficult to find, if you gather my inference.

name: The Break of Dawn
objective: kill Malkoran, and retrieve the Dawnbreaker
first_tasks: enter Kilkreath

quest_giver.name: Meridia
quest_giver.description: the lady of light, a goddess

reward.name: Dawnbreaker
reward.description: Meridia's token, a mighty sword that burns undead

characters.name: Malkoran
characters.description: a necromancer who defiles Kilkreath and traps the souls of the people killed in the ongoing war

tools: NONE
description:
The Necromancer Malkoran defiles my shrine with vile corruptions, trapping lost souls left in the wake of this war to do his bidding. Worse still, he uses the power stored within my own token to fuel his foul deeds.
Mortals call my token Dawnbreaker, for it was forged in a holy light that breaks upon my foes, burning away corruption and false life. You will enter my shrine, destroy Malkoran, and retrieve this mighty blade.
I have brought you here, mortal, to be my champion. You will do this. I have commanded it!

name: Bow to the Master
objective: retrieve Dravin Llanith's stolen bow
first_tasks: find the thieves who stole Dravin Llanith's bow

reward.description: Dravin Llanith will pay the player what he can

tools: NONE
description:
A few days ago, some thieves from Riften broke in here and stole it! Can you imagine? Took the only thing of value we had. It was a family heirloom. I can't even put a price on how much that thing means to me.
I'm sure that they are from Riften. I bumped into them when I was coming back to my farm after buying supplies. I know those lowlifes took it with them back to the Ratway. They left an unmistakable stench behind.
If you have the guts to head into the Ratway and get my bow back, I'll pay you what I can. It would be nice to have it back... means a lot to me.

name: Breaching Security
objective: assassinate Gaius Maro, and implicate him in a plot to kill the Emperor
first_tasks: go to Dragon Bridge, observe Gaius Maro's departure, follow him, waylay him in one of the major cities, kill him, and plant the false evidence on his body

quest_giver.name: Gabriella
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: Olava's token as a bonus, if the player does not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road

characters.name: Astrid
characters.description: the player's female guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Gaius Maro
characters.description: the son of Commander Maro, a member of the Penitus Oculatus

characters.name: Olava the Feeble
characters.description: Gabriella's old female friend, and a powerful seer

characters.name: Commander Maro
characters.description: the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus, and handles the Emperor's security

tools: Astrid sent the player to Gabriella
the Emperor will arrive in Skyrim: the Penitus Oculatus will need to begin its preparations immediately
Astrid and Gabriella have devised a plan to break Commander Maro and cripple the Emperor's protection
Gaius Maro is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim
Olava's token is to be given to Olava the Feeble for a reading of the player's future
description:
Dear sibling. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, his security service, the Penitus Oculatus, will need to begin its preparations immediately. Security is being handled by a Commander Maro. Astrid and I have devised a plan to break the man, and in doing so, cripple the Emperor's protection.
You are to slay the commander's son, Gaius Maro, and once he is dead, plant false evidence on his body implicating him in a plot to kill the Emperor. He is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Go there now. Observe Gaius Maro's departure, and follow him. Waylay him in one of the cities, and send his soul to Sithis. Once he's dead, plant the incriminating letter on his body, and let fate take care of the rest. Oh, and one final thing...
To earn your bonus, do not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road. Kill him in one of the other major cities he'll be visiting. There, the body will be discovered quickly, as will the letter implicating Gaius Maro in the plot to assassinate the Emperor. Do that, and Astrid has authorized me to grant you a rather unique bonus. It is a special token, to be given to Olava the Feeble, in Whiterun. Olava is an old and dear friend, and a powerful seer. The token entitles you to a reading of your future. It's an opportunity one should not pass up.

name: Bound Until Death
objective: lure Titus Mede II to Skyrim so that the Dark Brotherhood can assassinate him
first_tasks: assassinate Vittoria Vici at her own wedding

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: a significant bonus if the player kills Vittoria Vici while she addresses the wedding guests

characters.name: Titus Mede II
characters.description: the Emperor

characters.name: Vittoria Vici
characters.description: the overseer of the the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude, and the first cousin of the Emperor

characters.name: Night Mother
characters.description: the female spirit who guides the Dark Brotherhood

tools: the Night Mother spoke to the player

Vittoria Vici has Imperial connections, and her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks: their marriage is a step toward reconciliation between the Empire and the Stormcloaks, but a murder at the wedding will stall the peace process and send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire
description:
Splendid. We're ready to begin. Or, more specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to.
Now then. I hope you have something nice to wear. Because you're going to a wedding. Well, more like the public reception. It should be a lovely affair. You'll mingle with the guests, eat some cake... stab the bride.
Oh yes. You've got to kill the bride. At her wedding. And they say romance is dead. Your target's name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Her death will cause an uproar, which is exactly what we want.
Vittoria Vici is the first cousin to our dear Emperor, Titus Mede II. Vici has obvious Imperial connections. Her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks. Their union is a step toward reconciliation. So if there's a murder at the wedding... Not only will it stall the peace process - it will send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire. The Emperor's hand will be forced. He'll have to travel to Skyrim to deal with the aftermath... and he'll find the Dark Brotherhood waiting.
Vici is likely to address her guests frequently, as is the wedding custom. Kill her when she does that, and I promise you a significant bonus.
Now go. And give the city of Solitude a celebration they're not likely to forget.

name: The Book of Love
objective: act as the hands of Mara in the world
first_tasks: help Fastred with her fickle love

reward.description: the touch of Mara

characters.name: Mara
characters.description: the goddess of love

characters.name: Fastred
characters.description: a young woman

tools: NONE
description:
I am devoted to the Goddess Mara, who gave mortals the gift of love that they might have a hint of eternity. Her blessings are many. To love is to know the true nature of the gods.
Not all can hear the broad echoes of deepest dawn. To receive the touch of Mara, you must first act as her hands in the world. Explore the facets of the infinite jewel. Are you prepared, then, to help bring the light across this land?
The dawn surely opens upon you, child. You must bear its light that all may see. Mara has reflected an image to me. A young woman... almost a girl... her fickle love must resolve itself. The village of Ivarstead. The woman, Fastred. This is the prayer heard by the goddess and relayed to her servants.
Return when Fastred has seen her path. I will entreat Mara on your behalf.

name: The Bonds of Matrimony
objective: get married
first_tasks: attend your wedding tomorrow, from dawn until dusk

reward.description: a spouse

characters.name: Mara
characters.description: the goddess of love

tools: the player told Maramal that the player wants to get married
these are difficult times
description:
Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples.
You wish to be married to your future spouse? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times. Your wedding will be held tomorrow, from dawn until dusk, in the Temple of Mara.

name: Boethiah's Calling
objective: get a glimpse of Boethiah
first_tasks: gain someone's trust, lead him to the shrine above, instruct him to touch the pillar of sacrifice to trap him, and kill him with the ceremonial blade

reward.description: Boethiah will appear before the player

characters.name: Boethiah
characters.description: the lady of plots and the dark warrior, an evil goddess

tools: NONE
description:
We are forged by Boethiah's example. We carve our will upon the world through our tongues and our blades. You? You are nothing. An empty vapor, dispersed by the slightest breeze.
If you desire a glimpse of Boethiah, our Dark Mistress, then this is what you must do. First, prove your tongue can wield a lie. Find someone. Gain his trust. Lead him to the shrine above. Next, instruct your thrall to touch the Pillar of Sacrifice. Its magic will ensnare him, rendering him helpless. Then, girded with certitude, plant the ceremonial blade deeply, so that the waters of his heart wash over you.
If your will is strong enough, it will stir Boethiah in her Dark Mansion, and she will appear before us.

name: Bloody Nose
objective: win the wager against Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
first_tasks: match Hofgrir Horse-Crusher's bet, and beat him in a fistfight

quest_giver.name: Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
quest_giver.description: the man with the the strongest arms in all of Skyrim

reward.description: Hofgrir Horse-Crusher's purse of septims

tools: rules for the fistfight: no weapons, no tricks, no magic
description:
Bah, I'm not afraid of anything out here. Walls are just a weakling's hiding spot. Now me, I'm no weakling. In fact, I bet I've got the strongest arms in all of Skyrim.
You bet against me? Oh! Sounds like I've got a challenger. Tell you what. How about a friendly wager, just between us. I bet you my entire purse of septims I can beat you in a fistfight. You match the bet and we fight until one of us gives in.
All right, remember... this is a clean fight. No weapons, no tricks. And none of those fancy magic spells, either. Here we go!

name: Blood's Honor
objective: claim the head of a Glenmoril Witch so that Kodlak Whitemane can cure the Companions' lycanthropy
first_tasks: seek out the Glenmoril witches, kill them, and collect their heads

quest_giver.name: Kodlak Whitemane
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Companions, and a Nord who wants to end up in Sovngarde

groups.name: Companions
groups.description: a band of honorable warriors cursed with lycanthropy

characters.name: Hircine
characters.description: the god of the werewolves, claims dead werewolves in the Hunting Grounds

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied afterlife of heroic Nords

locations.name: Hunting Grounds
locations.description: Hircine's realm, a place where the player can hunt forever

tools: the Companions are nearly five thousand years old: the Companions became werewolves a few hundred years ago when the Glenmoril witches promised to grant the Companions great power in exchange for hunting their lord Hircine
the Companions were deceived: lycanthropy affects not just the Companions' bodies, but the Companions' spirits as well
description:
Have you heard the story of how we came to be werewolves?
The Companions are nearly five thousand years old. This matter of beastblood has only troubled us for a few hundred. One of my predecessors was a good, but short-sighted man. He made a bargain with the witches of Glenmoril Coven. If the Companions would hunt in the name of their lord, Hircine, we would be granted great power.
The Companions of old became werewolves. They did not believe the change would be permanent. The witches offered payment, like anyone else. But we had been deceived. The disease, you see, affects not just our bodies. It seeps into the spirit. Upon death, werewolves are claimed by Hircine for his Hunting Grounds. For some, this is a paradise. They want nothing more than to chase prey with their master for eternity. And that is their choice. But I am still a true Nord. And I wish for Sovngarde as my spirit home.
I've spent my twilight years trying to find a cure myself. And now I've found the answer. The witches' magic ensnared us, and only their magic can release us. They won't give it willingly, but we can extract their foul powers by force. I want you to seek them out. Go to their coven in the wilderness. Strike them down as a true warrior of the wild. And bring me their heads. The seat of their abilities. From there, we may begin to undo centuries of impurity.

name: The Blessings of Nature
objective: restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
first_tasks: get Nettlebane

characters.name: Kynareth
characters.description: the goddess of nature

items.name: Gildergreen
items.description: the big holy tree of Kynareth that died

items.name: Eldergleam
items.description: the ancient parent tree of the Gildergreen

items.name: Nettlebane
items.description: a weapon that can cut the Eldergleam

tools: disciples of Kynareth used to travel far to hear the winds of Kynareth in the Gildergreen's branches
description:
This is the Gildergreen. It was planted as a seedling in the early years of Whiterun. Disciples of Kynareth could sense something holy in it, and traveled far to hear the winds of the goddess in its branches. Of course, not as many pilgrims these days. A big dead tree isn't very inspiring if you're coming to worship the divine of wind and rains. Kynareth gives life, and we need a living tree to be her symbol.
I've thought about restoring the Gildergreen... Trees like this never really die. They only slumber. I think if we had some of the sap from the parent tree, Eldergleam, we could wake up its child. But even if you could get to the Eldergleam, you couldn't tap it. Not with any normal metal. If you want to help, you'll need something to cut into it first.
Eldergleam is older than metal, from a time before men or elves. To even affect it, you have to tap into the old magic. You'll have to deal with the Hagravens. I've heard about a weapon they've made for sacrificing Kynareth's creations. It's called "Nettlebane." The hags terrify me, or I would have gone after it myself. It's held in a Hagraven nest called Orphan Rock

name: A Blade in the Dark
objective: help Delphine stop dragons from coming back to life
first_tasks: go to an ancient dragon burial with Delphine, and kill a dragon

reward.description: Delphine will tell the player everything she knows

tools: the Blades killed the dragons off centuries ago
description:
Dragons aren't just coming back, they're coming back to life. They weren't gone somewhere for all these years. They were dead, killed off centuries ago by my predecessors. Now something's happening to bring them back to life. And I need you to help me stop it.
I've visited their ancient burial mounds and found them empty. And I've figured out where the next one will come back to life. We're going to go there, and you're going to kill that dragon. If we succeed, I'll tell you anything you want to know.
We are going to Kynesgrove. There's an ancient dragon burial near there. If we can get there before the dragon comes back, maybe we'll learn how to stop it.

name: Bleak Falls Barrow
objective: retrieve the Dragonstone for Farengar Secret-Fire
first_tasks: find the Dragonstone in the main chamber of Bleak Falls Barrow

items.name: Dragonstone
items.description: a stone tablet that contains a map of dragon burial sites

tools: NONE
description:
I could use someone to fetch something for me. Well, when I say fetch, I really mean delve into a dangerous ruin in search of an ancient stone tablet that may or may not actually be there.
I, ah, learned of a certain stone tablet said to be housed in Bleak Falls Barrow - a 'Dragonstone,' said to contain a map of dragon burial sites. Go to Bleak Falls Barrow, find this tablet - no doubt interred in the main chamber - and bring it to me. Simplicity itself.

name: Look Mom, I Made a Dagger!
objective: help a blacksmith
first_tasks: smith an iron dagger
tools: the blacksmith gives the player everything the player needs to make an iron dagger
description: I could use some help around the forge. How about you smith me an iron dagger? Here's everything you need to make one. Go ahead.

name: Blood on the Ice
objective: investigate the brutal murders of women
first_tasks: check out a trail of blood leading away from the murder scene
talk with Helgird

first_task_locations.name: Hall of the Dead
first_task_locations.description: a temple where the dead are prepared for burial

characters.name: Helgird
characters.description: a bit crazy woman who knows her dead bodies

characters.name: Susanna
characters.description: a barmaid from Candlehearth Hall, and the victim at the murder scene

tools: Susanna and other two girls were killed the same way: stabbed and cut apart with a blade
there's a war: no one has time to spend on murder investigations
description:
Another girl killed. The victim is Susanna, from Candlehearth Hall. Served me a drink just a few nights ago... but I can't say I knew her.
She was killed the same way as the other two girls. Looks like she was stabbed, and then cut apart. It's like an animal got to her, but these are the wounds of a blade.
You could help us with the investigation. We're stretched thin as it is with the war. Nobody has the time to spend on this. Not pleasant, but it's the truth.
Here are some starting points for you. I noticed a trail of blood leading away from here. Helgird's taken Susanna's body into the Hall of the Dead to prepare for burial. She's a little crazy, but if she knows anything, it's dead bodies.

name: The Black Star
objective: become the champion of Azura
first_tasks: ask around about an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night

first_task_locations.name: Winterhold
first_task_locations.description: a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it

quest_giver.name: Aranea Ienith
quest_giver.location: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

characters.name: Azura
characters.description: the queen of the night sky, a goddess

tools: Azura has given Aranea Ienith the gift of foresight
description:
Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here.
Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted.
You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is cryptic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.

name: Black Book
objective: learn the secrets of a Black Book
first_tasks: find the Black Book

reward.name: Black Book
reward.description: a book containing dangerous secrets

tools: NONE
description:
I know things. Hidden things. Things you aren't supposed to know.
I'm not alright! No! That's what I'm trying to say. The secrets. They're in there. In there deep. Can't get them out. They're in my head. They might leak out. Don't want them crawling into your head, too. Like me.
The Black Book taught me the secrets. It shoved them in my head. With black slick fingers. My fingers are too short. I can't get them out. I didn't find the Black Book. It found me. Here. I'll show you. See. Right there, in White Ridge Barrow. But don't go there. You don't want these things in your head. You don't!

name: Before the Storm
objective: inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
first_tasks: find Balgruuf

quest_giver.name: Alvor
quest_giver.description: a man who saw a dragon flying down from the south

reward.description: Alvor will be in the player's debt

characters.name: Balgruuf
characters.description: the Jarl of Whiterun

locations.name: Helgen
locations.description: a village that was destroyed by a dragon

tools: the player told Alvor that there was a dragon in Helgen
description:
What? A dragon? In Helgen? That explains what I saw earlier... a dragon flying down from the south... I was hoping I was wrong about what I thought it was... Didn't want to believe my own eyes, is all.
The Jarl needs to know if there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.

name: Extinguishing the Flames of Rebellion
objective: put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
first_tasks: fight your way in Ulric's castle, and make Ulfric face justice

quest_giver.name: General Tullius
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Imperial Legion

reward.description: men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the man who leads the Stormcloaks

tools: General Tullius is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel
description:
All right. It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion. You all have fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point.
Ulfric thinks he can hide behind the walls of his castle. But we will fight our way in and drag him out through the rubble to face justice. Because this is the end for them, the Stormcloaks will fight like cornered rats. They will be fierce and crafty. But they are no match for Legionnaires.
You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating. The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded.
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

name: The Bedlam Job
objective: steal whatever you can to make an impression
first_tasks: steal from anywhere in Whiterun without anyone seeing you steal

quest_giver.name: Delvin Mallory
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

reward.description: the player gets to keep everything the player steals

tools: NONE
description:
Sometimes we like to remind a city that we mean business, so we hit it hard. Just steal whatever we can until we've made an impression.
Simple right? Almost. The catch is it doesn't count if anyone sees you take it. The message needs to be clear; we work in the shadows.
Steal from anywhere in Whiterun, and you even get to keep everythin' you stole. So, you in?

name: Storm over Whiterun
objective: take Whiterun in the name of the Stormcloaks
first_tasks: tear through the barricades, and find a way to drop the drawbridge into Whiterun

first_task_locations.name: Whiterun
first_task_locations.description: a city with tall, yet old and crumbling walls

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks, a Nord

groups.name: Stormcloaks
groups.description: Nord rebel forces opposing the Empire

tools: Galmar Stone-Fist is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim
Imperial legionnaires have been stationed on the walls of Whiterun
description:
This is it men! They say that our cause is false and that we are nothing more than thieves, thugs and murderers! But no! We are farmers! We are craftsmen! We are sons and daughters of shopkeepers, maid servants and soldiers!
We are the sons and daughters of Skyrim! And we have come this far because our cause is true. Because we fight as one. And because our hearts are bursting with anger! What we do here today, we do for our country! For all the true Nords of Skyrim!
Whiterun's walls are tall, but they are old and crumbling, like the Empire whose Legion lines them. They've barricades to block us, but we'll tear through them and the Imperials behind them! Our objective is the drawbridge. If we can find a way to drop it, the city will be ours!
Everyone on me. Let's show these Imperial milk drinkers what true Nords look like! Rrrrraaaaaarrrrr!!!!!

name: Weather the Storm
objective: protect Whiterun from the Stormcloak invasion
first_tasks: go with Legate Rikke

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the man who leads the Stormcloaks

groups.name: Stormcloaks
groups.description: rebel forces opposing the Empire in Skyrim

tools: Legate Rikke is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the Imperial legion will send a message to Ulfric and the rebel Jarls who support him
description:
This is it men! This is an important day for the Empire and for the Legion. And for all of Skyrim.
This is the day we send a message to Ulfric and the rebel Jarls who support him. We will protect Whiterun from Stormcloaks. But make no mistake. What we do here today, we do for Skyrim and her people. By cutting out the disease of this rebellion, we will make this country whole again!
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

name: A Crumbling Empire
objective: conquer Solitude, and free Skyrim from the Empire
first_tasks: fight your way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the Imperial legion itself

quest_giver.name: Ulfric
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Stormcloaks

locations.name: Castle Dour
locations.description: the headquarters of the Imperial legion

tools: Ulfric is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim
Sovngarde awaits those who die fighting
the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be: full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free
description:
This is it men! It's time to make this city ours!
We come to this moment carried by the sacrifices and the courage of our fellows. Those who have fallen. And those still bearing the shields to our right. On this day, our enemy will know the fullness of our determination, the true depth of our anger, and the exalted righteousness of our cause.
The gods are watching. The spirits of our ancestors are stirring. And the men under suns yet to dawn will be transformed by what we do here today. Fear neither pain, nor darkness. For Sovngarde awaits those who die with weapons in their hands, and courage in their hearts.
We now fight our way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the legion itself! And in that moment, the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be. Full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free!
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the sons and daughters of Skyrim!

name: Azra's Staffs
objective: retrieve a magical staff made by Azra Nightwielder for Neloth
first_tasks: find the staff

quest_giver.name: Neloth
quest_giver.description: a wizard, and a collector of magical staffs

reward.description: a staff made by Neloth

characters.name: Azra Nightwielder
characters.description: the original shadowmage, whose advances in magic are legendary, a man

tools: NONE
description:
I have a slightly more personal request. You see, I'm a collector. Of staffs. Magical staffs. In particular, those made by Azra Nightwielder.
Azra Nightwielder was the original shadowmage. His advances in magic are legendary. Less well known is that he was also a pioneer in the field of enchanting staffs. Nightwielder's creations don't really hold up in comparison to what can be made today, but they have a sentimental value for me. You understand.
Through some divinations, I believe I've located one of Azra Nightwielder's staffs in Frostmere Depths. If you retrieve it, I'll give you a staff of my own making.

name: An Axe to Find
objective: retrieve Glover Mallory's Ancient Nordic Pickaxe
first_tasks: tell Crescius Caerellius give Glover Mallory his Ancient Nordic Pickaxe back

reward.description: Glover Mallory will pay the player

items.name: Ancient Nordic Pickaxe
items.description: a pickaxe, the only tool tough enough to crack stalhrim, becoming rare because forging them is a lost art

characters.name: Crescius Caerellius
characters.description: a foolish old man

tools: NONE
description:
You haven't seen Crescius Caerellius have you? That foolish old man's taken my pickaxe again!
I'm not fussing over a simple pickaxe. No, no, no. This isn't just your run-of-the-mill pickaxe... I'm talking about an Ancient Nordic Pickaxe. They don't exactly grow on trees, you know.
An Ancient Nordic Pickaxe is the only tool tough enough to crack stalhrim, is what it is. Not many of those beauties left in the world... forging them is a lost art.
Look, if you see Crescius, tell him to give me that pickaxe back and I'll pay you for the trouble.

name: At the Summit of Miraak's Defeat
objective: destroy Miraak and lift his master's shadow from the land
first_tasks: kill Miraak

quest_giver.name: Frea
quest_giver.description: a woman whose father sacrificed himself for the player

characters.name: Miraak
characters.description: the player's enemy

tools: NONE
description:
Go. My father sacrificed himself so that you could destroy Miraak and lift his master's shadow from the land.
Go, then. Kill Miraak. Do not fail.

name: Arniel's Endeavors
objective: help Arniel Gane with his unofficial research project
first_tasks: bring Arniel Gane 10 Dwemer Cogs

quest_giver.name: Arniel Gane
quest_giver.description: a fellow mage of the College of Winterhold

tools: the player has been rising through the ranks of the College of Winterhold
description:
I can't help but notice that you're doing quite well for yourself, rising through the ranks and all.
It may not be "official", but there is a, uhh, project I've been working on. I wonder if perhaps you could assist with it.
Just... Just bring me some Dwemer Cogs. I need to examine them for the methods used in forging them. Ten of them should be enough for me to get a better understanding of how they were crafted. That's all I need, all right?

name: A Suspicious Deal
objective: get the item from Enthir for Arniel Gane
first_tasks: talk to Enthir and convince him to give you the item Arniel Gane hired Enthir to acquire

characters.name: Enthir
characters.description: a shady merchant

tools: NONE
description:
There is something you can do for me.
I had retained Enthir's services in, uhh, acquiring something specific. But now he's refusing to deliver. Could you perhaps speak with him, and see if we can come to some sort of arrangement?

name: Thorough Cleaning
objective: purify a soul gem
first_tasks: place the soul gem in 3 Dwarven Convectors and heat them for 3 seconds with Arniel Gane's spell

quest_giver.name: Arniel Gane
quest_giver.description: a scholar fascinated by the Dwemer

items.name: Dwarven Convectors, Convectors
items.description: Dwemer machines that were used to purify gems

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: a lost race of people, masters of magic

tools: the Dwemer's greatest achievement has also been their greatest mystery: their instant, unexplainable disappearance
Arniel Gane tries to find out what happened to the Dwemer though experimentation
the player brought Arniel Gane Dwemer parts and a soul gem before
description:
The Dwemer, they were uhh, masters of magic in a way we can't even begin to conceive of. Their greatest achievement, however, has also been their greatest, shall we say... mystery.
This mystery is their disappearance, of course! Instant, unexplainable. The stories have fascinated me... Ever since I was young, I wanted to know what really happened. After years and years of work, I'm closing in on a way to investigate what happened through experimentation.
Only now... Well, it's simply a disaster. Without boring you with the, ahh, details, I am attempting to re-create the circumstances of the event. I used the soul gem you brought me for this. The soul gem by itself isn't enough, you see. It needs to be altered, purified. The Dwemer had machines for this sort of thing. I attempted to build my own, based on designs and using parts you helped to provide. My very own Dwemer machine. It worked, but not fully. And the uhh... The device was destroyed in the process.
The designs for my Convector were based on real Dwemer machines, so there may still be some in existence. I'd go looking myself, but uhh... Yes, there are calculations to double- and triple-check. Many calculations. Perhaps you could seek out these Convectors in Skyrim ruins? I can even teach you the spell to heat them.
Just place the soul gem inside, and heat the Convector. At least three seconds. You'll almost certainly need to find multiple Convectors. I suspect it may be due to the nature of the soul gem versus the crystals this was intended for. Destroys the equipment in the process.
But, ahh... It's effective. Three times, and the crystal should be ready for the next step. Isn't this exciting?

name: Argonian Ale Extraction
objective: bring Brenuin a bottle of Argonian Ale
first_tasks: steal the bottle f Argonian Ale

reward.description: a healing potion

tools: NONE
description:
I'm drunk only if I can help it. But damn if I ain't almost sober.
Hey. In the Bannered Mare, there's this bottle of Argonian Ale. The good stuff. Get it for me. They won't even know it's gone. Come on...
Argonian Ale! I can almost taste it! I have something for you. This here healing potion. I, er, "found" it in a temple.

name: Animal Extermination
objective: clear out Bleakcoast Cave for the Jarl
first_tasks: kill the beasts

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Winterhold

tools: NONE
description:
The Jarl of Winterhold has asked for our help. It seems that predators have taken up residence in Bleakcoast Cave and have been attacking farmers and travelers.
Someone's got to head out there and take care of the beasts. Get it taken care of right away. Nobody wants a hungry animal left roaming along the roads.

name: Unwanted Tenants
objective: kill a beast for Pavo Attius
first_tasks: kill the beast

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

characters.name: Pavo Attius
characters.description: a man

tools: NONE
description:
Pavo Attius has asked for our help. It seems a predator has invaded his home, and someone needs to clear the beast out.
Be cautious. Beasts are not nearly as predictable as men. Give the thing a quick death.

name: Medresi Dran and the Wandering Dead
objective: discover the treasure of Angarvunde
first_tasks: clear the main chamber of restless undead

first_task_locations.name: Angarvunde
first_task_locations.description: an old tomb that is said to hold a treasure that bestows great power on the one who discovers it

reward.description: Medresi Dran will split the treasure of Angarvunde with the player

tools: Medresi Dran's work force ran away while excavating Angarvunde: they opened a chamber full of undead
description:
I'm on the verge of incredible wealth, but my cowardly work force ran at the first sign of danger. We were excavating this old tomb when we opened a chamber full of corpses. The team took one look, turned tail, and ran.
Legend says this tomb holds a treasure that bestows great power on the one who discovers it. Beyond that, not much more is known. Obviously, this treasure will fetch a good deal of gold, and I'm willing to let you share in the reward when we find it.
I'll tell you what. You help me get the treasure and I'll split it with you. First, I need you to clear the main chamber of those restless dead. I'll stay here until you're finished, planning our next move.
With my brains and your brawn, that treasure will soon be mine... uh, ours.

name: Andurs' Arkay Amulet
objective: retrieve Andurs' amulet of Arkay
first_tasks: search for Andurs' amulet of Arkay

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of burial and funeral rites

tools: NONE
description:
Perhaps you'll take pity on a humble priest who has lost something precious?
I lost my amulet of Arkay. It's the source of my divine powers and also a sacred badge of office. I misplaced it in the catacombs. I'd look for it, but I've been hearing noises down there. I fear the dead have become... restless. Without that amulet, I'm powerless to confront them.
Would you be willing to search for it? I'll just wait here and make sure nothing foul escapes the catacombs.

name: Dragonhide
objective: help Tolfdir finish his research on the Dragonhide
first_tasks: retrieve Kahvozein's Fang, and use it to carve a few heartscales off a dead dragon

reward.description: the first copy of the Dragonhide tome

items.name: Dragonhide
items.description: a protection spell, an improvement on the Ebonyflesh spell

tools: NONE
description:
I've been working on something. An improvement on the Ebonyflesh spell. I've made progress, but then hit a snag. I think perhaps you could help.
I made some progress using the essence of dragon scales. But they're just not quite potent enough. My knowledge of history is far from complete, but I did some research and discovered two things.
First, there are ancient references to dragon "heartscales". What little I could learn suggests they may be what I need. Second, there are stories of a dagger called Kahvozein's Fang, said to be sharp enough to carve heartscales off a dragon.
First you'll need to retrieve the dagger, then use it to carve a few heartscales off a dragon. Presumably a deceased one.
If my research succeeds, I certainly think you deserve the first copy of the Dragonhide spell tome.

name: Ancestral Worship
objective: help Golldir save Agna, and stop Vals Veran from defiling Hillgrund's Tomb
first_tasks: meet Golldir inside Hillgrund's Tomb, and go after Vals Veran with Golldir

quest_giver.name: Golldir
quest_giver.description: a man who is afraid of Hillgrund's Tomb

characters.name: Agna
characters.description: Golldir's aunt who raised Golldir

characters.name: Vals Veran
characters.description: a dark elf necromancer who has never seen eye to eye with Golldir's family

tools: NONE
description:
Can you help me? There's a necromancer in the tomb; doing Gods know what with my dead relatives.
The necromancer's called Vals Veran. My family has never really seen eye to eye with him and he has finally gone off the deep end. He's gone in to defile our family tomb by using our ancestors for his filthy dark elf necromancy.
My aunt went in after him, but she hasn't come out yet and I'm afraid to go in by myself. I'm not proud of it. I'm terrified of that place and Aunt Agna knows it. My Da locked me in there in a drunken rage when he left us... three days in there eating the offerings left for our dead before Aunt Agna found me.
I'll unlock the door and meet you inside, then you can lead the way. We should get after Vals Veran before he does more damage here.

name: Amulet of the Moon
objective: bring Kharjo's Moon Amulet back to him
first_tasks: find Kharjo's Moon Amulet

quest_giver.name: Kharjo
quest_giver.description: a caravaner from a warm land

tools: NONE
description:
A few days ago, our caravan was ambushed. A nuisance, really, but many of the marauders had quick fingers.
One of them stole my Moon Amulet, given to me by my mother when I was just a cub. It is my only memory of home in this cold land.
You offer to get my amulet back? We believe the bandits are a part of a group headquartered in Faldar's Tooth. Be careful. I miss my amulet, but a life cannot be replaced as easily.

name: Alduin's Bane
objective: defeat Alduin
first_tasks: take the Elder Scroll to the Time-Wound

quest_giver.name: Paarthurnax
quest_giver.description: a dragon, and the player's ally

items.name: Elder Scroll
items.description: a mythological scroll that can bend time itself

characters.name: Alduin
characters.description: an evil dragon

characters.name: Akatosh
characters.description: the god of dragons

tools: the player has the Elder Scroll
description:
You have it. The Scroll - the Elder Scroll. Time bends... touch. Time shudders at its touch. There is no question. You are doom-driven. Blessings of Akatosh. The very bones of the earth are at your disposal.
Go then. Fulfill your destiny. Take the Scroll to the Time-Wound. Do not delay. Alduin will be coming. He cannot miss the signs. You must defeat him.

name: Alduin's Wall
objective: locate Alduin's Wall in Sky Haven Temple
first_tasks: find the entrance to Sky Haven Temple with Esbern

reward.description: Alduin's Wall tells the player how to stop Alduin and avert the end of the world

characters.name: Alduin
characters.description: an evil dragon

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: a person who can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world

locations.name: Sky Haven Temple
locations.description: an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach

tools: the player is the Dragonborn
description:
Only a Dragonborn can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world!
But... I don't yet know how you can stop him. But Alduin's Wall does. I hope. It's in Sky Haven Temple, an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach.
Ah, yes. The entrance to Sky Haven Temple seems to be near what's now known as the Karthspire. We'll have to see what we find when we arrive there.
We should be careful. There's no telling what traps and wards the ancient Blades may have set.

name: Alchemist in Making
objective: use an alchemy lab to mix a couple of ingredients together
first_tasks: mix Wheat and Blisterwort together to make a healing potion

reward.description: a healing potion

tools: NONE
description:
You know how to use an alchemy lab right? Mix a couple of ingredients together, see what happens.
A little Wheat and Blisterwort makes a healing potion, if you didn't know. There's plenty of ingredients for sale, too.

name: Aftershock
objective: take care of a magical disturbance
first_tasks: contain the power from the Eye of Magnus with the Staff of Magnus

quest_giver.name: Tolfdir
quest_giver.description: a professor at the College of Winterhold

reward.description: a large portion of the reward from the Jarl of Markarth

items.name: Eye of Magnus
items.description: a powerful artifact that was held at the College of Winterhold

items.name: Staff of Magnus
items.description: a powerful staff that can contain energy from the Eye of Magnus

characters.name: Arch-Mage
characters.description: the leader of the College of Winterhold

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

tools: the player is the Arch-Mage
the player should have the Staff of Magnus
description:
There is something you should be aware of, Arch-Mage. We've been contacted by the Jarl of Markarth. It would seem there's some sort of disturbance.
From what few details we were given, it sounds quite familiar. I suspect that the power released by the Eye of Magnus was not fully contained, and has coalesced in this part of Skyrim. I do hope you still have the Staff of Magnus someplace. I suspect you're going to need it to contain the power.
I'm sure the Jarl will be quite pleased to. I think it only fitting that the Arch-Mage personally receive a large portion of the reward.

name: Culling the Beast
objective: kill thin-blooded vampires
first_tasks: find the thin-blooded vampires
tools: NONE
description:
A bunch of feral vampires are running wild, upsetting the mortals. When the prey is riled, it makes things difficult for us.
Go cull the brutish beasts in Haemar's Shame before the problem gets out of hand. At first you may pity the thin-bloods. But after disposing of a few, you realize they aren't worth the worry.

name: Cleansing Light
objective: destroy the head vampire to scatter its minions
first_tasks: find the head vampire
tools: NONE
description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a vampire lair at Movarth's Lair.
Destroying the head vampire is usually sufficient to scatter its minions, though it's best to destroy every last one of them.
I suspect there's more wherever he came from. We cannot afford to relax.

name: Chasing Echoes
objective: get information about an Elder Scroll from Valerica
first_tasks: search for clues about Valerica's whereabouts with Serana

first_task_locations.description: a courtyard in Castle Volkihar with Valerica's garden, a peaceful place that Serana's father could not stand

characters.name: Valerica
characters.description: Serana's mother

characters.name: Dexion
characters.description: a male Moth Priest

locations.name: Castle Volkihar
locations.description: a castle, and the home of Serana's family

tools: Dexion said the player and Serana needed two other Elder Scrolls
Valerica told Serana that she'd go somewhere safe, somewhere that Serana's father would never search
description:
That Moth Priest, Dexion. He said we needed two other Elder Scrolls. I think I know where we can start looking. We need to find my mother, Valerica. She'll definitely know where one of the Scrolls is, and if we're lucky, she actually has it herself.
The last time I saw her, she said that she'd go somewhere safe... somewhere that my father would never search. Other than that, she wouldn't tell me anything. But the way she said it... "someplace he would never search." It was cryptic, yet she called attention to it.
Wait... There's a courtyard in Castle Volkihar. I used to help her tend a garden there. All of the ingredients for our potions came from there. She used to say that my father couldn't stand the place. Too... peaceful. I don't think we'll actually trip over her there. But it's worth a look.

name: Bolstering the Ranks
objective: find Florentius and recruit him into the Dawnguard
first_tasks: ask Isran whether he knows where Florentius is

quest_giver.name: Sorine Jurard
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Dawnguard

characters.name: Florentius
characters.description: a former priest of Arkay, and an eccentric, yet trustworthy man

characters.name: Isran
characters.description: a man who never got along with Florentius, and the leader of the Dawnguard

characters.name: Gunmar
characters.description: a male member of the Dawnguard

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of death

tools: Gunmar and Sorine Jurard think that the Dawnguard are going to need Florentius to help against the vampires
Florentius had regular contact with the Vigilants: Isran has kept track of the Vigilants
description:
These vampires are a new threat, and a truly deadly one. Gunmar and I agree that we're going to need Florentius to help.
Gunmar and I have a lot of work to do here, so we were hoping that maybe you could track him down. He's a priest of Arkay. Well, he was. It's... it's complicated. Florentius's a little eccentric, but we can trust him and we could definitely use his skills.
Here's the thing. We don't know where Florentius is. Haven't seen him in years. I think he had regular contact with the Vigilants, and I know Isran kept track of them... So maybe you could ask Isran if he knows anything?
Just keep in mind that Isran... well, he might not like the idea. The two of them just never got along.

name: The Bloodstone Chalice
objective: fill the Bloodstone Chalice for Harkon
first_tasks: follow Garan Marethi to the Bloodstone Chalice

characters.name: Harkon
characters.description: the Lord of the player and Garan Marethi's vampire clan

items.name: Bloodstone Chalice
items.description: a chalice that is able to increase the potency of the player's vampiric powers

tools: the player told Garan Marethi that Harkon wants the Bloodstone Chalice without addressing Harkon properly as Lord Harkon
Harkon has owned the Bloodstone Chalice for a long time
description:
Lord Harkon. Remember your place. Now, he wants the Chalice, then.
You've heard of the Bloodstone Chalice? The Chalice has been in Lord Harkon's possession for quite some time now. It is, when used properly, able to increase the potency of our powers.
Lord Harkon has neglected using the Chalice for ages. If he wants it filled now, then grander things are afoot. This is good.
Follow me. I'll take you to the Bloodstone Chalice.

name: Awakening
objective: find out what vampires are looking for at Dimhollow Crypt
first_tasks: meet Tolan, who will try to assist you

quest_giver.name: Isran
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

characters.name: Tolan
characters.description: a male member of the Vigilants of Stendarr

tools: the Dawnguard are getting the Dawnguard Fortress back into shape
Isran gives the player a crossbow: crossbows are good for hunting vampires before they get too close
description:
I need someone out in the field, taking the fight to the damn vampires, while we're getting the fort back into shape...
Go see what the vampires were looking for in Dimhollow Crypt. With any luck, they'll still be there. Here, you should take a crossbow. Good for hunting out those fiends before they get too close.
Tolan'll meet you at Dimhollow. He will try to assist you. Watch out. Vigilants of Stendarr were never trained for vampire hunting...

name: Ancient Technology
objective: retrieve Dwemer schematics for Sorine Jurard
first_tasks: find the Dwemer schematics

quest_giver.name: Sorine Jurard
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Dawnguard, and an avid tinkerer

reward.description: improved crossbows for the Dawnguard

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct race of people famed for their mechanical constructs

tools: NONE
description:
I want to add some punch to our crossbow capabilities, I've done all I can on my own. I need a little inspiration. I've always been fascinated with Dwemer artifacts. I take them apart, poke around in their guts, and try to figure things out - with mixed results.
But as luck would have it, I've tracked down the location of some actual Dwemer diagram drawings! So, if you'd be a dear and collect those plans for me at Irkngthand?
With the Dwemer diagrams and a little tinkering I should be able to improve the capabilities of our crossbows.

name: Ancient Power
objective: retrieve the petrified remains of an elder vampire
first_tasks: find the remains

reward.description: Bloodstone Chalice's salutary effects will be prolonged

items.name: Bloodstone Chalice
items.description: a chalice that is able to increase the potency of the player's vampiric powers

tools: NONE
description:
I've been performing a little research on the Bloodstone Chalice. I believe we can prolong its salutary effects if we infuse it with potent vampiric blood.
I've located the petrified remains of an elder vampire in Cold Rock Pass. Bring them to me, and I should be able to extend the effects granted by the Bloodstone Chalice.

name: Homecoming
objective: help Serana back to Castle Volkihar
first_tasks: find a boat that takes you and Serana to Castle Volkihar

reward.description: Serana tells the player the whole story

locations.name: Castle Volkihar
locations.description: Serana's family's home, on an island to the west of Solitude

tools: the player asked Serana why she was sealed inside a tomb
Serana and her father don't get along
description:
That's... complicated. And I'm not totally sure if I can trust you. But if you want to know the whole story, help me get back to my family's home.
My family used to live on an island to the west of Solitude. Not the most welcoming place, but depending on whose around, I'll be safe there. My father and I don't really get along. Ugh, saying it out loud makes it sound so... common. "Little girl who doesn't get along with her father." Read that story a hundred times.
Hopefully we can find a boat to take us to my family's home.

name: Bloodline
objective: become a vampire, or be banished from Castle Volkihar
first_tasks: decide whether you want to become a vampire or remain mortal

reward.description: the player becomes a vampire, or Harkon spares the player's mortal life this time

tools: the player is meeting Harkon for the first time: Harkon and his family are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim
the player returned Harkon's daughter and her Elder Scroll to him
description:
I am Harkon, lord of this court. By now, my daughter will have told you what we are. We are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim.
You have done me a great service, and now you must be rewarded. There is but one gift I can give that is equal in value to the Elder Scroll and my daughter.
I offer you my blood. Take it, and you will walk as a lion among sheep. Men will tremble at your approach, and you will never fear death again.
However, if you refuse my gift you will be prey, like all mortals. I will spare your life this once, but you will be banished from this hall.
I await your decision.
